story:
The Tiger & the Protected - Short Film

Logline: A Single, determined mother places tremendous pressure on her phenom star son to excel in his high school basketball program. 

 

The film develops around a resourceful mother who puts massive expectations on her talented but despondent son who wants to forge his own path. It's a story of a protective mother learning to allow her son to grow responsibly and a gifted player searching to become a decisive young adult. This film engages both a single mother and teenage son's perspectives to invite audiences to understand their underlying motivations and family love for each other.

Characters:

Janet Bell (30's) is a driven parent who wants to see her son excel in his high school basketball program. She attempts to shield her son from their tumultuous neighborhood and pushes for his success at an elite basketball camp.

Darius Bell (18) is the quiet basketball sensation who plays to please his demanding mother. He is conflicted about whether his love of the game is genuine or if he plays for acceptance. 

At an elite basketball camp, Darius gets teased by a less talented player. He badly beats up this mouthy player. Has Darius thrown away a valuable opportunity? Will Janet come to terms with Darius’ decision or continue her high expectations? 

A story of actions and consequences from this dynamic and emotional coming of age sports drama. 

INSPIRATION:

The short film/script is adapted from an award winning feature length script. The script has won numerous awards including Nicholls, Final Draft, and Austin Film Festival and was selected as a Grand Prize winner at the 2017 Seattle International Film Festival’s, Catalyst Screenplay Competition.

Shore Scripts Competition - Quarterfinalist
Table Read My Screenplay Park City (ISA) - Semifinalist
Academy Nicholl - Quarterfinalist
Austin Film Festival Screenplay Competition - Second Rounder
Final Draft Big Break Screenwriting Competition - Quarterfinalist

 

We believe this well-crafted story shows another side to the Single Mothers across the country who work tirelessly and do not get recognition. This is one of those unique stories that need to be heard. We want to create something special that will continue the conversation of what it means to be a strong parent in this day and age. Our hope is that this film will change, challenge, and bridge sports dramas moving forward.

 

   WE ARE CURRENTLY RAISING MONEY TO COMPLETE POST-PRODUCTION ON THE FILM!

This includes, paying editor, post sound, music score, original title track song, ADR, Colorist, Sound Mix, Foley, deliverables, visual effects, marketing, festival submission fees, and Public Relations. 

WE PLAN TO ENTER TOP FESTIVALS, & USE AS PROOF OF CONCEPT FOR THE FEATURE FILM!!!

The TEAM:

 

ACTRESS: Novi Brown

Novi Brown is the mega-talented actress, known for Tyler Perry's TV Series, Sistas (2019) She is one of the most famous social media influencers in America and runs an Instagram page under the name @iamnovibrown with over 52.6K followers online

DIRECTOR: B. Monét

B. Monét is a writer/director who graduated from Spelman College with a B.A. in English. She hails from Silver Spring, Maryland and holds an MFA from New York University in Film and Television with a concentration in writing and directing. 

Her award-winning short film Q.U.E.E.N. has screened at over a dozen festivals including Cannes Short Film Corner and premiered on Magic Johnson's channel ASPiRE. She was also named the 2017 Horizon Award Winner through Cassian Elwes, Christine Vachon and Lynette Howell - Taylor at the Sundance Film Festival. She’s been fortunate to work with Reese Witherspoon, Janet Jackson, Rosario Dawson, Chika, Rapsody and Shangela for brands like Crate and Barrel, Estee Lauder, Uber, OkayAfrica, OkayPlayer, and Hyundai.

Last year she made history by becoming the first black woman to direct a Cadillac commercial. She was selected as one of the filmmakers in the New York Stage and Film Filmmakers' Workshop at Vassar College for her Q.U.E.E.N. film in July 2019. Additionally, B. Monét was selected as one of the participants in the Artist Academy with the New York Film Festival and Lincoln Center. Most recently, B. Monét was selected as one of the winners for the Queen Collective in partnership with Queen Latifah, Tribeca and P&G. Her short film Ballet After Dark was exclusively streaming on Hulu and now BET.

Producer: Lisa Cole

                                  A global nomad, who’s lived with 201 families in 12 countries, Lisa Cole shares true stories inspired by incredible underrepresented humans. She co-wrote, GIRL NAMED SUE (Shailene Woodley starring; Laura Bickford, Jean-Marc Vallee & Nathan Ross producing) and QUEEN OF NEWBURGH - Trinidad director Maya Cozier attached. Lisa recently delivered a screenplay for Flora Films, an adaptation of the 2017 WaPo article about Kay Jewelry and the ongoing sexual harassment & pay discrimination suit of 69k women. A Student Academy Awards Regional Finalist, WIF mentee & Stowe Story Labs Final Draft Fellow, Lisa’s short film SHIPWRECK is currently screening in 20+ festivals worldwide. Director of award-winning documentaries for The Gates Foundation, Sundance, Viacom & A&E, Lisa is a Board member of the Hot Springs Documentary Film Festival, and resides in Los Angeles with her documentarian husband, Mark Monroe, and two children.

Producer: JoAnne Gordon-Burton

                                       JoAnne Gordon-Burton is a seasoned Executive Assistant with close to 15 years in the field. She currently works in Academic Affairs and assists four Academic Associate Vice Presidents. In addition, she chairs the Committee for Institutional Diversity & Equity. She worked as the first African-American mayor’s confidential secretary for the City of Port Jervis. JoAnne was honored to be selected to represent her hometown in that position. Prior, she worked as a store manager for a nationwide pharmacy for five years. An army veteran and alum of SUNY Orange.

JoAnne holds a BS in Organizational Management from Nyack College and A.A.S in Business Management from SUNY Orange.

Outside of her work at the college, she has engaged in community activities to include former girl scout leader and neighborhood watch organizer, and the treasurer for an HOA. She also has an entrepreneurial spirit and works to actively seek change; always searching for continuous improvement. Currently, the head executive assistant to startup – Midnight Magic Media.

Actor: Glenn Fleary

Glenn Fleary is an actor, known for Younger (2015), FBI (2018) and Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (1999)

Actor: Kassime Fofane

Kassime Fofana is a rising talented New York based actor.  He has recently performed Spilled Milk at the 2020 Hudson Guild New York Winter Theatre Festival,  which has been nominated as a finalist for Best Play. 

Writer/Producer: Jay Gordon

                                                                Jay received a Bachelor's & Master's degree in UCLA's Film MFA Screenwriting program. Jay's writing was awarded the Jack Nicholson Screenwriting prize from UCLA's Film and Television Program.

Jay writes dramatic works that deal with coming of age sports dramas and sports-centric stories. His sports drama scripts have been recognized and won awards in various competitions. Jay is a member of the Writers Guild and heads the media company upstart, Midnight Magic.

With your donations and support, you can help our team bring this powerful story to life!!!

   

                                                        WE HAVE STRETCH GOALS!

                               HELP US SURPASS our $15K goal! MORE MONEY allows us to:

 Complete ADR Sessions, Create Original Score & Music, Payback Production Costs, and costs to effectively market film.

Other Ways You Can Help

- Spread the word about the project, tell your friends, family and loved ones.

- Use the Indiegogo share tools to help me promote!

- I thank you all for supporting and giving to this film project!

We had a great time filming this project, please help us continue this journey so we can share the efforts of our creativity with film-going audiences.

story:
Coming to terms of her younger sister, Maya’s terminal cancer has always been difficult for Serena Gonzalez. She struggles with her own mental health issues and relies on her bond with Maya to help through those struggles. The sisters share a bond like no other which makes it difficult for Serena to accept Maya’s fate.

Written and Produced by Anna Carina Scalzi, So Long and Good Night, explores the sisterly bond that Serena and Maya Gonzalez have as Serena tries to come to terms with Maya’s terminal cancer.

 

So Long and Good Night is a film that conveys a young Cuban American woman, Serena Gonzalez’s fight with her own mental illness while trying to come to terms with her younger sister, Maya Gonzalez’s, terminal cancer.

This story is very personal to me because similar to the sister’s relationship’s my sister and I are extremely close, and we share a bond like no other. Like our protagonist, I too have mental illness and I want to share light on how discussing having anxiety and functioning depression should be discussed more in media and even amongst friends and your community.

 In my experiences whenever my mental health issues are brought to light, I’m quickly looked at differently or stigmatized whenever I’m facing personal issues and that shouldn’t be the case. People who have mental illness should feel open and free when discussing their mental health illness and my hope with my thesis is to have more open conversations about people’s mental health.

I have a multicultural background of Italian descent (from my father’s side) and Cuban descent (from my mother’s side). This film heavily focuses on my Cuban roots, mostly due to my abuelita, Hipolita ‘Pola’ Gonzalez always being a constant in my life. She was living with my parents since I was in middle school and was always getting herself into the good kind of trouble. She was fierce, loved, extremely independent and a kick ass Latina. Sadly, she passed last year and now my thesis film will be dedicated to her.

 

Let's Meet Our Team!

Anna Carina Scalzi (Writer, Producer, & Editor) is a multicultural writer, producer, and editor of Cuban and Italian descent. Scalzi is currently pursuing her MFA in Film and TV in Atlanta, at the Savannah College of Art & Design. While she loves to learn the different aspects and departments in Film and TV, her passion is video editing. Anna has developed, scripted, supervised, and taken on different crew positions on diverse projects ranging from documentary, music video, branded films, and narratives. She has a great eye for detail, and continuity.

She received her bachelor’s degree in Art and Science from the University of North Florida in Communications with is a concentration in Electronic Media. Anna has developed, script supervised, and taken on different crew positions, on different projects ranging from documentary, music video, branded films, and narratives.

 

Mya-Breyana Morton (Director) is Cinematographer,  Producer, and Director based in Atlanta, Ga. She spent the majority of her childhood in Kuwait attending the American School of Kuwait where she traveled the Middle East playing softball for Kuwait’s National Softball Team. She holds an M.F.A. in Film & Television Production from Savannah College of Art and Design and a B.I.S. in Sports Administration from Georgia State University.

At age 19 she was the youngest student to graduate from Georgia State's Sports Administration program and at age 22, one of the youngest to graduate from SCAD's Film & Television Master's program. She was recently the cinematographer and co-producer for a short horror film entitled, "Auntie", which is currently streaming on social media platforms. "Auntie" was a viral hit and has since gained over 800,000 views. Her main goal within her career is to travel the world making films that resonate with people in new and exciting ways. Her approach in doing so is by educating herself on the craft of filmmaking and storytelling and simple trial and error.

 

Marcus Kyle (Directory of Photography) is s a diverse film maker focused on cinematography with a passion for directing/writer. Raised in Dallas TX, Bachelor’s in Marketing from Morehouse College, pursing MFA from Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD).  He currently mainly operates on indie shorts and commercials in the ATL area. He’s shot a number of shorts for local film makers and boasts a deepening collection of directorial endeavors himself. 

 

Erik Francisco Medina (Casting Director) is a writer, filmmaker, and development producer from Canóvanas, Puerto Rico. He brings a much-needed new perspective to his work, creating thought-provoking works that explore the experiences of young people of color in modern America. Erik is not beholden to a single medium, incorporating everything from music and cuisine to politics to bring his visions to life. Erik holds an MFA in Film and Television from Savanna College of Art and Design, and a BA in Mass Communications from Universidad del Turabo. He currently splits his time between Atlanta, Puerto Rico and Los Angeles, where he continues to use his creativity to start important conversations and propel society forward.

 

Ekaterina Soyuznova (Illustrator) is an internationally renowned Illustrator from Moscow, RU. She is known for traveling and enhancing her professionalism by living in different countries. Currently, she is based in Los Angeles.

Her professional skills include storyboarding, character design, and Background painting. She had significantly contributed to Numerous award-winning film projects.   And currently working on one of her personal projects webtoon comics " Monster pet" while creating appealing designs for various announced animated short films.

 

So Long & Good Night is a dramatic, origin story about Cuban American, Serena Gonzalez dealing with her own mental health issues while trying to come to terms with her younger sister, Maya’s terminal cancer.

This film explores Serena and Maya’s sisterly bonds, and the lengths Serena will go to help Maya. I’m looking at raising a flexible goal of $10,000 for my thesis film. Your support and donation will help pay for:

Locations and Permits

Equipment Rentals

VFX

Stunt Coordination

Wardrobe

Props

Cast and Crew gifts

Food for Cast and Crew

Post-Production

Festival Submissions

EVERY SINGLE DONATION COUNTS, so please show your support in any way that you can! You will be receiving the tier perks that you donate to and their respective perks above. 

 

With you help and donations my hope is for this project to shed light and support and normalize more discussions and people dealing with different mental health issues.

With the hope of the success of this film, Serena will embark and in a coming-of-age story with her magical, superhero, origin story. The hope is to continue Serena’s story in the future and have her embrace becoming the first Cuban American Female Lead who will develop magical powers and watch her as she tries to become a hero in her own right.

 

A big challenge for this film will be Stunt Coordination, due a fight scene that happens between Serena and a Man. Safety is my number one priority and having the proper Stunt Coordinator and a Set Medic is really important.

Another challenge is VFX because there will be magical components that affect Serena and a VFX Supervisor will need to be on set to make sure the effects will be useable in post-production.

Having Stunts and VFXs in a short film is something that I incorporated in my script because I wanted to challenge myself in Principal Photography (filming my thesis) and in Post Production.

 

Here’s another way you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! Send it to all your friends and family!
  • Please use your social media outlets and share, share, share!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

story:
[ENG] Denise knits with her nervous hands; a ball of yarn unravels, taking the shape of... a noose! The story center around Denise Schechter, a quick witted and cynical 78 year-old American Jewish woman who routinely tries to put an end to her own life in hopes to reunite with her beloved late husband, Greg. After almost losing her young grandson, Jake, Denise has an epiphany: she must continue living to fulfill her new purpose in life, watching Jake grow up. Something Grandpa Greggy never got to see.

This story blends genres of comedy, romance, and drama to deliver a heartwarming and tangible message that it's never too late to make a change, both for yourself and your family.

[ITA] Denise lavora a maglia nervosamente; un gomitolo si dipana, assumendo la forma di... un cappio! Denise Schechter, una donna ebrea americana di 78 anni, intelligente e cinica, cerca abitualmente di porre fine alla propria vita sperando di riunirsi con il suo amato defunto marito, Greg. Dopo aver quasi perso il suo giovane nipote, Jake, Denise si rende conto che il suo nuovo scopo nella vita è continuare a vivere per essere vederlo crescere, cosa che il nonno Greggy non potrà mai vedere

Questa storia fonde i generi di commedia, romanticismo e dramma per trasmettere un messaggio commovente e tangibile che non è mai troppo tardi per fare un cambiamento, sia per te che per la tua famiglia.

[ENG] By contributing to the campaign, you're helping the vision of young filmmakers come to life. This script's budget is a reflection of how seriously we take this project, and how important it is to make a film that not only brings our vision to life, but is created with the utmost professionalism. 

We're making this film completely independently, and in order to do our story justice we've budgeted so that our casting, locations, production design, cinematography, sound, and editing are given the love and care they deserve. We want to pay our cast and crew fair wages for the important work they do, and create a film that reflects all of our creativity as filmmakers. 

This budget is both a reflection of our creative ambition and the scope of our project. We're not taking any shortcuts as a production, and that requires paperwork, insurance, and a lot of time! Our plan is to apply to festivals and opportunities like TIFF, Tribeca, HBO Shorts, Cannes, and Sundance, so executing this project at the highest caliber is a necessity!

[ITA] Con il tuo contributo, stai aiutando la visione dei giovani filmmakers a prendere vita. Il budget di questa sceneggiatura riflette quanto stiamo prendendo seriamente questo progetto e quanto sia importante realizzare un film che non solo dia vita alla nostra visione, ma sia creato con la massima professionalità.

Stiamo realizzando questo film in modo completamente indipendente e, per rendere giustizia alla nostra storia, abbiamo stanziato un budget in modo che il nostro casting, le location, la scenografia, la fotografia, il suono e il montaggio ricevano l'amore e la cura che meritano. Vogliamo pagare un salario equo al nostro cast per il lavoro che svolgono sul nostro progetto e creare un film che rifletta tutta la nostra creatività come filmmakers indipendenti in Hollywood.

Questo budget riflette sia la nostra ambizione creativa che la portata del nostro progetto. Non stiamo prendendo scorciatoie come produzione e ciò richiede scartoffie, assicurazione e molto tempo! Abbiamo in programma di candidarci a festival e opportunità come TIFF, Tribeca, HBO Shorts, Cannes e Sundance, quindi realizzare questo progetto al massimo livello è una necessità!

[ENG] That's a great question! Thanks for asking! 

Mental health is a huge part of this project. After a year of social distancing and loneliness, the symptoms of anxiety disorder and depressive disorder increased considerably (according to CDC.gov). Talking about mental health is extremely important to break the stigma around this topic, especially nowadays. Some of us might avoid talking about mental health problems if we’re worried about facing discrimination from society. Keeping discussions going about mental health likely makes us feel comfortable enough to recognize when we need help - our goal is to make people feel comfortable to discuss about this topic and to ask for help.

Our team met online during our endless zoom classes. We saw first hand our classmates, professors, family, and friends struggling (and we felt in that way too) - the only tool we had to help them was to talk over a computer or a phone. The amazing side of this tragic experience is that it created an incredible bound between us, and now we're excited to work on the first project together! The deep understanding of this topic in addition to the respect and love that we have for each other's are the perfect combination for a successful short film.

[ITA] Questa è un'ottima domanda! Grazie per averlo chiesto!

La salute mentale è una parte importante di questo progetto. Dopo un anno di distanziamento sociale e solitudine, ansia e depressione sono aumentati considerevolmente (secondo CDC.gov). Parlare di salute mentale è estremamente importante per rompere lo stigma intorno a questo argomento, soprattutto oggi. Molte persone evitano di parlare di problemi di salute mentale per paura di dover affrontare discriminazioni dalla società. Mantenere le discussioni sulla salute mentale farà sentire a loro agio queste persone così che possano riconoscere quando hanno bisogno di aiuto: questo è il nostro obiettivo.

Il nostro team si è incontrato online durante le nostre infinite lezioni su zoom. Abbiamo visto in prima persona (e provato sulla nostra pelle) le difficoltà dei nostri compagni di classe, professori, familiari e amici e l'unico strumento che avevamo per aiutarli era parlare al computer o al telefono. Il lato incredibile di questa tragica esperienza è che ha creato un legame incredibile tra di noi, e ora siamo entusiasti di lavorare nel nostro primo progetto insieme! La profonda comprensione di questo argomento, oltre al rispetto e all'amore che abbiamo gli uni per gli altri, sono la combinazione perfetta per un cortometraggio di successo.

[ENG] Cissy Wellman has starred in several films and TV shows over the course of her long career. Wellman's father was the author of the first Academy Award Best Motion Picture Film Wings (1927) and A Star is Born (1937).

She's thrilled to play the part of Denise and looks forward to creating a well-rounded character who may seem stiff at first, but is later discovered to have genuine love in her heart. 

[ITA] Cissy Wellman ha recitato in diversi film e programmi TV nel corso della sua lunga carriera. È la figlia del leggendario regista William A. Wellman, autore del primo Oscar come miglior film cinematografico Wings (1927) e A Star is Born (1937).

È entusiasta di interpretare la parte di Denise e non vede l'ora di creare un personaggio a tutto tondo che all'inizio può sembrare rigido, ma in seguito si scopre che ha un amore genuino nel suo cuore.

[ENG] We're a passionate team of filmmakers from USC's School of Cinematic Arts who need your help to make our vision come to life! We've spent the last year and a half of the pandemic eager to make films that push the boundaries of the medium, and we're using this film as an opportunity to make something truly special. Every member of our team has invested their time and energy into this project without pay, solely because they believe in this story.

Discover the personal stories of our amazing team on our social media pages!

[ITA] Siamo un team appassionato di filmmakers di Produzione Cinematografica a USC, ed abbiamo  bisogno del tuo aiuto per dare vita alla nostra visione! Abbiamo trascorso l'ultimo anno e mezzo della pandemia desiderosi di realizzare film che esca dagli schemi, e stiamo usando questo film come un'opportunità per realizzare qualcosa di veramente speciale. Ogni membro del nostro team ha investito il proprio tempo e le proprie energie in questo progetto senza retribuzione, unicamente perché crede in questa storia.

Scopri le biografie delle persone nel nostro team sui nostri social media!

 

[ENG] Cinematography is one of the most important aspects of our film, and developing the visual scope of the film is one of our biggest hurdles when it comes to our budget. We're planning to film a sequence underwater, which requires insurance for our rented camera equipment, actors, and our cinematographer. The underwater sequence alone will be one of our biggest challenges as a production, but the scene is integral to the story and we're committed to executing it safely and effectively. 

[ITA] La cinematografia è uno degli aspetti più importanti del nostro film e lo sviluppo della portata visiva del film è uno dei nostri maggiori ostacoli quando si tratta del nostro budget. Abbiamo in programma di filmare una sequenza sott'acqua, che richiede un'assicurazione per la nostra attrezzatura per la macchina da presa noleggiata, gli attori e il nostro direttore della fotografia. La sequenza subacquea da sola sarà una delle nostre maggiori sfide come produzione, ma la scena è parte integrante della storia e ci impegniamo a eseguirla in modo sicuro ed efficace.

[ENG] Well, let's say that making a $30,000 movie when we're still trying to pay out student loans is hard as f*ck.  So we need your help to cover these  expenses (or maybe someone at Warner Bros who decides to finance us, both could work):

[ITA] Bene, diciamo che fare un film da $ 30.000 quando stiamo ancora cercando di pagare i finanziamenti scolastici è dura. Quindi abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per coprire queste spese (o magari per trovare qualcuno alla Warner Bros che decida di finanziarci):

 

[ENG] If like me, math isn't your thang, here's an explanation of that colorful pie:

We’re raising funds a 10 pages short script, which we’ll begin shortly after we close our campaign art the end of September. The majority of our budget is going towards equipment, crew, cast, locations, etc. 

We'll use around $22,500 for production, $9,000 of which will cover the Camera Department costs, $6,600 to pay the rent of our location, $4,500 to buy and rent props, costumes and set design to make the movie come to life, $2,400 will go towards our brilliant actors and SAG-AFTRA fees. $4,500 will cover out Covid Costs to ensure we’re keeping our cast and crew safe. Lastly, $3,000 will go towards our post-production, which includes music, sound mixing, color grading, and editing. Funny how a good chunk of cash turns out to be a pretty tight budget once you break it all down, huh? 

Yeah, making a movie is not as cheap as it seems... at least if you want to make it right! And we want to make it perfect to rack up all those awards! 

Awards? Oh yeah, we're already  strategizing on festival run and looking at some awesome platforms to deliver our short film right into your screens! Isn't this cool?

[ITA] Se come me, la matematica non fa per te, ecco una spiegazione di quella torta colorata:

Stiamo raccogliendo fondi per un breve copione di 10 pagine, che inizieremo poco dopo la chiusura della grafica della campagna alla fine di settembre. La maggior parte del nostro budget è destinata a attrezzature, troupe, cast, location e così via.

Useremo circa $ 22.500 per la produzione, $ 9.000 dei quali copriranno i costi del reparto riprese, $ 6.600 per pagare l'affitto della nostra location, $ 4.500 per acquistare e noleggiare oggetti di scena, costumi e scenografia per dare vita al film, $ 2.400 andranno verso i nostri brillanti attori e le commissioni SAG-AFTRA. $ 4.500 copriranno i costi di Covid per garantire la sicurezza del cast e della troupe. Infine, $ 3.000 andranno alla nostra post-produzione, che include musica, mixaggio del suono, correzione del colore e editing. Strano come una buona fetta di denaro si riveli essere un budget piuttosto limitato una volta abbattuto tutto, eh?

Sì, fare un film non è così economico come sembra... almeno se vuoi farlo bene! E vogliamo renderlo perfetto per accumulare tutti quei premi!

Premi? Oh sì, stiamo già elaborando una strategia per il festival e stiamo esaminando alcune piattaforme fantastiche per distribuire il nostro cortometraggio direttamente sui tuoi schermi! Non è fantastico?

 

[ENG] If you can't donate to the production of our film, please share this campaign with your friends and family, and of course, please watch and support the film when it's released! THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT, it means the world to us - it really does ❤️

[ITA] Se non puoi fare una donazione per la produzione del nostro film, condividi questa campagna con i tuoi amici e familiari e, naturalmente, guarda e supporta il film quando uscirà! GRAZIE MILLE DEL TUO SUPPORTO, significa tantissimo per noi
story_txt: [ENG] Denise knits with her nervous hands; a ball of yarn unravels, taking the shape of... a noose! The story center around Denise Schechter, a quick witted and cynical 78 year-old American Jewish woman who routinely tries to put an end to her own life in hopes to reunite with her beloved late husband, Greg. After almost losing her young grandson, Jake, Denise has an epiphany: she must continue living to fulfill her new purpose in life, watching Jake grow up. Something Grandpa Greggy never got to see.This story blends genres of comedy, romance, and drama to deliver a heartwarming and tangible message that it's never too late to make a change, both for yourself and your family.[ITA] Denise lavora a maglia nervosamente; un gomitolo si dipana, assumendo la forma di... un cappio! Dopo aver quasi perso il suo giovane nipote, Jake, Denise si rende conto che il suo nuovo scopo nella vita è continuare a vivere per essere vederlo crescere, cosa che il nonno Greggy non potrà mai vedereQuesta storia fonde i generi di commedia, romanticismo e dramma per trasmettere un messaggio commovente e tangibile che non è mai troppo tardi per fare un cambiamento, sia per te che per la tua famiglia.[ENG] By contributing to the campaign, you're helping the vision of young filmmakers come to life. story:
Hi!

Thanks you so much for stopping in. We are so excited to be making our debut short film: The Coin.  The Coin will be the official b-side story to our up and coming feature length film of The Son.  

The Coin

The Coin is a film about A 17 year old teenager whose world turns upside down from the recent death of her mother. She finds herself trapped, locked within this feeling of being worthless due to her abusive step-father.    She places her hope, value and protection within a rare coin given to her by her mom.  

Inspiration

The script is inspired by God and it was written for those struggling with depression, struggling with self worth and someone that has been in this situation.  Whoever you are, you are beautiful, valuable and worth more than the rarest gemstone that you could find on this earth.  I

Let's face the facts, there are so many that can relate to this message being spoken about.  We are here to create and tell unique stories inspired by scripture but told in a relatable way.  The Coin takes an approach to really dive deep into our protagonist’s back story.  We will be able to get a glimpse of who this character is, and what the feature film will be like.  

A lot of things have lined up perfectly for this new season to happen and we are STOKED to get on with the program here!!!

We wrote "The Son" as a short film for Luke's school and at first it was just a tick in a box to satisfy his grade, but now it has grown much larger heights than we could ever imagine! We are soooo ready for these things to be done, but we know with great patience, hard work, and a whole lotta Jesus anything is possible!! 

We feel this script could impact so many lives in it's 100's of inspirational messages and to further that need for this film, we feel shooting smaller films or "B sides" of the story will help get the word out and get people excited about it. Thats where funding the film "The Coin" would come into play for our feature "The Son" . 

Meet The Cast

What is a good inspiring story without an amazingly talented cast.

Kiley Opsal - Kiley plays the lead role of Rebecca Meyer in our up and coming film.  Kiley is a teen actress with a heart and passion for Acting and she has starred in some major Hollywood productions one being; "Bad Boys For Life."  She is also known for her lead role as Gabriella in the faith based Amazon Prime Video series "The End."  You can learn more about her on her IMDB.

Joe Ray - Joe plays the role of Phillip Meyer.  He is a highly trained and talented actor that has starred in alot of films and tv shows.  Both Kiley and Joe have worked together on set for several films and are absolutely a dream to work with.  Joe started his career in his home town of Maryland and has got many lead acting roles throughout his days.  You can learn more about him on his IMDB.

Kahlid Tapia - Kahlid plays the Role of Asriel and we all call him the next Morgan Freeman.  He has a personality unlike anyone that I met and has a true heart of gold.  He started his acting career in South Korea and made his way up in the acting career vine.  You can learn more about him on his IMDB.

Meet The Team

A great movie cannot be made without a great crew.

Luke Riether - The director and writer - Luke is the author of a few self published books that can be found on Amazon.  He is a creative mastermind that has released several albums both music and spoken word as well as a few films.  Luke started his career as a Portrait and Wedding photographer and is super passionate about creating things that can inspire that one person.  He is never after fame, recognition, or money, he is truly after that one person who needs an inspiring message. He is not only a filmmaker but he is also a youth pastor and such a loving friend to have in your life.  You can learn more about him on his website.

Taylor Riether -  Director of Photography and Editor -  Taylor is another creative genius and absolutely incredible in everything she does.  She started her career as a filmmaker working on TV Sets for companies like TLC.  She later moved into photography while still advancing her knowledge in filmmaking.  Both Taylor and Luke are one unstoppable team that has a passion to reach the youth using the abilities God gave them. You can learn more about her on her website.

Todd Utzig - Second AD - Todd has many years under his belt as a writer and director.  He has been on a few amazing projects already and is now teamed up with both Taylor and Luke to create a lot more inspiring content.  His passion in life is to reach that one person with a message that will transform their heart.  You can learn more about him on his IMDB.

Stephen Ullom - First AD and Producer - Stephen is someone that has a lot of knowledge to share to the world.  He loves every aspect in film making and is an amazing friend to have.  He has worked on set of some inspiring films.   You can learn more about him on his IMDB.

Zhenja Williams - Assistant Director - Zhenja is a graduate of Southeastern University located in Lakeland, Florida.  With her skills, you guys will be in for one treat.  She has a lot of talent working on set and has written, and directed some amazing short films including her most recent one: A bicycle made for two.  We are excited to have both her and her husband on set!

Tyler Williams - Gaffer - Where would a great film be without a solid Gaffer.  Tyler has spent years investing in great equipment to offer both his lighting expertise and overall talent to the table.  He is not only an amazing gaffer but also an amazing DP.  He recently graduated along side of his wife at Southeastern University.  We are stoked to bring both of these two on board.  

The Impact

The world needs good.

It needs inspiration. Too many times today the "good hearted' films are too picture perfect. They don't show the real life struggles, they don't show the vulnerable people, or the hurting imperfect world.

But we want show the light in the real world darkness. The real.  We all need that. If you feel the same way, let's do this together!

Where your money will go

The main costs for indie film productions revolve around paying cast and crew, food, expenses, props, and others. We have put together a budget that best fits our production level and have calculated the rates of each working person along with the cost of specific things including locations, travel, gear and additional unexpected expenses.

Here is a rough budget of what we are looking to spend:

$900-$1100 for a 8-9 person crew

$750 for a 3 person cast

$100-200 for catering

$150. Props + Set Design

$500-800 Post Production

$200-300 Location

$500-800 Marketing

$3100-$3500+

Your money isn't just going to get eaten up and spit out though. We want you to feel like your investment was worth it. Each "perk" involves and special thank you on the final film and they get more and more exciting the more you give.  We are working hard behind the scenes because we truly want to release a film that will touch that one life who needs this message the most.  With that we are excited to release our film's official line of merchandise.  You can check out many cool designs on our production website at www.filmtheson.com.   

We understand that times are hard these days. If you are unable to contribute monetarily, there are some other ways you can still help bring our film to life:

  • Give us a shout online! Share our Indiegogo link with friends, family and followers.
  • If you’re in the Central Florida area and you know anyone that could help us out with anything, send us a message!

The Road Ahead

What is the future of this short film?

The main idea in mind for this short film is for marketing purposes for the larger 1.5 million dollar film. We know Rome wasn't built in a day, and if everyone with a good movie idea got funded without marketing, we would all do it. That's why this short film is so important because this film is just the start of many more beautiful things coming. 

Marketing is the literal heartbeat of every successful movie and we feel we are on the right track toward a solid foundation of a feature length film by exploring character development within the shorts. 

What is the next step to produce "The Son"?

Just like The Coin, we need coins to fund our bigger ventures. Small but mighty steps have been made in the right direction for production of the larger film. We are currently projecting production to begin in February of 2022. Pre-production is in process including revising the script, paperwork, planning, location scouting and more.
story_txt:
Hi!
Thanks you so much for stopping in. We are so excited to be making our debut short film: The Coin.  The Coin will be the official b-side story to our up and coming feature length film of The Son.  
The Coin
The Coin is a film about A 17 year old teenager whose world turns upside down from the recent death of her mother. She finds herself trapped, locked within this feeling of being worthless due to her abusive step-father.    She places her hope, value and protection within a rare coin given to her by her mom.  
Inspiration
The script is inspired by God and it was written for those struggling with depression, struggling with self worth and someone that has been in this situation.  Whoever you are, you are beautiful, valuable and worth more than the rarest gemstone that you could find on this earth.  I
Let's face the facts, there are so many that can relate to this message being spoken about.  We are here to create and tell unique stories inspired by scripture but told in a relatable way.  The Coin takes an approach to really dive deep into our protagonist’s back story.  We will be able to get a glimpse of who this character is, and what the feature film will be like.  
A lot of things have lined up perfectly for this new season to happen and we are STOKED to get on with the program here!!!
We wrote "The Son" as a short film for Luke's school and at first it was just a tick in a box to satisfy his grade, but now it has grown much larger heights than we could ever imagine! We are soooo ready for these things to be done, but we know with great patience, hard work, and a whole lotta Jesus anything is possible!! 
We feel this script could impact so many lives in it's 100's of inspirational messages and to further that need for this film, we feel shooting smaller films or "B sides" of the story will help get the word out and get people excited about it. Thats where funding the film "The Coin" would come into play for our feature "The Son" . 
Meet The Cast
What is a good inspiring story without an amazingly talented cast.
Kiley Opsal - Kiley plays the lead role of Rebecca Meyer in our up and coming film.  Kiley is a teen actress with a heart and passion for Acting and she has starred in some major Hollywood productions one being; "Bad Boys For Life."  She is also known for her lead role as Gabriella in the faith based Amazon Prime Video series "The End."  You can learn more about her on her IMDB.
Joe Ray - Joe plays the role of Phillip Meyer.  He is a highly trained and talented actor that has starred in alot of films and tv shows.  Both Kiley and Joe have worked together on set for several films and are absolutely a dream to work with.  Joe started his career in his home town of Maryland and has got many lead acting roles throughout his days.  You can learn more about him on his IMDB.
Kahlid Tapia - Kahlid plays the Role of Asriel and we all call him the next Morgan Freeman.  He has a personality unlike anyone that I met and has a true heart of gold.  He started his acting career in South Korea and made his way up in the acting career vine.  You can learn more about him on his IMDB.
Meet The Team
A great movie cannot be made without a great crew.
Luke Riether - The director and writer - Luke is the author of a few self published books that can be found on Amazon.  He is a creative mastermind that has released several albums both music and spoken word as well as a few films.  Luke started his career as a Portrait and Wedding photographer and is super passionate about creating things that can inspire that one person.  He is never after fame, recognition, or money, he is truly after that one person who needs an inspiring message. He is not only a filmmaker but he is also a youth pastor and such a loving friend to have in your life.  You can learn more about him on his website.
Taylor Riether -  Director of Photography and Editor -  Taylor is another creative genius and absolutely incredible in everything she does.  She started her career as a filmmaker working on TV Sets for companies like TLC.  She later moved into photography while still advancing her knowledge in filmmaking.  Both Taylor and Luke are one unstoppable team that has a passion to reach the youth using the abilities God gave them. You can learn more about her on her website.
Todd Utzig - Second AD - Todd has many years under his belt as a writer and director.  He has been on a few amazing projects already and is now teamed up with both Taylor and Luke to create a lot more inspiring content.  His passion in life is to reach that one person with a message that will transform their heart.  You can learn more about him on his IMDB.
Stephen Ullom - First AD and Producer - Stephen is someone that has a lot of knowledge to share to the world.  He loves every aspect in film making and is an amazing friend to have.  He has worked on set of some inspiring films.   You can learn more about him on his IMDB.
Zhenja Williams - Assistant Director - Zhenja is a graduate of Southeastern University located in Lakeland, Florida.  With her skills, you guys will be in for one treat.  She has a lot of talent working on set and has written, and directed some amazing short films including her most recent one: A bicycle made for two.  We are excited to have both her and her husband on set!
Tyler Williams - Gaffer - Where would a great film be without a solid Gaffer.  Tyler has spent years investing in great equipment to offer both his lighting expertise and overall talent to the table.  He is not only an amazing gaffer but also an amazing DP.  He recently graduated along side of his wife at Southeastern University.  We are stoked to bring both of these two on board.  

The Impact
The world needs good.
It needs inspiration. Too many times today the "good hearted' films are too picture perfect. They don't show the real life struggles, they don't show the vulnerable people, or the hurting imperfect world.
But we want show the light in the real world darkness. The real.  We all need that. If you feel the same way, let's do this together!

Here is a rough budget of what we are looking to spend:
$900-$1100 for a 8-9 person crew
$750 for a 3 person cast
$100-200 for catering
$150. Props + Set Design
$500-800 Post Production
$200-300 Location
$500-800 Marketing
$3100-$3500+
Your money isn't just going to get eaten up and spit out though. We want you to feel like your investment was worth it. Each "perk" involves and special thank you on the final film and they get more and more exciting the more you give.  We are working hard behind the scenes because we truly want to release a film that will touch that one life who needs this message the most.  With that we are excited to release our film's official line of merchandise.  You can check out many cool designs on our production website at www.filmtheson.com.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, we are Jak Ivings and Amina Williams and we are two film-making students from Bristol, who want to create a not-for-profit film that doesn't look studenty. We also really want to pay creatives respect for working on our film, hence we need your help to make that possible.

Our passion lies in dark story telling, which we think deserves more exposure than it gets. For example, this particular film includes quite a bit of violence, surrounding an abusive father and husband.

This is a behind the scenes photo on day 2 of the prototype. Jak is on the far right.

Jak is a sound connoisseur. He particularly loves foley [sound effects], so he is one to pay close attention to it on set and particularly in post-production. Jak has always loved psychological and horror films from a young age and is excited to make his own of a similar genre, this one technically being a psychological thriller.

Amina loves to dive into a bit of everything from camera operating to producing. She started off acting in a few short films and knows how to communicate with actors, as she has often times been on the same end of the production. Her acting debut in Window, a production of CineUltra, has won multiple awards at several online festivals.

What We Need & What You Get

  1. First and foremost, your contribution will go towards paying our actors their national living/minumum wage they would earn on a day job of 8 hours + their travel expenses. This is one of the key reasons we have launched this campaign, as we believe paying our actors is the best way to show respect for their time.
  2. Travel expenses for our crew (no matter how small).
  3. Snacks and food supplies for catering.

We hope to crowdfund £1,500 to make sure we can cover everything we have planned to cover and anything that comes up as an emergency (if something on set breaks etc.). Even if we do not reach our goal, the funds collected will still primarily go to our actors.

As it is the standard for perks, we would like to offer a special thanks in the credits or with a handwritten letter, invite you to our screening of the film or last but not least, provide you with a digital copy of the film. We, ofcourse, can never repay you for your generous donations however, you'll be the reason why the film even goes into production!

The Impact

  • We have made a prototype (which you can find above to watch with two separate scenes) but are determined to make a full version of the script. This will boost our confidence and launch us from the realm of STUDENT to PROFESSIONAL film-making.
  • This film is for all the dark cinema lovers out there, who love a few chills running down their spine when truly immersed in something engaging and powerful.
  • We are aware that it takes a bold move to explore dark themes as young and upcoming filmmakers but we trust ourselves to break the stereotype and hope we can gain that trust in our backers too!

Challenges

Our biggest challenge really, is being professional. For us, this means being respectful towards our actors and paying any travel expenses for crew that have to travel a distance. It is the biggest project we have worked on so far and we'd like to run it as smoothly as possible.

We've been very patient with waiting for the right moment to restart filming as several obstacles, including lock downs, have obstructed along the way. After everything that has taken place, we are still determined to make a great film.

We believe that the key to film-making is to keep prototyping, refurbishing, re-making. However, the challenge is almost always to not give up on a project and deliver a finished product no matter the length and energy it takes.

Ways You Can Help: SHARE!!

Please SHARE this campaign around using specifically the Indiegogo sharing buttons! It will mean the world to us and help boost this campaign's visibility! Follow us on our official Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/iamfshort to stay updated on all our progress!

 

Thank you all so much,

 

The I Am My Father Team. ~

story:
Thank you everyone! We are almost funded!

If you still want to help this film, please follow the link - 

https://gofund.me/a219671e

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

'Transgressing' is a story of a hardworking insecure girl from a family fallen into poverty. She is forced to make irreversible sacrifice to save her family, and her dreams of continuing education.

‘Transgressing’ is an important film that highlights certain issues in modern society. This story explores complex themes of morality, poverty, sacrifice, and abuse with a focus on feminism. I believe that ‘Transgressing’ will resonate with audiences and provide topic for discussion and reflection long after the film’s release.

I’m the writer and producer of short film ‘Transgressing’. While researching stories of young people from working class families for this film, I was reminded of my favourite Russian novel ‘Crime and Punishment’ by Dostoevsky. I was surprised that what he was writing about in the 19th Century Russia was happening in modern-day Britain. I am so passionate about telling the story of Sonia; a young girl that has become a Dostoevsky character so relevant to the modern world.

I am thankful to have the support of Dostoevsky’s descendants, Lancaster University, and award-winning actor and singer Jonathan Jackson and I ask you to join them. Without your generous contributions support this film is unlikely to be made.

Currently we are in pre-production - we are running casting, redrafting the script, working on costumes and production design. These amazing cast and crew members are already working on pre-production online.

You can read more about those talented people on our website.

Our team are all really passionate about this project. Many of them are working for just the minimum expenses. Our cast and crew believes this is a film that needs to be made.

We understand that it is a difficult time for everyone, and for many, money has been a little tighter over the past year. However, I can assure you that any contribution, whether it is £1 or £1000, will make a difference.

You probably have some questions. What if we don’t reach our goal? How will we keep the cast and crew COVID-19 safe on set? You can find the answers to many questions in our FAQ. If you have more questions, do not hesitate to contact us.

While making films is so exciting, it can also be a little hectic at times and things don’t always go according to plan. Solving problems that arise, however, is just a part of filmmaking. Our biggest priorities are of course, keeping all members of the cast and crew safe, and creating the best film we’ve made so far. With your help, we can make that possible.

If you do want to be part of our team, but you can’t make a donation at this time, don’t worry! We have plenty of other ways you can show your support for ‘Transgressing.’ You can become our Ambassador and appear on our Wall of Love. You can take part in our contests and competitions and win perks without spending a penny. More information on this can be found in our FAQ. Make sure you follow the campaign on Indiegogo, and across our social media so you don’t miss out!

These are amazing people who already supported our project.

We are very grateful for their support, love and belief in us!

story:
Hi movie lover!

 

Help us finish our great new film and you'll be an essential part of BC movie magic.

 

We’re almost finished making Outrunners, a hilariously smart comedy filmed in beautiful BC. Outrunners is a smart comedy about two bickering reality stars, Emily and Todd, who are racing to save Emily’s mom’s life during a future pandemic while chased by deadly snipers + camera drones. We just need 25K to add music, audio, and visual effects!

 

My passion for this movie

I’m the writer/director, Ken Hegan. I’ve been a writer for Rolling Stone and 20 TV shows, written/directed 11 short films, and you can see my brewery sitcom trailer here. I believe you should make the films you want to see...and I really want to see this movie. I’ve directed the story with care and passion, collaborated with pro actors and crew, and filmed in locations so gorgeous, you’ll think we filmed it all over the world.

 

Watch our trailer!

 

Here’s our fun pitch video and website: outrunnersfilm.com

 

The timely plot

During a future pandemic lockdown, a determined young woman, Emily, races to save her mother while dodging snipers and reality show camera drones. Inspired by the cancellation of Big Brother Germany while the castmates were live on air, Outrunners is a pandemic comedy thriller that’s like Game Night meets The Hunger Games. 

 

Important note: our story takes place 18 months after the end of COVID-19. It’s a smart, hopeful, pro-mask, pro-vaccination, pro-comedy film that’s full of heart and love and adventure.

 

How this movie started

I came up with the idea on Week 1 of the COVID-19 pandemic when I was racing to hunker down with my mom in Kamloops. So I started mapping out 40 great adventure scenes.

 

How we made it

Once I banged out the smart and funny script, I surrounded myself with talented actors (you’ll love Amanda McEwan as Emily and Matt Graham as Todd), crew, and cinematographers Andy Brown and Marco Bossow. 

 

Our veteran producer & production designer is Shawn ‘Major’ Major, our Executive Producers are Wendy Hyman of Big Sky Pictures and Corinne Lea the CEO & Boss Babe of The Rio Theatre. Check our full cast and crew list. 

 

Our sponsors and cameos

Outrunners was entirely filmed (safely) during COVID-19. After filming two weeks in Kamloops (thanks Tourism Kamloops!), we filmed our epic ending at this cool marina in North Vancouver.

We shot the reality show games & hot tub scenes on a Delta farm owned by skateboarding legend Kevin Harris (check out his Kombucha Baby beverages).

Our sponsors and product placements include:

  • Aviation Gin
  • Kevin Smith beers brewed in collaboration with his friends at Main Street Brewing
  • William F. White film gear/lights
  • Fritzworks Printing who did all our pandemic warning signs
 

How we’re finishing

We’ve shot 25 days, now we’re completing music and visual effects by September 2021. So close to being done!

 

What we need

We need just $25,000 CAD to finish Outrunners -- a small portion of our entire 150K budget. Your contribution -- and any funds we raise -- will pay for:

  • Music & audio effects from Hatched Productions
  • Visual effects from Ghost VFX

Our assembly/colour correction costs have already been covered (huge thanks to Raw Camera Company for their hard work), so no matter what, we’ll finish the film this September 2021.

 

What you get

Check out our awesome perks and experiences on the right!

 

Your impact

Your contribution means we’ll finish in time to submit to Sundance, Slamdance, and SXSW this fall. Once we’re in major film festivals, we plan to sell the film to a major theatrical distributor and/or streaming network like Netflix or Prime.

 

Thank you for sharing the word!

We’d love it if you make some noise about our film campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends and family about our epic film!

 

We’re so grateful for your help, we’ll make sure you get to participate in the film’s release and celebration. Thank you!

 

Very best wishes,

Ken Hegan

Writer/Director - Outrunners

We’re so grateful for your help, we’ll make sure you get to participate in the film’s release and celebration. Thank you! Very best wishes,
Ken Hegan
Writer/Director - Outrunners

story:
Documenting the Alternate Universe 

Growing up with fanfiction, it feels like you have a secret. You’d read amazing stories (for free!) long into the night, but you had no answer when asked in school what you like to read. There tends to be a shaming of online communities and virtual interaction and in starting conversations about fanfics, we found that the general perception of the community was all wrong.

This documentary aims to widen the understanding of the fanfic community, not only within itself but enlighten non-fanfic readers about the wonderful world that has evolved into a diverse and unique medium.

We’re a film crew that wants to provide an honest look into these communities and encourage the educational and positive properties of the medium. 

With mainstream media now reaching into the world of fanfics, it's important that we provide a platform for the community to represent themselves in their own words, amplified by research and analysis conducted into the world.

 

We aim to interview a range of different voices: 

For those who’ve established a prolific writing career, did fanfiction help them, and how do the two worlds differ?

Insight from those who write/read and their experiences in being the creators that keep these communities alive. As well as the connections they form with one another.

Experts who have studied fanfiction as a whole, and researchers who can provide insights into how the different aspects operate.

Help us clear up the air around fanfiction!

 

Why Crowdfunding? 

The funding will go towards making sure that we can create the most authentic representation of the fanfiction world. We are based in London, so we will need to travel to contact those with a genuine interest in the community and get to know the people behind the screens. 

Your money will also ensure that every hour of labour from animators and composers are appropriately paid for as well as supporting the film crew throughout the shooting days.

We will also need to acquire rights to certain materials that we need to tell the story without any copyright issues.

 

Unique Challenges

COVID-19

Even as England is lifting its restrictions around COVID, we will be sure to take every precaution to ensure that our crew and contributors are safe. 

Copyright and permission

As we delve into fanfiction, we must also delve into the world of legality and copyright as well. Of course, we will always ask for permission to showcase content and pay owners where necessary.

 

Updates

Keep an eye on this campaign as we'll have regular updates with information about our crew, our progress and potentially behind the scenes as well! 

 

Spread the Word!

If you can’t contribute yourself, then engage with this project by spreading the word! Let’s utilise the reach of online communities and social media to make sure we can give an honest and accurate glimpse into this world!

 

The background for our image was designed by Freepick: www.freepik.com

story:
Hello, Bertie here! Welcome to our campaign!

We're hoping to raise the funds for an ambitious short film proof of concept about trauma, toxic masculinity and...theatre?  Let's dig in.

'PLEASE CARE!' centres around Max - a drama teacher who decides to make a spectacle of his suffering by writing and directing a play about a recent tragedy in his life, for his students to perform.

Intercutting between the turgid performance and Max scrambling to keep the show afloat, the film culminates in him having to reckon with this horrendous display and his own deep-seated issues in explosive fashion.

A nihilistic, cautionary exploration of someone losing touch with reality, highlighting how ill equipped so many of us are to deal with our emotions - especially men. Too often does suffering only breed more suffering.

We've assembled quite the team for this project, if I don't say so myself!

Max will be portrayed by the brilliant Hugh Skinner (Fleabag, Les Misérables, American Psycho, Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again). If you're familiar with Hugh, you already know just how dynamic and captivating a performer he is. He's going to absolutely soar in such a troubled, frenzied role.

 

 

On the production side - I've teamed up with Slick Films, who created the Oscar winning short 'The Silent Child' in 2017. So far, it's been an incredibly lovely and collaborative experience working with these folks in the buildup to launching this campaign!

 

 

And if you don't know who I am - I'm Bertie! I'll be directing this film, which I also wrote with my good friend Dean Dobbs.

I've been making films since I was sixteen - creating projects ranging from narrative shorts to music videos to documentaries, showcasing most of it on my YouTube channel. It's my passion, the thing I love doing most in the world.

Dazed once classified me as one of the 'Five New Wes Andersons' - which is absolutely ridiculous, but sounds quite impressive so thought I'd include it. In 2016, I was also part of the Dazed 100, a 'definitive list of creatives shaping youth culture' - again, totally absurd but thanks!

 

 

If we raise the money, I look forward to expanding the team further. From the rest of the cast, to other creative roles in post/pre-production - this is just the start!

This is a concept and a premise that was very much born out of my own struggles with being vulnerable. As someone who’s been documenting aspects my life and the depths of my emotional state for all to see - I sometimes  find myself questioning how healthy that really is. I wanted to explore that, address that. This idea of 'performative suffering' is the bedrock of this project.

Despite a cultural conversation being had, far too many still practice deeply unhealthy coping mechanisms - especially men. Max exemplifies this notion, taken to an absurd, yet worryingly plausible extreme. 

To externalise your pain so rabidly, to feel as though the universe itself has wronged you. Toxic masculinity is a disease producing far too many men, dangerously ill-equipped to deal with their own emotions. He lashes out at the universe because he doesn’t know there’s another way. Why do so many men seek retribution instead of help? 

Feeling free and able to ask for help when the pain gets too much is vital, and at large can ensure we’re more open and sensitive as a culture

Under the guise of being a dark stylised comedy, we’ll be able to avoid creating something preachy, while still confronting these ideas head on.

Despite being written as a complete story in its own right, this film also serves as a backdoor proof of concept for a potential series arc. Here we witness the culmination of Max’s descent, but there’s a great deal more story to be told in the lead up to this fateful night. From seemingly well-adjusted drama teacher to morally dubious, dangerously unhinged bastion of misery. 

The potential series would unravel Max’s emotional journey, as well as the parallel journeys of the characters orbiting around him. A more complex, richer story more broadly about all the which ways we cope.

So there you have it! I hope you'll consider contributing, but regardless of if you do -  thank you so much for your time. I'm excited.

story:
Synopsis:

Johnny, with less than an hour before the top of the show, realizes that his costume has been left at home. He needs to fix this quickly -and secretly- to avoid his high demanding school theater director’s wrath, not to mention his cast members hating him for derailing the performance. As time runs out, he must take increasingly drastic measures and ends up getting help from the person he least expects. 

 

Where the money goes:

We are fortunate to be granted equipment from The University of Texas at Austin, but funds are still needed for actor compensation, feeding everyone on set, ensure the set is COVID-safe with PPE,  insurance premiums for the location, production design, costumes, and transportation. 

COVID safety 

During these unprecedented times, we are extremely lucky to be able to make a film this semester. On set we are following COVID-19 safety guidelines provided by UT while implementing our own to ensure our cast and crew are safe. Making sure the cast and crew have all tested negative before coming to set, socially distancing on set, double masking, have a designated safety supervisor, etc. are all aspects in what will be done to remain safe.

 

Bios:

Writer/Director: Ander Echeverria

Born in Mexico City and raised in Round Rock, TX, Ander Echeverria is a current student at The University of Texas at Austin. 

His latest directing effort was a comedic student film called “Get Over Him” completed at the end of last year. The 2021 Short. Sweet. Film. Fest. recently recognized a project he edited, called “Transmissions”, with an Honorable Mention in Horror. Currently, Ander works with the UT Center for Community Engagement, creating video content to promote the essential work of organizations such as Austin Voices for Education and Youth. 

 

Producer: Nikki Beck

Fourth-year senior at the University of Texas at Austin, Nikki Beck is pursuing her Bachelor’s of Science in Radio-Television-Film.

Nikki had recently co-produced and co-directed another UT thesis film M.I.L.K. which is currently in the beginning stages of post-production. Nikki is also the current Co-Executive Producer of a Texan Student Television show Down To Film. She recently began working as the TSTV Narrative Department Director where she oversees all narrative shows and web series content.

 

Spread the word!

If you can't donate, sharing this page with friends and family is still a great help! Thank you for taking time to view our project!

story:
HOW IT GOT STARTED...

Join our team of BELIEVERS!! We believe creative content is alive and thiriving --- so we need your help. Joseph McGee is the writer, director, and producer of When the Sun Dies. 

The story for the 78 page screenplay, "When the Sun Dies," was based on some dreams I had involving the Sun dying. I expanded on those idea's and in four days took those ideas and developed the back-story, story, and developed the characters for this FEATURE film which will be about 1 hr 35 minutes for a run-time. We are projected to start filming in 2022, as we were intially slated to start in Aug 2021 but had to push back production do to same locations not available at the last minute.  WE ARE BACK!!! We started a campaign last year but did not raise the goal we were seeking. At this time we have (1) associate producer Kelley Daniel, and (1) executive producer. Thanks for reading about our campaign; see below for the PERKS and full details.  We look forward in your partnership - Joe McGee 

Joseph McGee (Above) takes a picture of his script. 

 

Learn more about the SCORPION MC vests used in the movie. 

Plot Summary

In the year 2050; a group of scientists left a capsule in a secret bunker to be found containing information on how to prevent the sun from dying based on technology techniques in the century they lived among. This was code-named, “Project Sun,” and was found in 2091 by former NASA Engineer named Eugene Patterson. Shortly after 2050 an asteroid struck the Earth and eliminated 70% of its population.

It is now controlled by a group of outlaws called, “Scorpions,” who have banished any intelligent work to commence on the planet Earth. Eugene Patterson has been in hiding since 2050 a former NASA engineer in attempt to find a solution to the world’s problem; what happens when the sun dies? In the midst of finding answers; he’s also attempting to find a cure for his dying son Earl who has a rare chromosome disease. Eugene will be put to the ultimate test while confronting the outlaws and making the ultimate decision. Do I save my son or do I save the SUN?

CAST + CREW

Our official website will provide more information about the CAST + CREW at www.SaveTheSunMovie.com 

About Joseph McGee

Joseph McGee is the founder of McGee Productions USA. This was founded in 2017 by Joseph McGee; McGee Productions is a video production company serving New England. We specialize in short/feature films and music videos. Mr. McGee serves as the writer, director, and producer for his company.  I want to thank you for visiting our campaign and appreciate your support in helping our project. 

“Filming is much like an unfinished art project; it’s defined to a degree but always a work in progress. In order to obtain one’s attention — lines need to be drawn by using abstract colors” – Joseph McGee

Where we need the help....

We still need your help with the following items that will incur the most costs. I'll be putting $5,000 of my own money into this project as a producer which is not counted in the GOAL for this campaign. The money I have will be used for vests, food and other production costs incurred during production. 

The areas where we need your help is outlined in detail below.

PROPS

  • Motorcycles are needed, we have many background motorcycles that will be provided, but we need more for the riding scenes.  

SET DESIGN

  • Some locations we are seeking to film at for the NASA scenes, may not be available. If so we may have to build those sets instead for the NASA control room. 
  • Some of the other scenes we will have to build platforms and sand delivered

EXPLOSIONS

  • We have used POST explosions in the past, but will be using real explosions for the end scene when the SCORPIONS raid Eugene's compound. We will be hiring a pyrotechnic for this scene. 

LOCATIONS

  • Some locations will require special insurance and fee's to film at. This will help fund those locations that require a fee. 

EQUIPMENT

  • For this film we will be seeking the highest quality possible for a INDIE-FILM, and will be utilizing higher end equipment. We will rent or pay a DP to film using ARRI or RED equipment and will incur a cost for this.

I've Moved On By Brian Ebin Wolfe

Pour me whiskey for breakfast, with my morning tea
Soon I'll be putting some distance, between these outlaws and me
I've discarded most of my history
I'm beyond fear, I've moved on
Where's that future, once bright as the sun
How can I save the whole world, if I can't save my son
The deeper I go, the farther I see
It's like I'm back at NASA, part of the great mystery
I've discarded most all of my history
I'm beyond fear, I've moved on
I'm beyond fear, I've moved on
credits from Passage, released April 30, 2021
Brian Ebin Parker Wolfe: Vocals, Acoustic & Electric guitars
Bobo Lavorgna: Bass
Peter Mitchell: Keyboards
Harmonies: Rose Wolfe, Bumpy Chimes
Recorded by Michael Arafeh at The Coffeehouse Recording Studio, Middletown CT, Produced by Michael Arafeha

https://bepw.bandcamp.com/track/ive-moved-on-2

Business Contributions

Are you a business? We also are seeking business sponsorship. View this page for more information. Business Sponsorship 

We are also seeking product sponsors particular liquor / beer companies. Email us at jmcgee@mcgeeproduction.us for info on PRODUCT Sponsors.

story:
Short Summary

World weary couple Pete and Susan - like the majority of the modern world - have resigned themselves to a life of bleak monotony. They start to question everything they thought they knew when a mysterious boy appears, drenched with rain, on the doorstep of their London home. He claims to come from a world where there is no suffering, a world that is not 'Fallen'. The more they see, the more they begin to wonder: is it true?

  • We, in Britain, are one of the most cynical nations in the world. It’s a sickness that spreads like a virus. We chronically mistrust our leaders; we assume the worst of one another; we fear the technology that is changing everything we once knew... What would it take to reverse our cynicism?
  • ‘Fallen’ is a story and a message I’ve been desperate to tell for 15 years. The sense has been growing stronger and stronger that now is the perfect time. The film has now been cast with incredible actors who I know will uniquely bring ‘Fallen’ to life.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need £1400 ($2000) to complete the film. This will go towards actor’s fees, travel, accommodation, costume, and other expenses involved in the shoot and post-production. I would LOVE if we could overshoot the goal enough to raise the quality even more, but the important thing is that the film gets made.
  • As perks for this campaign, you can get a personal message of thanks from the Writer / Director or cast member of your choice. If you are feeling very generous you can book a VIP ticket to the screening  (but please bear in mind this will be in Scotland and dependent on you being able to make the date when it is arranged.) One of our actors, Paul, is also a professional photographer and is generously offering a photo session as a perk. All donations will receive a screener of the film so they can watch as soon as it is released.  
  • If we don’t reach our goal we will still make the film. But quality may be reduced and this struggling artist will be struggling that bit more!

The Impact

  • I sincerely believe in the power of stories to change lives. Film is a medium of unlimited potential, combining images, light, music and the spoken word together in a way that can make a permanent impact. I believe that, if we can do this short film justice, people will see it and be changed.
  • I have experience producing and filming a range of projects (my IMDb) and I can’t wait to get started on this one.
  • I love to hear from people. Please do get in touch with any thoughts or questions: matthew@matthew-todd.co.uk

Risks & Challenges

  • Clearly the ongoing situation with the Covid-19 pandemic is a concern and a challenge. We have a full Covid risk assessment in place to respond to whatever situation we find ourselves in at the time of the shoot.
  • The shoot has also been fully risk assessed for Health and Safety and Safeguarding, and the appropriate child performance license is in progress for our child actor.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can’t contribute - thank you for being here!
  • Please share this campaign with your friends. That really does make all the difference.
