story:
Hello there!

ENG

Hi. I'm Alan Koprivec, a filmmaker and a screenwriter graduate. I'm twenty-four years old, and I was born and raised in Lugano, Switzerland. I met Cesco in August at the Locarno Film Festival where he was performing at the time, and that same evening, talking on the train, I came up with a documentary idea about his upcoming trip to Italy. 

Who is Cesco? Born in Bari on September 23, 1999, for 8 years now he has been bringing his magic and mime performances all over Europe. His shows entertains thousands of people not only in the streets but also on social media, achieving a rapid success of followers close to one million on TikTok.

Social Busker proposes itself as a street performance documentary, taking Cesco and his life during and outside of the shows as he travels all over Italy, from north to south.

The subject of the documentary aims to tell the point of view of the busker (the street artist), through the journey and his encounters. The film aims to show a reality often ignored and often denigrated. 

ITA

Ciao! Sono Alan Koprivec, regista e sceneggiatore diplomato. Ho ventiquattro anni, e sono nato e cresciuto a Lugano, in Svizzera. Ho conosciuto Cesco ad agosto al festival del cinema di Locarno dove si esibiva in quel momento, e la sera stessa, parlando sul treno gli ho proposto di fare un documentario sul suo prossimo viaggio in Italia. 

Chi è Cesco? Nato a Bari il 23 Settembre 1999, da 8 anni porta le sue esibizioni di magia e mimica, in tutta Europa.  I suoi spettacoli animano migliaia di persone non solo in strada ma anche sui social, ottenendo un successo rapido di followers  prossimo al milione su TikTok.

Social Busker si propone come un documentario che parla di street performance, prendendo Cesco e la sua vita durante e fuori dagli show mentre attraversa l'intera Italia, da nord a sud.

Il soggetto del documentario ha come obbiettivo il raccontare il punto di vista del busker  (l'artista di strada), attraverso il viaggio e i suoi incontri.  Il film punta a mostrare una realtà spesso ignorata e spesso denigrata.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get/ Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e cosa riceverai

ENG

Regardless of the amount received, every donation counts. It will entirely cover the project and the people that gets to be part of it; equipment rental, post-production, transportation, and housing.

The rewards for your help are many and unique, as every single product you will receive, in digital or physical format, has been conceived and produced entirely by us. So it goes from the various thanks in the credits, ranging from tier 4 to tier 1, through t-shirts, sweatshirts, blu-ray and even you could join a live performance by Cesco wherever you want!

If we do not reach the required amount, the project will still be completed. We will sacrifice audio and video post production, but the rewards will still be guaranteed.

ITA

Ogni offerta conta, indipendentemente dall'ammontare. La cifra richiesta sarà interamente indirizzata al progetto e alle persone che ne fanno parte; noleggio attrezzatura, post-produzione, trasporti e alloggi.

Le ricompense per il vostro aiuto sono tante e uniche, in quanto ogni singolo prodotto che riceverete, in formato digitale o fisico, è stato pensato e prodotto interamente da noi. Si va quindi dai vari ringraziamenti nei titoli di coda, che vanno dal tier 4 al tier 1, passando per magliette, felpe, blu-ray e molto altro fino ad arrivare ad uno spettacolo di Cesco live dove vuoi tu!

Se non dovessimo ricevere la somma richiesta, il progetto sarà comunque portato a termine. Andremo a sacrificare per forza di cose, fattori quali la post produzione audio e quella video, ma le ricompense saranno comunque garantite.

 

The Impact/L'impatto

ENG

A documentary of this type and with this topic nowadays is more important than ever. The reason is simple, Social Busker, tells a reality that is often forgotten and has seen, in the last year, because of the pandemic, its darkest period. Supporting a project like this is not only a help towards the project itself but also towards the busker community, to make it better known from a purely human side and to make a collective consciousness about these artists.

The main choice of crowdfunding was conceived not only for the funding, but also for the creative freedom of not having to depend on a conventional producer during filming, and also because it would have slowed down our production process.

ITA 

Un documentario di questo tipo e con queste tematiche è ora, più importante che mai. La ragione è semplice, Social Busker, racconta di una realtà troppo spesso dimenticata che ha visto, nell'ultimo anno, a causa della pandemia il suo periodo più buio. Sostenere un progetto del genere non è solo un aiuto verso il progetto stesso ma anche verso la comunità dei busker, per farla conoscere meglio da un lato puramente umano e per far si che la coscienza collettiva riguardante questi artisti si arricchisca.

La scelta del crowdfunding è stata pensata non solo per i finanziamenti, ma anche per la libertà creativa di non dover per forza dipendere da un produttore convenzionale in fase di riprese, e anche perché ci avrebbe rallentato i tempi di realizzazione.

 

Risks & Challenges/Rischi e Sfide

ENG

The challenges of this project are many, the first one consists of an entirely month of on the road filming throughout Italy and the consequences, however planned, that could become unpredictable at any time.

The second is a purely economic issue, since the period of filming will take place during the fundraising and which means we will start with our own funds without even knowing if the campaign will go well or not, so it is a risk for us that we will totally assume. This does not devalue your economic support, also because it is still for us an intense month of work, expenses and energy.

The third challenge is the cinematographic and qualitative aspect of the project. All the people involved are professionals who care and put all their passion and own experiences for the film's success. This is a great act of responsibility on everyone's part and at the same time puts us in a stressful condition that we have to manage day by day.

ITA

Le sfide di questo progetto sono tante, la prima è che si tratta di un mese di riprese on the road per tutta Italia ed i risvolti, per quanto calcolati, possono diventare imprevedibili in qualsiasi momento.

La seconda è una questione puramente economica, dato che il periodo delle riprese, sarà durante la raccolta fondi e quindi partiremo solo con fondi nostri senza neanche sapere se la campagna andrà bene o meno, quindi è un rischio che ci assumiamo totalmente. Questo non va a sminuire le offerte anche perché per noi è comunque un mese intenso di lavoro, spese ed energie.

La terza sfida è quella che riguarda il lato cinematografico e qualitativo del progetto. Tutte le persone coinvolte sono professionisti del settore che ci tengono e mettono tutta la loro passione ed esperienza al servizio della buona riuscita del film. Questo è un grande atto di responsabilità da parte di tutti e ci mette allo stesso tempo in una condizione di stress che dovremmo gestire giorno per giorno.

 

Other Ways You Can Help!/Altri modi in cui puoi aiutarci!

ENG

We would like to remark that no one is forced to donate anything, what interests us most is that people can understand the importance of the project, supporting it by sharing. Word of mouth is an important form of help and it's free, so share!

Spread the word so that this project can succeed and become a quality documentary that could be up to participating in film festivals and who knows, even something more ...

Daily content and updates will be posted on our instagram profiles (@cescoartist @alan.in.black), on tiktok (@cescoartist) and especially here on indiegogo, so you'll always know what we're doing and if we happen to be by your city don’t doubt on bringing us something to eat, at least we'll be saving some money :)

ITA

Ovviamente nessuno è obbligato a donare qualcosa, quello che ci interessa di più è che le persone riescano a capire l'importanza del progetto, sostenendolo con una condivisione. Il passaparola è una forma importante di aiuto ed è gratuito, quindi condividi!

Spargi la voce per far si che questo progetto possa avere successo e riesca a diventare un documentario di qualità capace di partecipare a festival cinematografici e chissà, anche qualcosa in più...

Ogni giorno verranno pubblicati contenuti ed aggiornamenti sui nostri profili instagram (@cescoartist @alan.in.black), su tiktok (@cescoartist) e sopratutto qui su indiegogo, quindi saprete sempre quello che faremo e se capitiamo nella tua città portaci qualcosa da mangiare che almeno risparmiamo :)

 

Other useful informations/Altre informazioni utili

ENG:

Timeline:

The documentary production will begin on September 17,  and finish around mid/late October. Post-production, such as; editing, sound design, subtitling and color correction, on the other hand is expected to be finished by January 2022. From January to September the film will be sent to all the major film festivals worldwide, followed by immediate purchase and rental on platforms yet to be defined. Perks for those who donated will be delivered between September and October 2022.

The film will last 90-100 minutes long, in color and mostly in Italian, with subtitles in Italian for the deaf, English, Spanish and possibly, if we reach our goal, in German and French. 

For any other kind of information, collaboration or contribution please contact us at socialbusker@gmail.com

ITA:

Timeline:

Le riprese inizieranno il 17 settembre, e finiranno verso metà/fine ottobre. La post-produzione, quindi; montaggio, suono, sottotitolatura e color correction, invece contiamo di finirla per gennaio 2022. Il film da gennaio a settembre sarà mandato a tutti i principali festival cinematografici mondiali, in seguito il film sarà disponibile per l'acquisto e ed il noleggio su piattaforme ancora da definire. Tra settembre e ottobre 2022 invece saranno consegnati i perk per chi ha donato.

Il film sarà di una durata stimata di 90-100 minuti, a colore e prevalentemente in italiano, saranno disponibili i sottotitoli in italiano per non udenti, inglese, spagnolo ed eventualmente, raggiungessimo il nostro obbiettivo, in tedesco ed in francese. 

Per ogni altro tipo di informazione, collaborazione o contributo contattateci a socialbusker@gmail.com
story_txt:
Hello there!
ENG
Hi. I'm Alan Koprivec, a filmmaker and a screenwriter graduate. I'm twenty-four years old, and I was born and raised in Lugano, Switzerland. I met Cesco in August at the Locarno Film Festival where he was performing at the time, and that same evening, talking on the train, I came up with a documentary idea about his upcoming trip to Italy. 
Who is Cesco? Born in Bari on September 23, 1999, for 8 years now he has been bringing his magic and mime performances all over Europe. His shows entertains thousands of people not only in the streets but also on social media, achieving a rapid success of followers close to one million on TikTok.
Social Busker proposes itself as a street performance documentary, taking Cesco and his life during and outside of the shows as he travels all over Italy, from north to south.
The subject of the documentary aims to tell the point of view of the busker (the street artist), through the journey and his encounters. The film aims to show a reality often ignored and often denigrated. 
ITA
Ciao! Sono Alan Koprivec, regista e sceneggiatore diplomato. Ho ventiquattro anni, e sono nato e cresciuto a Lugano, in Svizzera. Ho conosciuto Cesco ad agosto al festival del cinema di Locarno dove si esibiva in quel momento, e la sera stessa, parlando sul treno gli ho proposto di fare un documentario sul suo prossimo viaggio in Italia. 
Chi è Cesco? Nato a Bari il 23 Settembre 1999, da 8 anni porta le sue esibizioni di magia e mimica, in tutta Europa.  I suoi spettacoli animano migliaia di persone non solo in strada ma anche sui social, ottenendo un successo rapido di followers  prossimo al milione su TikTok.
Social Busker si propone come un documentario che parla di street performance, prendendo Cesco e la sua vita durante e fuori dagli show mentre attraversa l'intera Italia, da nord a sud.
Il soggetto del documentario ha come obbiettivo il raccontare il punto di vista del busker  (l'artista di strada), attraverso il viaggio e i suoi incontri.  Il film punta a mostrare una realtà spesso ignorata e spesso denigrata.


 

 

What We Need & What You Get/ Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e cosa riceverai
ENG
Regardless of the amount received, every donation counts. It will entirely cover the project and the people that gets to be part of it; equipment rental, post-production, transportation, and housing.
The rewards for your help are many and unique, as every single product you will receive, in digital or physical format, has been conceived and produced entirely by us. So it goes from the various thanks in the credits, ranging from tier 4 to tier 1, through t-shirts, sweatshirts, blu-ray and even you could join a live performance by Cesco wherever you want!
If we do not reach the required amount, the project will still be completed. We will sacrifice audio and video post production, but the rewards will still be guaranteed.
ITA
Ogni offerta conta, indipendentemente dall'ammontare. La cifra richiesta sarà interamente indirizzata al progetto e alle persone che ne fanno parte; noleggio attrezzatura, post-produzione, trasporti e alloggi.
Le ricompense per il vostro aiuto sono tante e uniche, in quanto ogni singolo prodotto che riceverete, in formato digitale o fisico, è stato pensato e prodotto interamente da noi. Si va quindi dai vari ringraziamenti nei titoli di coda, che vanno dal tier 4 al tier 1, passando per magliette, felpe, blu-ray e molto altro fino ad arrivare ad uno spettacolo di Cesco live dove vuoi tu!
Se non dovessimo ricevere la somma richiesta, il progetto sarà comunque portato a termine. Andremo a sacrificare per forza di cose, fattori quali la post produzione audio e quella video, ma le ricompense saranno comunque garantite.


 
The Impact/L'impatto
ENG
A documentary of this type and with this topic nowadays is more important than ever. The reason is simple, Social Busker, tells a reality that is often forgotten and has seen, in the last year, because of the pandemic, its darkest period. Supporting a project like this is not only a help towards the project itself but also towards the busker community, to make it better known from a purely human side and to make a collective consciousness about these artists.
The main choice of crowdfunding was conceived not only for the funding, but also for the creative freedom of not having to depend on a conventional producer during filming, and also because it would have slowed down our production process.
ITA 
Un documentario di questo tipo e con queste tematiche è ora, più importante che mai. La ragione è semplice, Social Busker, racconta di una realtà troppo spesso dimenticata che ha visto, nell'ultimo anno, a causa della pandemia il suo periodo più buio. Sostenere un progetto del genere non è solo un aiuto verso il progetto stesso ma anche verso la comunità dei busker, per farla conoscere meglio da un lato puramente umano e per far si che la coscienza collettiva riguardante questi artisti si arricchisca.
La scelta del crowdfunding è stata pensata non solo per i finanziamenti, ma anche per la libertà creativa di non dover per forza dipendere da un produttore convenzionale in fase di riprese, e anche perché ci avrebbe rallentato i tempi di realizzazione.

 
Risks & Challenges/Rischi e Sfide

ENG
The challenges of this project are many, the first one consists of an entirely month of on the road filming throughout Italy and the consequences, however planned, that could become unpredictable at any time.
The second is a purely economic issue, since the period of filming will take place during the fundraising and which means we will start with our own funds without even knowing if the campaign will go well or not, so it is a risk for us that we will totally assume. This does not devalue your economic support, also because it is still for us an intense month of work, expenses and energy.
The third challenge is the cinematographic and qualitative aspect of the project. All the people involved are professionals who care and put all their passion and own experiences for the film's success. This is a great act of responsibility on everyone's part and at the same time puts us in a stressful condition that we have to manage day by day.
ITA
Le sfide di questo progetto sono tante, la prima è che si tratta di un mese di riprese on the road per tutta Italia ed i risvolti, per quanto calcolati, possono diventare imprevedibili in qualsiasi momento.
La seconda è una questione puramente economica, dato che il periodo delle riprese, sarà durante la raccolta fondi e quindi partiremo solo con fondi nostri senza neanche sapere se la campagna andrà bene o meno, quindi è un rischio che ci assumiamo totalmente. Questo non va a sminuire le offerte anche perché per noi è comunque un mese intenso di lavoro, spese ed energie.
La terza sfida è quella che riguarda il lato cinematografico e qualitativo del progetto. Tutte le persone coinvolte sono professionisti del settore che ci tengono e mettono tutta la loro passione ed esperienza al servizio della buona riuscita del film. Questo è un grande atto di responsabilità da parte di tutti e ci mette allo stesso tempo in una condizione di stress che dovremmo gestire giorno per giorno.


 
Other Ways You Can Help!/Altri modi in cui puoi aiutarci!
ENG
We would like to remark that no one is forced to donate anything, what interests us most is that people can understand the importance of the project, supporting it by sharing. Word of mouth is an important form of help and it's free, so share!
Spread the word so that this project can succeed and become a quality documentary that could be up to participating in film festivals and who knows, even something more ...
Daily content and updates will be posted on our instagram profiles (@cescoartist @alan.in.black), on tiktok (@cescoartist) and especially here on indiegogo, so you'll always know what we're doing and if we happen to be by your city don’t doubt on bringing us something to eat, at least we'll be saving some money :)
ITA
Ovviamente nessuno è obbligato a donare qualcosa, quello che ci interessa di più è che le persone riescano a capire l'importanza del progetto, sostenendolo con una condivisione. Il passaparola è una forma importante di aiuto ed è gratuito, quindi condividi!
Spargi la voce per far si che questo progetto possa avere successo e riesca a diventare un documentario di qualità capace di partecipare a festival cinematografici e chissà, anche qualcosa in più...
Ogni giorno verranno pubblicati contenuti ed aggiornamenti sui nostri profili instagram (@cescoartist @alan.in.black), su tiktok (@cescoartist) e sopratutto qui su indiegogo, quindi saprete sempre quello che faremo e se capitiamo nella tua città portaci qualcosa da mangiare che almeno risparmiamo :)

 
Other useful informations/Altre informazioni utili
ENG:
Timeline:
The documentary production will begin on September 17,  and finish around mid/late October. Post-production, such as; editing, sound design, subtitling and color correction, on the other hand is expected to be finished by January 2022. From January to September the film will be sent to all the major film festivals worldwide, followed by immediate purchase and rental on platforms yet to be defined. Perks for those who donated will be delivered between September and October 2022.
The film will last 90-100 minutes long, in color and mostly in Italian, with subtitles in Italian for the deaf, English, Spanish and possibly, if we reach our goal, in German and French. 
For any other kind of information, collaboration or contribution please contact us at socialbusker@gmail.com
ITA:
Timeline:
Le riprese inizieranno il 17 settembre, e finiranno verso metà/fine ottobre. La post-produzione, quindi; montaggio, suono, sottotitolatura e color correction, invece contiamo di finirla per gennaio 2022. Il film da gennaio a settembre sarà mandato a tutti i principali festival cinematografici mondiali, in seguito il film sarà disponibile per l'acquisto e ed il noleggio su piattaforme ancora da definire. Tra settembre e ottobre 2022 invece saranno consegnati i perk per chi ha donato.
Il film sarà di una durata stimata di 90-100 minuti, a colore e prevalentemente in italiano, saranno disponibili i sottotitoli in italiano per non udenti, inglese, spagnolo ed eventualmente, raggiungessimo il nostro obbiettivo, in tedesco ed in francese. 
Per ogni altro tipo di informazione, collaborazione o contributo contattateci a socialbusker@gmail.com

story:
Synopsis

Tim , a down-on-his-luck amateur crypto currency trader with marital problems loses his life’s savings after an insider tip goes wrong. When Patti, Tim’s wife, doesn’t make their dinner date, Tim meets a cocky and corrupt man by the name of Juan Jones (Alejo Vega). Juan befriends Tim and convinces him he can recuperate his money with a game of poker. With a marriage on the brink and money to be made, Juan takes Tim for a ride through the streets of Miami for a night of debauchery, corruption, and self-discovery.

Breakdown

  • We are looking to gather $30,000.00 for production costs & salary to make this film. We have all colaboratively called in all favors we have acquired over the years of filmmaking to bring down our production costs while maintaining a professional set Although we are putting in funds from our own pocket it is not enough,.so we ask you to help us in bringing this film to 
  • We have amazing perks, and fun events planned for those who participate from meet and greets to Q&A's, Free Merch., a day on set, and Dinner with Juan Jones to name a few. Who knows  maybe even a night on the town with Juan himself if you get lucky enough. Your contributions will make sure we can accomplish as well as make our movie. We are trying to create an experience not just a movie.
  • If we fail to meet our goal of $30,000.00, we have in place contingency plans to be able to produce this film by any means necessary. So regardless if we make $1.00 or $100,000.00 our goal is to make this film. We just need your help. So please contribute or share.

 

The Impact

Meeting Juan Jones is a special film in a special city! MIAMI. With special characters played by amazingly talented Local Artists. For many of them it will be a first opportunity to be a part of a feature film. For some, their first chance at validation. This film is a chance for this group of locals and up and comers to stamp our mark in the industry. And to prove that if you have a dream and a talented committed group of individuals along with people who support them, "ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE!" All we ask is for your help to make this dream a reality, not just for us but for many others as well. To show other that dreams can come true and to show that if we can do it so can any one.

 

Risks & Challenges

In all Projects there are obvious risk and challenges. As a team of actors and crew, we are committed to this project and seeing this film and our vision come to live for all to enjoy.

  • With a film of this magnitude you would figure we would need a pretty big budget, but the sacrifice of all involved we have managed to create a plan that will make it affordable but retain all the cinematic qualities you see in big budget films. 
  • We have devised 3 different plans of action to make sure this film gets made and you get to enjoy an independent film that offers original storytelling and beautiful cinematography. 
  • Depending on you the contributor is what will determine how quickly we can go about making this film with your undying generosity and interest in our film.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our film.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please Follow us on
  • Instagram: @meetingjuanjones / @mcpreeproductionsfilms / @filmwaitpictures / @highbuzzproductions

And that's all there is to it. Help us make Meeting Juan Jones a reality, and who knows maybe you'll get to really meet Juan Jones.

story:
Telling An Untold Story 

The idea for 'Catch A Butcher' came from our writer/director Cassiah Joski-Jethi's own experience of the pressure to suppress and express different sides of her heritage. Upon further research into Anglo-Indian history, we discovered stories of complex dynamics between Indian mothers and their mixed race children who were at the mercy of their British fathers and the British Empire, especially in the late 19th century when there was a huge cultural shift against mixed race children. These themes are reflected in 'Catch a Butcher' by the cult-like maternity ward that secretly prepares mixed race babies in horrific ways to be separated from their native mothers and sent back to England. But reaching beyond colonial India, the pressure to identify with one side of your identity over another crosses into societal and cultural pressures even today, and 'Catch A Butcher' looks at the devastating consequences of this. Our film is told through the prospective of four female nurses; one mixed race, one caucasian, and two Indian, making it an extremely diverse and unique proposal. We believe there has never been a film like this, and we are thrilled to explore these women and shine a light on their untold stories.

 

Our Film & The Horror Genre

In recent years, there has been a trend in films utilising horror tropes to explore the fear of how society forces oppressed groups to “change”. Whether it be the creation of a “White Voice” in ‘Sorry to Bother You’; the decision to stay an oppressed woman or change into a free goat in ‘I Am Not a Witch’; or being forced into the sunken place and changed into a mindless slave in ‘Get Out’, modern films are presenting the complicated nature of how society forces oppressed groups to change. We are looking to join these films with ‘Catch a Butcher’, an intense horror-thriller that explores the horror of a cult-like 19th century hospital "caring for" mixed race babies and forcing them to assimilate into white English culture. This forced “change” creates the horror that we believe will get under the audiences skin, while also making important social statements about our history as a country with colonialism, and the feelings and struggles of mixed race individuals.

 

Visuals 

Setting our story in 19th century India gives us a wealth of interesting visuals to play with, especially with the surreal horror elements in our story. We are planning to shoot some of the film on location, as well some scenes in a purpose-built set in a studio. Cassiah is collaborating with Director of Photography Robbie Bryant (after their first collaboration on 'Kindling') and Production Designer Lili Lea Abraham.  

 

Cassiah Joski-Jethi (Writer/Director) 

Directors Statement

"‘Catch A Butcher’ was grown out of a desire to learn more about my own mixed race heritage. Growing up, I found it difficult to negotiate my Indian heritage and identity, feeling a pressure from society to “choose” my white side above all else, and ‘Catch A Butcher’ is a visual metaphor for this. I want the film to reclaim and celebrate my Indian heritage, hence why I use Hindi throughout the script but not translated. Just as Western colonialism imposed their language and beliefs on other cultures, this film is in direct opposition to that. The film will allow those with the knowledge of Indian culture to pick up the subtle contexts expressed in the title and in the dialogue, and will hopefully prompt audiences who do not know this language to research and find out for themselves, ensuring they can be an active participant in delving into the context behind the film."

Director Biography 

Cassiah began her career being mentored by Gurinder Chadha OBE who took Cassiah under her wing after a chance meeting on a train. As a director, Cassiah is motivated to tell stories through a female lens, and often her work explores the projection of femininity, the subversion of typical female roles, and dual heritage/identity. Cassiah’s directorial debut 'Polly' (2017), about a teenager wanting to escape an all-female cult, was a short film winner at the Moondance International Film Festival 2018. Her second short 'Woman of the Night' (2018), about a mother who secretly works as a bouncer, premiered at the Short Cinema in Leicester in 2018. Cassiah recently completed her third short ‘Kindling’ (2019) about fairy tales coming to life to help a girl to escape an abusive home. Cassiah is also a writer represented by SMA Talent in London. Her award nominated stage plays have been performed in theatres across the country and she is currently working on a number of commissions for independent film and TV companies. In addition, Cassiah is currently a member of the BFI Network X BAFTA Crew, and is being mentored by Film London producer Angeli Macfarlane as part of the scheme.

 

Our Team

Editor - Naomi Smallwood 

Naomi studied Editing and Post Production at Ravensbourne, an industry acclaimed university, and now works in high-end TV drama. She has assembly editor credits for the BBC's ‘Death In Paradise’ and forthcoming C4 drama ‘Chimerica’. She loves to cut short films when she can, and has cut several productions with exciting up and coming directors, including Cassiah's ‘Kindling’. 

Sound Designer - Emma Butt 

Emma has over 11 years experience in post production sound as a ADR Recordist and Supervisor, Re-Recording Mixer and Dialogue and Sound Design editor. Some of Emma’s ADR credits include: ‘Game of Thrones’, ‘Vikings’, ‘Sex Education’, and Jim Henson’s ‘Dark Crystals’. She has received a certificate of merit from The Emmys for her ADR work on ‘Game of Thrones’ season 5 and has also been nominated for an IFTA for "Best Sound" for her work on animated series ’Punky’ and documentary ‘My Fathers War’.

Costume Designer - Jovana Gospavic

Jovana is a London based visual designer with experience in product design & development, costume & stage design, art direction and styling. She has collaborated with theatres, film production companies, advertising agencies, fashion magazines and private clients in London (BBC, The Guardian, TOPSHOP, Warner Bros, British Fencing, London Fashion Week), the Czech Republic (National Theatre in Prague, Činoherní klub Prague, Divadlo v Dlouhé Prague, Barrandov Studios) and Serbia (Bitef, Elle Serbia, Wannanbe Magazine). She's also a member of BAFTA Crew.

Cinematographer - Robbie Bryant

Robbie grew up in Bristol where he began working in the camera department in his teens. He then moved to London and climbed the ranks in the camera department whilst working on studio films including 'Harry Potter', 'Captain America' and 'James Bond'. Robbie was then mentored by several cinematographers on music videos and commercials before a mentorship with Haris Zambarloukos on the feature films 'Locke', 'Jack Ryan' and 'Cinderella', working as a camera operator on the latter. Lastly, before making the jump as a full–time cinematographer, Robbie was mentored by Dan Mindel on 'Star Wars: A Force Awakens'. His recent short 'Wale' was shortlisted for an Academy Award 2019 and is nominated for a BAFTA 2019.

Production Designer - Lili Lea Abraham 

Lili graduated at University of the Arts London specialising in Production Design. Since then she has worked in art departments on major studio films including ‘Ready Player One’, ‘Detective Pikachu’ and ‘Paddington 2’ and independent features such as ‘The Death and Life of John F. Donovan’ and ‘The Nest’. Meanwhile she has designed several award winning short films including BAFTA nominated and Oscar Shortlisted ‘Wale’ and she was Production Designer on her first feature film ‘Shapes’. She is a Warner Bros Creative Talent Alumni and member of BAFTA Crew.

Casting Director - Shakyra Dowling 

Shakyra is an independent Casting Director who has worked on Sundance, BAFTA, Berlinale and Oscar nominated films. Actors she has discovered have gone on to be nominated in best newcomer awards throughout the world. Shakyra has successfully worked in the industry for over two decades from producing West End theatre to her recent two nominations in the Inaugural UK CDA Casting Awards 2017 in both the Feature Film and Short Film categories.

Producer - Thomas McDonald 

After setting up the award-winning film festival the ROHO Film Fest, Thomas secured Film London funding for short 'Vibration', which screened at among others LSFF and the Cleveland Film Festival, reaching the final 12 for BIFA Best British Short Film. He has since worked with exciting, up-and-coming directors, helping them build further forward into their career, making ‘CFF’ with Kacper Slonina which toured around the world and won awards at Queen Palm festival in America, ‘No Exposure’ with Marcus Thomas which premiered at the BFI Southbank earlier this year, ‘New Years Day’ with Nathan Glendinning which is starting its festival tour, and the recently completed ‘Kindling’ with Cassiah.

Composer - Nainita Desai

Nainita Desai is a BAFTA Breakthrough Brit and has scored countless bespoke scores for film and TV for all the major broadcasters from the BBC to HBO and ITV and C4.  Nainita’s musical foundations are rooted in documentary where she has forged an enviable reputation, working with leading filmmakers on numerous projects that have garnered OSCAR, BAFTA, EMMY awards and nominations.

 

Budget

We have already secured some funds from various sources, and we need to raise our minimum production budget of around £32,000. This will allow us to pay our talented, experienced team of creatives we have already brought on to the project, rent out high quality equipment, attach top acting talent, pay for prosthetics and special effects, and to hire out lavish locations such as Highbury Hall, which has been used often in the past as a location for the BBC. 

However, we have also created possible projections for a bigger budget, allowing us to be even more ambitious with our film, and increase the quality even more. This includes budget for travelling a small number of crew to India, to possibly shoot some exterior scenes on location there. 

 

Shining A Light on the Midlands 

A feature of Cassiah's work is to base her productions in the Midlands. Therefore, our production will have a Midlands focus, and as such, we will be actively looking to engage with the local area. Some of our initial plans include:

-  Working with interns from underprivileged areas who would not usually have access to the film industry, giving them the opportunity to work behind the scenes on a film set

- Shooting the majority of our film in locations across the Midlands 

- Collaborating with Midlands-based companies to support the local industry 

- Auditioning talent from the Midlands region for the lead role of Deandria

In recent years, there has been a trend in films utilising horror tropes to explore the fear of how society forces oppressed groups to “change”. Whether it be the creation of a “White Voice” in ‘Sorry to Bother You’; the decision to stay an oppressed woman or change into a free goat in ‘I Am Not a Witch’; or being forced into the sunken place and changed into a mindless slave in ‘Get Out’, modern films are presenting the complicated nature of how society forces oppressed groups to change. We are looking to join these films with ‘Catch a Butcher’, an intense horror-thriller that explores the horror of a cult-like 19th century hospital "caring for" mixed race babies and forcing them to assimilate into white English culture. This forced “change” creates the horror that we believe will get under the audiences skin, while also making important social statements about our history as a country with colonialism, and the feelings and struggles of mixed race individuals.

 
Visuals 
Setting our story in 19th century India gives us a wealth of interesting visuals to play with, especially with the surreal horror elements in our story. We are planning to shoot some of the film on location, as well some scenes in a purpose-built set in a studio. Cassiah is collaborating with Director of Photography Robbie Bryant (after their first collaboration on 'Kindling') and Production Designer Lili Lea Abraham.  

 
Cassiah Joski-Jethi (Writer/Director) 

Directors Statement
"‘Catch A Butcher’ was grown out of a desire to learn more about my own mixed race heritage. Growing up, I found it difficult to negotiate my Indian heritage and identity, feeling a pressure from society to “choose” my white side above all else, and ‘Catch A Butcher’ is a visual metaphor for this. I want the film to reclaim and celebrate my Indian heritage, hence why I use Hindi throughout the script but not translated. Just as Western colonialism imposed their language and beliefs on other cultures, this film is in direct opposition to that. The film will allow those with the knowledge of Indian culture to pick up the subtle contexts expressed in the title and in the dialogue, and will hopefully prompt audiences who do not know this language to research and find out for themselves, ensuring they can be an active participant in delving into the context behind the film."
Director Biography 
Cassiah began her career being mentored by Gurinder Chadha OBE who took Cassiah under her wing after a chance meeting on a train. As a director, Cassiah is motivated to tell stories through a female lens, and often her work explores the projection of femininity, the subversion of typical female roles, and dual heritage/identity. Cassiah’s directorial debut 'Polly' (2017), about a teenager wanting to escape an all-female cult, was a short film winner at the Moondance International Film Festival 2018. Her second short 'Woman of the Night' (2018), about a mother who secretly works as a bouncer, premiered at the Short Cinema in Leicester in 2018. Cassiah recently completed her third short ‘Kindling’ (2019) about fairy tales coming to life to help a girl to escape an abusive home. Cassiah is also a writer represented by SMA Talent in London. Her award nominated stage plays have been performed in theatres across the country and she is currently working on a number of commissions for independent film and TV companies. In addition, Cassiah is currently a member of the BFI Network X BAFTA Crew, and is being mentored by Film London producer Angeli Macfarlane as part of the scheme.
 
Our Team

Editor - Naomi Smallwood 
Naomi studied Editing and Post Production at Ravensbourne, an industry acclaimed university, and now works in high-end TV drama. She has assembly editor credits for the BBC's ‘Death In Paradise’ and forthcoming C4 drama ‘Chimerica’. She loves to cut short films when she can, and has cut several productions with exciting up and coming directors, including Cassiah's ‘Kindling’. 
Sound Designer - Emma Butt 
Emma has over 11 years experience in post production sound as a ADR Recordist and Supervisor, Re-Recording Mixer and Dialogue and Sound Design editor. Some of Emma’s ADR credits include: ‘Game of Thrones’, ‘Vikings’, ‘Sex Education’, and Jim Henson’s ‘Dark Crystals’. She has received a certificate of merit from The Emmys for her ADR work on ‘Game of Thrones’ season 5 and has also been nominated for an IFTA for "Best Sound" for her work on animated series ’Punky’ and documentary ‘My Fathers War’.
Costume Designer - Jovana Gospavic
Jovana is a London based visual designer with experience in product design & development, costume & stage design, art direction and styling. She has collaborated with theatres, film production companies, advertising agencies, fashion magazines and private clients in London (BBC, The Guardian, TOPSHOP, Warner Bros, British Fencing, London Fashion Week), the Czech Republic (National Theatre in Prague, Činoherní klub Prague, Divadlo v Dlouhé Prague, Barrandov Studios) and Serbia (Bitef, Elle Serbia, Wannanbe Magazine). She's also a member of BAFTA Crew.
Cinematographer - Robbie Bryant
Robbie grew up in Bristol where he began working in the camera department in his teens. He then moved to London and climbed the ranks in the camera department whilst working on studio films including 'Harry Potter', 'Captain America' and 'James Bond'. Robbie was then mentored by several cinematographers on music videos and commercials before a mentorship with Haris Zambarloukos on the feature films 'Locke', 'Jack Ryan' and 'Cinderella', working as a camera operator on the latter. Lastly, before making the jump as a full–time cinematographer, Robbie was mentored by Dan Mindel on 'Star Wars: A Force Awakens'. His recent short 'Wale' was shortlisted for an Academy Award 2019 and is nominated for a BAFTA 2019.

Production Designer - Lili Lea Abraham 
Lili graduated at University of the Arts London specialising in Production Design. Since then she has worked in art departments on major studio films including ‘Ready Player One’, ‘Detective Pikachu’ and ‘Paddington 2’ and independent features such as ‘The Death and Life of John F. Donovan’ and ‘The Nest’. Meanwhile she has designed several award winning short films including BAFTA nominated and Oscar Shortlisted ‘Wale’ and she was Production Designer on her first feature film ‘Shapes’. She is a Warner Bros Creative Talent Alumni and member of BAFTA Crew.
Casting Director - Shakyra Dowling 
Shakyra is an independent Casting Director who has worked on Sundance, BAFTA, Berlinale and Oscar nominated films. Actors she has discovered have gone on to be nominated in best newcomer awards throughout the world. Shakyra has successfully worked in the industry for over two decades from producing West End theatre to her recent two nominations in the Inaugural UK CDA Casting Awards 2017 in both the Feature Film and Short Film categories.
Producer - Thomas McDonald 
After setting up the award-winning film festival the ROHO Film Fest, Thomas secured Film London funding for short 'Vibration', which screened at among others LSFF and the Cleveland Film Festival, reaching the final 12 for BIFA Best British Short Film. He has since worked with exciting, up-and-coming directors, helping them build further forward into their career, making ‘CFF’ with Kacper Slonina which toured around the world and won awards at Queen Palm festival in America, ‘No Exposure’ with Marcus Thomas which premiered at the BFI Southbank earlier this year, ‘New Years Day’ with Nathan Glendinning which is starting its festival tour, and the recently completed ‘Kindling’ with Cassiah.
Composer - Nainita Desai
Nainita Desai is a BAFTA Breakthrough Brit and has scored countless bespoke scores for film and TV for all the major broadcasters from the BBC to HBO and ITV and C4.  Nainita’s musical foundations are rooted in documentary where she has forged an enviable reputation, working with leading filmmakers on numerous projects that have garnered OSCAR, BAFTA, EMMY awards and nominations.

 

Budget
We have already secured some funds from various sources, and we need to raise our minimum production budget of around £32,000. This will allow us to pay our talented, experienced team of creatives we have already brought on to the project, rent out high quality equipment, attach top acting talent, pay for prosthetics and special effects, and to hire out lavish locations such as Highbury Hall, which has been used often in the past as a location for the BBC. 
However, we have also created possible projections for a bigger budget, allowing us to be even more ambitious with our film, and increase the quality even more. This includes budget for travelling a small number of crew to India, to possibly shoot some exterior scenes on location there. 

 
Shining A Light on the Midlands 
A feature of Cassiah's work is to base her productions in the Midlands. Therefore, our production will have a Midlands focus, and as such, we will be actively looking to engage with the local area. Some of our initial plans include:
-  Working with interns from underprivileged areas who would not usually have access to the film industry, giving them the opportunity to work behind the scenes on a film set
- Shooting the majority of our film in locations across the Midlands 
- Collaborating with Midlands-based companies to support the local industry 
- Auditioning talent from the Midlands region for the lead role of Deandria

story:
Lovers Ava (Grace Gordon) and Sid (Athena Reddy) come face to face with unexpected entities.

THE VILE SLUGS is a monster movie! Just like the monster movies of old, we believe in practical effects and weird, fun images.  We believe movies like this still have a place in cinema.  It's not only a monster movie, it is also a mystical movie.  It's another world, slightly outside of our own.

Short films aren't a commercial category and don't get support from anyone but the artists themselves...and hopefully you.  We believe that to change the landscape of big cinema, small unique projects need to keep being created.  This is one of those.

 

 

We are Nick Grant (writer-director-producer), Athena Reddy (actor-producer), Gabriel Grant (producer-producer) and Grace Gordon (actress extraordinaire).

Nick (he/him) and Gabriel (he/him) head up Rook Productions which has produced the TROMA Film, Gutboy: A Badtime Story and the recently released psychological thriller, Pasture.  Nick is also the creator of the Wonderdrome Comics and Professor Bulwer Smythe (a conspiracy puppet). 

Athena Reddy (they/them) is an actor whose recent film We Do This Once premiered at Tribeca 2021.  They are the writer and creator of Corpus Vile, a body horror podcast, writer-director of Chimera Therapy, a short film and a Butoh performer. 

In addition to acting and modeling, Grace Gordon (she/her) is the creator and host of The Art Life Podcast.  She is also a visual artist who deals almost exclusively in the spookiness and sexiness. 

Oh, also Nick and Athena are the creators of Alison The Influencer (who is totally not a vampire at all.)

Our first goal is to be able to afford all the material stuff and rentals to make the film: that's practical effects, lighting, unavoidable costs like that.  That's where we need to put the most resources.  Our projected budget for this is $5,000 and if we can reach that with your help, everything becomes a lot easier.  This kind of film is a labor of love (and slime)---we are all professionals working on this project because we believe in monster movies. Any additional funds would be used to increase compensation for the friends and professionals who are graciously working below their usual rates on this fun project.

We've come up with some amazing perks for you which let you in on our process,  We want to be able to celebrate this genre with you! You can get rewards of Q+A's, polaroids from set, special screenings of our movie and even special effects props!

We're aware of the challenges that come along with low budget filmmaking.  Rook Productions  has made many short films and feature length films (you can see them here!). This project is a labor of love (and goo!) that we're ready to tackle.  

Thank you for your spooky time.  If you aren't able to contribute, your stentorian voice blaring out to the void of the internet would be a great help (that means sharing this campaign would help). Send this along to your creepiest friends! Share it with rich pets! Maybe you have a skeletal Dowager Countess in the family, surely she might have a ruby or two!
