story:
Krystyna Hutchinson, a stand-up comedian, writer, and actress based out of New York City, is well known for co-hosting one of the top comedy podcasts on iTunes, GUYS WE F*CKED: AN ANTI SLUT SHAMING PODCAST with her comedy partner Corrine Fischer. She's been featured in Vogue, Glamour, Esquire, Vice, and most recently released her short film "Dwell," helmed by Ally Giannini and co-director of photography Ben Nigh. The short film was described as "immaculate", "incredible" and "expertly written & performed" and appeared in several national film festivals, winning an award for 'outstanding drama short'.

Now, they are teaming up again to bring you to...
 

Krystyna Hutchinson, Ally Giannini, and Ben Nigh combined their passion for psychological thrillers with the deeply personal themes of trauma, PTSD, and repressed memories into a new film, called "The Tower."

This short film will invite our audience to face their own memories through the main character, Lucy, who will be performed by Krystyna. Lucy receives an ominous tarot card reading that sends her running. She realizes she's being followed, but no matter where she runs the elusive figure is already there waiting. What happens when she can't run anymore? Stay tuned to find out...

We are asking for your help to raise $40,000 so we can bring "The Tower" to life.

These funds will be used in these main areas:

  • Locations
  • Anamorphic lenses and Alexa Mini Camera kit
  • Cast & Crew 
  • Moonlight Screening, digital release, & festival fees


The locations are integral visual metaphors and characters. Our goal is to shoot around New York City on Roosevelt Island, in Tudor City, and Hunter's Point Park. Part of those funds will go to getting access and permits to shoot at these striking spots. It will also help cover costs associated with shooting on location including transportation, shelter, and craft services.

The funds will also help us secure an anamorphic lens kit, which will enhance the expansiveness of these landscapes and capture Lucy's isolation and growing dread as the film progresses. The lens kit will allow us to widen the field of view and explore monument horror.

After location and equipment, the rest of the funds will be to pay our wonderful crew, without whom we could not make this dream a reality. Aya Tariq will join us as our makeup artist. The film will be edited by Heather Mooney and feature an original score by Dan Krysa. The best version of this film has fully staffed departments in grip and electric, production design, camera, and post-production. Your funds will give everyone the support they need to create movie magic.

After we finish the film, the rest of the funds will go towards festival distribution and a digital release. We also plan to organize a moonlight screening in New York City for those who want to come and celebrate this journey with us. 

This past year has been hard for so many people. The whole city is being rebuilt through each person that walks through it and this film celebrates that. This film is for survivors of trauma – in its many forms. It's also for fans of new-age spiritualism, astrology, tarot, and horror as well as listeners of Krystyna Hutchinson's very popular podcasts, "The Voices in Our Heads" and "Guys We Fucked." We want our film to encourage folks to safely seek out the source of their pain and investigate the sadness they carry around. We hope it shows that it is possible to escape the cycle of trauma and comfort your inner child.

We need your help to create this film and any little amount goes a long way. Your donations will never go unnoticed, and each donation will come with perks, which are listed in the campaign. If you have any questions, reach out to us! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute but have some skills and want to be a part of the film, reach out to us @thetowershort on Instagram and we'd love to utilize your skills as a donation of services. Our team is expanding every day as we gear up to start production in the fall and we can't wait to show you what we've been working on.  

More than anything, you can help us get the word out -- this film means so much to this team and we wouldn't be able to do it without you. 

Without further adieu, meet the team: 


Ally is a director, cinematographer, producer, and editor based in Brooklyn. She directed "Dwell" and currently works at Insider Inc. as a Senior Videographer and Editor. She's directed and developed several Facebook Watch series, including "Science the $#!* Out Of It," "Swimming Hole Safari" and "It's Cool...But Does It Really Work?"

Additionally, she's contributed as a Cinematographer and Video Editor on many of Insider's shows, including Debunked, Good and Bad Acting, Luxe Life, Movies Insider, Beauty Insider, So Expensive, Legendary Eats, & Line Around The Block.  Ally graduated from Fairfield University with a B.A. in Film, TV and Media Arts and also spent a semester studying screenwriting at FAMU in Prague.


Director's Statement: 
Surrealism has been explored and championed by greats like Bergmen in "Persona," Fellini in "8 ½" and Wenders in "Wings of Desire." What strikes me about Persona and 8 ½ is that the margins between truth and reality are blurred, which makes us question reality itself. My brand of surrealism brings high fantasy imagery into spaces where they don't belong. The fantastical idea or self inserted into the real world can't exist there harmoniously. I live with PTSD, depression, and anxiety. Trauma manifests for me in fantastical and terrifying ways that warp reality. It's in the harmony of fantasy and kitchen-sink realism that I find my perspective. My work explores the way women are taught to make themselves disappear while simultaneously being fed a fantasy narrative of a happily ever after. It also explores trauma through nonlinear time bending - and in the case of "The Tower" - how trauma lives in the past, present, and future.


Ben is a cinematographer, photographer, editor, and musician based in Brooklyn. He was the co-cinematographer for "Dwell" and currently works at Insider Inc. as Senior Videographer and Editor. As a founding employee of Insider, he has contributed to countless series, sponsored video campaigns, and videos covering everything from food to politics to film theory to pop culture. He graduated from American University with a double major in Film & Media Arts and Business Administration, as well as spent a semester studying filmmaking at FAMU in Prague. He is generally well-liked.
story_txt:
Krystyna Hutchinson, a stand-up comedian, writer, and actress based out of New York City, is well known for co-hosting one of the top comedy podcasts on iTunes, GUYS WE F*CKED: AN ANTI SLUT SHAMING PODCAST with her comedy partner Corrine Fischer. She's been featured in Vogue, Glamour, Esquire, Vice, and most recently released her short film "Dwell," helmed by Ally Giannini and co-director of photography Ben Nigh. The short film was described as "immaculate", "incredible" and "expertly written & performed" and appeared in several national film festivals, winning an award for 'outstanding drama short'.Now, they are teaming up again to bring you to... 


Krystyna Hutchinson, Ally Giannini, and Ben Nigh combined their passion for psychological thrillers with the deeply personal themes of trauma, PTSD, and repressed memories into a new film, called "The Tower."
This short film will invite our audience to face their own memories through the main character, Lucy, who will be performed by Krystyna. Lucy receives an ominous tarot card reading that sends her running. She realizes she's being followed, but no matter where she runs the elusive figure is already there waiting. What happens when she can't run anymore? Stay tuned to find out...We are asking for your help to raise $40,000 so we can bring "The Tower" to life.
These funds will be used in these main areas:

Locations
Anamorphic lenses and Alexa Mini Camera kit

Cast & Crew 
Moonlight Screening, digital release, & festival fees

The locations are integral visual metaphors and characters. Our goal is to shoot around New York City on Roosevelt Island, in Tudor City, and Hunter's Point Park. Part of those funds will go to getting access and permits to shoot at these striking spots. It will also help cover costs associated with shooting on location including transportation, shelter, and craft services.The funds will also help us secure an anamorphic lens kit, which will enhance the expansiveness of these landscapes and capture Lucy's isolation and growing dread as the film progresses. The lens kit will allow us to widen the field of view and explore monument horror.After location and equipment, the rest of the funds will be to pay our wonderful crew, without whom we could not make this dream a reality. Aya Tariq will join us as our makeup artist. The film will be edited by Heather Mooney and feature an original score by Dan Krysa. The best version of this film has fully staffed departments in grip and electric, production design, camera, and post-production. Your funds will give everyone the support they need to create movie magic.


After we finish the film, the rest of the funds will go towards festival distribution and a digital release. We also plan to organize a moonlight screening in New York City for those who want to come and celebrate this journey with us. This past year has been hard for so many people. The whole city is being rebuilt through each person that walks through it and this film celebrates that. This film is for survivors of trauma – in its many forms. It's also for fans of new-age spiritualism, astrology, tarot, and horror as well as listeners of Krystyna Hutchinson's very popular podcasts, "The Voices in Our Heads" and "Guys We Fucked." We want our film to encourage folks to safely seek out the source of their pain and investigate the sadness they carry around. We hope it shows that it is possible to escape the cycle of trauma and comfort your inner child.We need your help to create this film and any little amount goes a long way. Your donations will never go unnoticed, and each donation will come with perks, which are listed in the campaign. If you have any questions, reach out to us!

Our team is expanding every day as we gear up to start production in the fall and we can't wait to show you what we've been working on.  More than anything, you can help us get the word out -- this film means so much to this team and we wouldn't be able to do it without you. Without further adieu, meet the team:

My brand of surrealism brings high fantasy imagery into spaces where they don't belong. The fantastical idea or self inserted into the real world can't exist there harmoniously. I live with PTSD, depression, and anxiety. Trauma manifests for me in fantastical and terrifying ways that warp reality. story:
UPDATE: June 2015 -

Mr. Somebody? is now on sale here @ Vinyl Tap Records. @£9.99

16 page photo booklet included!

http://www.vinyltap.co.uk/a-documentry-by-michelle-heighway

........

UPDATE May 2015

Mr. Somebody? is available here on our site :  http://www.mrsomebody.co.uk/blog/

thanks again to everyone for helping make this happen!

..................

This is my "Passion Project" - After 5 years in the making -  as a 1st time feature documentary film maker; I am now crowdfunding to release Limited Edition DVD's with a booklet , with unseen archive images  of my towns mysterious retired  performing eccentric.            (Eccentricity)                                                            

It would be amazing if you can help spread the word. Your contributions will help me finance the booklet/DVD's and a BBFC certificate.



Mr. Somebody? "Oscillating wildly from mad to insightful, Mangle-Wurzel carves a inspirational yet lonely figure of boundless imagination".  Sunshine Wong - Sheffield Doc Fest 2014

Here is something I prepared earlier with Jake to try explain the Limited Edition DVD release! Please see below: 



Hi I am Michelle Heighway. Between 2008-2013, I got my self a camera and editing suite  - I then created my 1st feature documentary about my home towns very own enigmatic eccentric Jake Mangle- Wurzel -  Mr. Somebody?

It has been the most passionate self searching journey of my life; as a filmmaker so far!


"Mr. Somebody? is a very humorous yet occasionally deeply moving home-grown tale". Bring the Noise



I also gained a little help from NFTS Film Clinic in 2013!

Since completion in 2014; I have screened at the world leading Sheffield Doc Fest and The well known Leeds International Film Festival.

I have had a overwhelming response from the people of Huddersfield , as they too are as  intrigued as I was about Jake Mangle-Wurzel. 

As a independent filmmaker I  am now in the process of creating a wonderful Limited Edition DVD release with a Booklet of images. (Seen and some wonderful archive unseen images!)

It is very important to me to release this DVD and Booklet to share this incredible story ; which also represents this creative time together. 

Mr. Somebody? is a wonderful  human, emotional portrait of Jake Mangle-Wurzel , it represents how Jake saved him self from the depths of despair by changing his name , his life and whole identity. I hope that each owner of the DVD can be  touched and inspired by Jake's courage and creativity .

This documentary not only captures the fascinating life style of a locally well known eccentric and prankster.  It is a story of the psychological resilience  of human beings and really captures how creativity can heal us on so many levels. I connected with Jake and his experiences and I hope that this documentary can also connect and inspire you, all of you out in big wide world too! For me that's what documentaries are about  - connecting , sharing, learning and inspiring. I hope my incredible journey as a 1st time feature indie documentary maker will touch you and take you on a journey they way it has for me.

(Synopsis here)

This  campaign is a wonderful opportunity to invite everyone to experience Jake's eccentric world! 



Contributors can  pre book the Limited Edition DVD's here on indiegogo ! The creation process will happen in  March!  The DVD's will be posted out to you April 24th onwards, ( I decided to release on this date to celebrate our 1st home town screening at the Lawrence Batley Theatre!)

All DVD's are set at a discounted price here on indiegogo , as a incentive to pre - order!  also the case will contain  a double  DVD cover wrap, and  a 8 page  Limited Edition booklet of photo's of Jake will be included.

The Contributions will be very important ,as they will  help towards making the DVD's  and booklets. As a indie filmmaker , this opportunity to crowdfund will be fantastic to engage with the audience and enable us to create a higher quality product.

It will be cool for you all to post images of any of the perks you purchase.

For example -  our super cool eccentric badges! if you post a selfie wearing one. We  will be excited  to share your photo on our facebook page!

(Free Goodies will be posted to a selection of the best eccentric/fashion selfies!)

We are super excited about the campaign and can't wait to get interactive with everyone on line.... if any one wants to help too , please get in touch via our Facebook Page or Twitter!! 


What We Require & What You Get!




A wonderful amount of contributions  which will enable me to create the Limited Edition DVD's  with booklets.

It will also help pay towards the BBFC Certificate.

The British Board of Film Classification and a unique bar code , then we are all set to sell  further on line! 

The certificate is required due to Jakes occasional use of  bad language! ..... Naughty Jake!

The certificate only is £590! However it will be pleasure to wear the British Board of Film Certification on our DVD ! ...yey!

What You  Can Get!


Jake's Business Card (as above!)

Limited Edition DVD & 8 Page Booklet

Deleted scenes e - mailed to you to watch at your own leisure!

Skype chats with Jake Mangle-Wurzel and/ or  Director Michelle Heighway

Posters

MP3 Sound Track Download
38mm Badges ( I am a Neurotic Old Bastard- I know I am Badges)
Available in Pink and Green!

 When the DVD's are created , they will be posted to your address with a thank you post card from Jake and Michelle. (April 2015 at the latest)

Your name and a thank you is a option ,which will be printed on the official booklet for this limited edition release.


Challenges

It is really important to do this as a indie filmmaker. I may even be the 1st female film maker in Huddersfield to do something like this and it would be great to have you all on board to watch and help create this happen!

It takes a lot of organization to create the DVD wraps and Booklets. They will be sourced by a highly regarded business , a bar code will be required and a BBFC certificate which is required to sell DVD's in the UK.

The world of Film Making is ever changing. This project is a huge passion project. We do not have a distributor. Therefore its very important for me to bring closure to the project and release this artifact  independently and distribute this unique Limited Edition DVD and booklet with a great selection of seen and unseen images of Jake Mangle-Wurzel!

Risks


As a Indie Filmmaker a lot of self funding goes in to the project. The risk is that no one contributes to this campaign and I will then have to self fund. Therefore it's a really special project , as your

 contribution will help make this happen.  

   


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't contribute, just posting this link on your twitter or facebook page will really help us out by spreading the word!
  •  Please contact us if you'd like to help market us in other ways also , if it's on your  blog , film forums, local magazines etc,  it will be great to hear from you!
  •  You can also log in to Indiegogo and use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for reading all of this info! Many thanks!!!!! From Wurzel-Land!!! :  )

story:
My name is Liana, and my love for Film and Television started over 30 years ago when I attended Whitecliffe Art & Design School in Auckland, New Zealand. After spending six (6) months there, I decided to move to the Bay of Islands, New Zealand, where I enrolled in another Film and Television Course program before proceeding to Hollywood as an Assistant Director Trainee on a film starring Mickey Rourke. After 5 years touring New Zealand and  Australia while working on TV commercials, TV series, Theatre productions and Movies, I couldn’t help but feel the passion for the film industry burn more than ever before.

From having a significant economic impact on the modern world to being an exceptional educational tool for transforming and influencing human lives, the truth is, the importance of the film industry is enormous and can never be over-emphasized.  However, despite all these things, there is still more we can achieve with the right resources, and that is why your support is of immense importance.

Consequently, with the upswing in independent film production, individuals talented and passionate enough can impact lives if they have the have the right resources. And yes, with the experiences I’ve gathered over the years, I and my team of professionals are capable of producing top-notch films at far lower budgets that can still attract broad audiences.

As we all know, people all over the world are looking for faith-promoting stories that can act as a moral compass during their dark moments. Much more than giving humanity hope, our stories have the potential to attract large percentages within all major international and commercial genres. But then, like I said earlier, we can’t do all of these without your support.

Now, the question is, how much money do we need?

So, after careful evaluation with my team, the financial estimation for this project is $61,000 AUS dollars. This will allow us to achieve the following:

  1. Rent office space
  2.  Purchase Office supplies & equipment
  3. Advertising & Marketing - Website, Facebook, Instagram, Google ads, Influencer marketing
  4. Purchase Film & Television Cameras & Lighting equipment
  5. Purchase Editing Suite equipment
  6. Purchase Recording Studio equipment
  7. Purchase Props & Wardrobe Costumes 
  8. Purchase Sound equipment
  9. Purchase  Drone

Help me to realize my dream of opening my own Film Production Company & Film facility in the Gold Coast (Australia's Hollywood).  

The Impact

Business start up costs

Reasons to support our cause

  • Help me to realize my dream of opening my own Film Production Company & Film facility in the Gold Coast (Australia's Hollywood)
  • My project would otherwise struggle to raise funds of this size. The motivation from a Contributor  is not for financial profit, but rather to "give" or make a contribution 
  • Accelerate QLD regions economic growth through the Film Industry which is an already thriving and profitable industry in the Gold Coast
  • Impact the world and bring more meaning to your life by supporting Phase 1 of my Phase 1-3 plan.

Your Donation

Your donation will allow us to complete Phase 1 within 12 weeks.

Thank you!!

 

Phase 2

Multiple Revenue streams

In order for our company to be successful it is important we maintain ongoing "income streams" on top of  initial start up costs. These ‘streams’ will  cover all Film facility & studio costs & the day-to-day expenses incurred in maintaining and staffing offices and underlying administrative and overhead expenses. 

 

Professional Studio Facilities

Recording & Sound studio - Available Full day/Half day hire

Editing Suite - Available Full day/Half day hire

Camera/Lighting/Sound hire - Available Full day/Half day hire

Green Screen hire - Available Full day/Half day hire

Props & Set hire - Various prices ranging from $20-$200

Drone hire - Available Full day/Half day hire

Profits will be used to run day to day Film facilities and Production Company costs.

 

Phase 3

Lioness Film Production will raise funds for our first "Feature Film" by applying for Grants, Crowd funding & through Investors.

"Warrior Woman” – (Indigenous Feature Film) Production budget estimate $4 million

My Tupuna (family) arrived here over 200 years ago in 13 canoes. We migrated from Hawaiiki. They were warriors of the time, giants of men standing over 8ft tall. Their sea going chariots were huge, over 150 ft long with over 100 Warriors to row them through the vast Pacific Oceans. They had the secret of Astral navigation which led them from the top of the world to a magic land beneath the world, a place remembered by the ancient ones Tangaroa, the sea God offered up food for the crew while our Karakia (prayers) found us favor with our Gods. We crossed paths with the whale people who accompanied us on our long journey.  We landed on Aotearoa where women made the rules and this land would never be the same again.

The Impact

"Warrior Woman” Feature Film

Empowering women & girls is the key to social transformation, political stability & economic growth

We must celebrate women's achievements, raise awareness & take action for equality in the Film Industry, particularly to give women a voice in a male dominated industry.

Empowering women is the fundamental right of women.

Risks & Challenges

Our business model is "recession & covid proof". 

Thanks to our relatively low number of COVID-19 cases, as well as our government's $400 million Location Incentive, which is designed to encourage film productions to shoot here, Australia is one of the best places to shoot movies in the world.

Present disruptions only accelerate a transformation well underway in movie production, distribution and consumption.

New revenue opportunities based on movie IP, such as video games, toys, books and theme parks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to everyone by sharing our campaign on your social media pages or use the Indiegogo share tools!

Your DonationYour donation will allow us to complete Phase 1 within 12 weeks.Thank you!! Phase 2Multiple Revenue streamsIn order for our company to be successful it is important we maintain ongoing "income streams" on top of  initial start up costs. These ‘streams’ will  cover all Film facility & studio costs & the day-to-day expenses incurred in maintaining and staffing offices and underlying administrative and overhead expenses.  Professional Studio FacilitiesRecording & Sound studio - Available Full day/Half day hireEditing Suite - Available Full day/Half day hireCamera/Lighting/Sound hire - Available Full day/Half day hireGreen Screen hire - Available Full day/Half day hireProps & Set hire - Various prices ranging from $20-$200Drone hire - Available Full day/Half day hireProfits will be used to run day to day Film facilities and Production Company costs. Phase 3Lioness Film Production will raise funds for our first "Feature Film" by applying for Grants, Crowd funding & through Investors."Warrior Woman” – (Indigenous Feature Film) Production budget estimate $4 millionMy Tupuna (family) arrived here over 200 years ago in 13 canoes. We migrated from Hawaiiki. They were warriors of the time, giants of men standing over 8ft tall. Their sea going chariots were huge, over 150 ft long with over 100 Warriors to row them through the vast Pacific Oceans. They had the secret of Astral navigation which led them from the top of the world to a magic land beneath the world, a place remembered by the ancient ones Tangaroa, the sea God offered up food for the crew while our Karakia (prayers) found us favor with our Gods. We crossed paths with the whale people who accompanied us on our long journey.  We landed on Aotearoa where women made the rules and this land would never be the same again.The Impact"Warrior Woman” Feature FilmEmpowering women & girls is the key to social transformation, political stability & economic growthWe must celebrate women's achievements, raise awareness & take action for equality in the Film Industry, particularly to give women a voice in a male dominated industry.Empowering women is the fundamental right of women.Risks & ChallengesOur business model is "recession & covid proof". Thanks to our relatively low number of COVID-19 cases, as well as our government's $400 million Location Incentive, which is designed to encourage film productions to shoot here, Australia is one of the best places to shoot movies in the world.Present disruptions only accelerate a transformation well underway in movie production, distribution and consumption.New revenue opportunities based on movie IP, such as video games, toys, books and theme parks.Other Ways You Can HelpGet the word out to everyone by sharing our campaign on your social media pages or use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
IN SEARCH OF WEEPING JIM

Hibernian Media NFP has been awarded a generous grant from The Consulate General of Ireland to further develop this film, IN SEARCH OF WEEPING JIM and we encourage you to join us in this journey of discovery of the life and times of James Ambrose Kearns and his family. It’s another great story of an Irishman who transformed America.

Hibernian Transmedia NFP is a public charity dedicated to Irish and Irish American culture. We tell stories to enlighten future generations while honoring our ancestors. 

All donations are tax-deductible.

James Ambrose Kearns was born to James and Catherine Quinn Kearns on January 13, 1871, on the tiny inner island of Inishcuttle, Kilmeena, County Mayo, Ireland. He emigrated to America in 1884 at the age of 13, attended St. Ignatius College Prep and Kent School of Law, becoming a lawyer in Chicago where he served as Alderman, Clerk of the Municipal Court and County Treasurer. He is considered “the father of the Chicago flag”.

He earned the moniker “Weeping Jim” from colleagues who had watched him at wakes as he campaigned, always offering his condolences and compassion for the bereaved families. It worked.

The story of Weeping Jim is the story of the Irish immigrant in America. They came, usually with nothing but the clothes on their backs, and with hard work, wit, and great faith, made their way until they were eventually ruling America.

This film tells the story of one man from County Mayo but could be the quintessential story for the Irish Diaspora.

Jim Kearns’ legacy for Chicago

On July 12, 1915, Alderman Kearns stood before his City Council colleagues and presented the following order.

“Whereas it is fitting and proper that the city of Chicago should have an emblem of its history, progress, enterprise and achievement made manifest in the shape and character of a municipal flag in order to symbolize properly the civic spirit of the city of Chicago, visualize local patriotism, stimulate industrial progress, and instill in the hearts of school children and of citizens a concrete evidence and example of the reality of the City of Chicago as a corporate  community and civic organism.”

The City Council then ordered that Mayor Big Bill Thompson make it happen, and he appointed Weeping Jim Kearns as the head of the commission. The rest is history.

In Ireland that year, a rebellion was brewing that would eventually create a republic, a “terrible beauty”.

In Chicago, a young man from Mayo may well have been sparked by that same spirit as he hoisted a flag to honor this most American of cities.

This is his story.

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently in post-production with this film and anticipate premiering the film in Chicago in September. We need your help financing the music, editing, licenses, and dozens of other expenses required in finishing a film. This story takes place across three centuries of folklore and fact, including seven pilgrimages to Ireland, most recently in 2020.

As Irish Catholics we are very proud that the city of Chicago flag can now be traced back to Ireland and the Irish Diaspora.

Hibernian Media has a brilliant and colorful history on stage, screen, and television under the direction of Chairman of the Board Mike Houlihan. Hibernian has premiered several films and TV shows on Chicago Public Television, produces a pair of weekly Irish Radio programs, broadcast every Saturday night on WSBC 1240AM as well as streaming worldwide on Global Irish Radio, GIR.ie, and is also the founder and producer of the Annual Irish American Movie Hooley film festival at the Gene Siskel Film Center. For more information please visit our websites, Hibernian Media,  Hibernian Radio, MovieHooley.org, and Weepingjim.org

In addition to very generous grants from the Irish Consulate of Chicago Emigrant Support Programme, The Richard H Driehaus Charitable Lead Trust, The Chicago Community Trust, The Benjamin & Bettina Van Cleave Foundation, and Culture Ireland; Hibernian Media has recently been awarded a 2:1 Matching Grant from Weeping Jim’s grandson Dennis A. Kearns for this film.

We encourage you to join us in this endeavor as we claim the flag of Chicago for Irish America.

All donations are welcome and if you can’t donate, please help spread the word to family and friends who could help with this bold endeavor. Please share links to this site as well taking advantage of the Indiegogo share tools.

We look forward to being with you in Chicago during the 150th year of Weeping Jim’s legacy as we premiere our film in September.

God bless you!

story:
Why I need your help

As you know, I've produced a surreal horror/comedy short film called "Cobwebs." This film was the culmination of research devoted to how the audio narrative plane can work with (or against) the visual narrative plane to do new things with storytelling. But forget about that for a second, forget the technical reason why the film exists. What's more important is the reaction that the film got. I'm overjoyed with my friends' and acquaintances' support of "Cobwebs." You've satisfied that artistic urge in me to be valued and simply seen and heard.

While making the film was a reward in itself, I want to take "Cobwebs" to its next natural stage, which is the festival run. What I'm asking is that if you liked the film or found it interesting, that you consider donating just $5 to help pay for festival costs.

The impact

This is a selfish request. But I've spent my own money on props, equipment, and some of the festival expenses for this film, as well as for the previous film that I helped make, "Kinesthesia." I'm hitting the point where spending more of my own money is not really wise. However, I know that it would be good for the film for it to hit exposure in other cities and states. I believe that surrealism and the mixture of horror and relationship drama is exactly what certain people in the world are craving right now. Not everything makes sense, and that's why art like this is so comforting. With your help, I can try to reach more people with that message. For that reason, I'm asking for some help in paying for the expenses that will help the film reach new audiences.

In closing

If you liked the film, please consider donating 5 (or more) dollars! If you can't afford this, I hold nothing against you. Your support, as I mentioned, has already been inspiring to me.

story:
NEW STRETCH GOAL: £30,000
NEXT STRETCH GOAL: £40,000

THE FILM IS NOW IN PRE-PRODUCTION, THANK YOU ALL FOR MAKING THIS POSSIBLE. NEW GOAL WILL HELP US COMPLETE THE FILM IN POST-PRODUCTION.

Plot Summary

From the creators of multi-award winning feature film HELP, Ridder Films brings you our second feature film - The Manor. 

An American film crew believe they have found the perfect location when they are led to a Victorian Manor House. We know what you're thinking... but this isn't your typical ghost story. As the characters slowly discover they are stuck in some kind of time loop... with the ghosts of themselves.

Proof of Concept Already Shot

From our ‘Proof of Concept’ film above, you can see what the opening of the film would look like and the potential the story has to grip an audience.

Who Are We?

We made our first feature HELP last year with the support from Indiegogo (see previous campaigns), and 6 months later, the film got completed and won multiple awards at festivals. It's now due for release later this year.


BLAKE RIDDER is an award winning writer/director and founder of RIDDER FILMS. He’s made over 25 short films on his ever growing YouTube channel and his devote feature film ‘Help’. 

He works closely with producer/actor LOUIS JAMES, who's starred in and produced multiple award winning films with Blake. To top it all off we also have the amazing producer LUCAS A. FERRARA, who's been supporting multiple Ridder Films for the past year. 

Location

From the concept film, we have secured a beautiful (also creepy) victorian manor. Which has been the home of many Hollywood films and numerous Netflix series. 

Cast

At the moment we have the following cast, but we are also hoping to bring in additional celebrity actors.

Kim Spearman
Louis James
Sarah Alexandra Marks
Rui Shang

Why We Need Your Help

The majority of the funding will go towards the unique location, talented actors and professional crew. We aspire to make this film our best yet but our main goal is to deliver one hell of a cinematic experience to our viewers.

With the right funding we know we will pull off a horror film that people will talk about and probably be too scared to watch for many years to come.

story:
Note: This project is not associated with the short documentary Águilas (dir. Kristy Guevara-Flanagan and Maite Zubiaurre, 2021).

Migration has consequences on both sides of the US-Mexico border: when somebody migrates, families and loved ones are left behind, and lives change forever. SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING tells the story of four migrants who take action into their own hands to help the families of other migrants lost in the Arizona desert.

Oaxacan activist Marisela Ortiz, co-founder with Ely Ortiz of the search and rescue group Aguilas del Desierto/Desert Eagles; Guatemalan activist Mirza Monterroso, Missing Migrant Program Director of the Colibri Center for Human Rights; and of Colombian artist Alvaro Enciso who has put out close to 1,000 crosses in the Arizonan desert to honor those who died are fundamental contributors to the “ecology of migrant care.” Their relentless altruism and powerful agency — despite having no resources or support — shed glaring light on the humanitarian crisis of migrant death escalating at the border.

Presentando SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING

La migración tiene consecuencias en ambos lados de la frontera entre México y Estados Unidos: cuando alguien emigra, las vidas de la familia y los seres queridos que se quedan cambian para siempre. SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING narra la historia de cuatro migrantes que toman la iniciativa de ayudar a familias de migrantes que desaparecieron en el desierto de Arizona al intentar cruzar hacia EEUU. Marisela Ortiz, activista oaxaqueña, cofundadora del grupo de búsqueda y rescate “Águilas del Desierto/Desert Eagles”; Mirza Monterroso, activista guatemalteca, Directora del Programa Migrante Desaparecido del Centro Colibrí para los Derechos Humanos; y Álvaro Enciso, artista colombiano que ha puesto cerca de 1,000 cruces en el desierto de Arizona para honrar a quienes han fallecido,  son los colaboradores fundamentales de “la ecología de atención al migrante”. Su altruismo inexorable y poderosa capacidad de intervención -sin contar con recursos ni apoyo - vierten  un rayo de luz sobre la muerte migrante y la creciente crisis humanitaria de la frontera. 

Exclusive first look at teaser #1 for SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING

Note: you can click on the blue title in the video image before clicking play to open the video in a new window, which will allow you to watch in full screen mode.
 

This documentary film project is produced and written by Maite Zubiaurre and Jonathan Crisman, two professors from UCLA and the University of Arizona. They have been researching the border issues behind SIN NADA for over six years, and felt that the issue was too important to remain within academic circles. Maite went on to make a short-length documentary specifically about the search and rescue group Aguilas del Desierto, titled Águilas (dir. Kristy Guevara-Flanagan & Maite Zubiaurre, 2021), which has gone on to receive numerous awards, including best short documentary at Big Sky, SXSW, and LALIFF, among others.

Nevertheless, a full-length documentary which captures the complexity of this issue and the ecology of migrant care is needed, along with more expertise about capturing lived border experiences on film. Dignicraft, a Tijuana-based film collective which includes Jose Luis Figueroa, Omar Foglio, and Paola Rodríguez, has been working on border, Latinx, and migration-related film projects for over 20 years, winning numerous awards (including an Emmy!) for their vision. They joined Maite and Jonathan as directors, co-writers, and co-producers in 2019, and we have been working together on SIN NADA since then.

Quienes somos

Esta película documental está escrita y producida por Maite Zubiaurre y Jonathan Crisman, profesores respectivamente de UCLA y de la Universidad de Arizona. Desde hace más de 6 años han realizado estudios sobre la grave crisis humanitaria que tiene lugar en la frontera y que se aborda en SIN NADA. Debido a la urgencia del tema, Zubiaurre y Crisman sintieron la necesidad de llevarlo más allá del círculo académico. Maite se dio a la tarea de hacer un corto documental específicamente sobre el grupo de búsqueda y rescate “Águilas del Desierto”,  titulado Águilas (Kristy Guevara-Flanagan y Maite Zubiaurre, 2021), el cual ha recibido importantes reconocimientos, entre ellos, los galardones al mejor corto documental que otorgan Big Sky, SXSW y LALIFF.

Sin embargo, para capturar la complejidad del problema y retratar la ecología de atención al migrante era necesario producir un largometraje documental donde se hiciera un abordaje más profundo sobre la vida en frontera. Para ello, Maite y Jonathan unieron fuerzas con Dignicraft, colectivo cinematográfico de Tijuana, cuyos miembros incluyen a José Luis Figueroa, Omar Foglio y Paola Rodríguez. Dignicraft ha producido películas documentales sobre migración y frontera desde hace más de 20 años y recibido numerosos premios por su trabajo (entre ellos ¡un Emmy!). En el 2019, José Luis, Omar y Paola se unieron a Maite y Jonathan como directores, co-guionistas y co-productores de SIN NADA.

We have already completed pre-production on our project, and also completed filming the first half of SIN NADA in Southern Arizona during 2020. We have already raised and spent $130,900 in these efforts, and now we are crowdfunding to raise the necessary money to complete production on the second half of SIN NADA which will be filmed in Mexico. The budget to finish the production phase of the project is $109,070, of which $56,700 is needed for filming in Mexico. We have already raised $20,600 in grants, so we are asking your help to raise the remaining $36,100 that we need to film in Mexico.

This is an especially important piece of the project because we hear directly from the families and see the home communities of those who have gone missing. These families have worked with activists Marisela Ortiz and Mirza Monterroso, and our goal is to fully represent the humanity and agency within this ecology of migrant care. We can’t do it without seeing these places and hearing these voices throughout key sites in Mexico, and we need your help to do it! Every dollar that we raise will go directly to the costs of travel, equipment rentals, and crew for filming in Mexico — we are committed to seeing this project through no matter what. Any additional funds we raise will go toward remaining production costs, post-production costs, and distribution costs.

Qué necesitamos

Hasta el momento está concluido el desarrollo del proyecto documental y también lo está la etapa de preproducción. Además, en el 2020 finalizamos la producción y rodaje de la primera parte de la película SIN NADA,  la cual tiene lugar en el sureste de Arizona. Hemos logrado recaudar y dedicado a los gastos de producción un total de $130,900 dólares, y ahora estamos iniciando una campaña de recaudación de fondos que nos permita acumular el dinero necesario para realizar la producción de la segunda parte de SIN NADA, que se filmará en México. El presupuesto total para el resto de la etapa de producción, es de $109,070 dólares, de los cuales $56,700 se utilizarán para cubrir el rodaje en México. Ya hemos recaudado $20,600 dólares a través de fondos y becas,pero  ahora acudimos a ti para recaudar el remanente de $36,100 dólares necesarios para costear lo más prioritario de la producción.  

Esta etapa es una parte especialmente importante del proyecto porque nos da la oportunidad de escuchar la voz de las familias y conocer de primera mano las comunidades de origen de quienes han partido sin retorno. Estas familias han colaborado de cerca con los personajes que aparecen en el documental, y nuestro objetivo es representar en profundidad su carácter humano y participación en la ecología de atención al migrante. Estamos seguros de que no podríamos lograrlo sin retratar esos  lugares y escuchar esas voces, ¡por eso necesitamos tu ayuda! Cada dólar recaudado irá directamente a los gastos de viaje, renta de equipo y apoyos para colaboradores durante la filmación en México; estamos comprometidos a llevar este proyecto a su fin pase lo que pase.

Take a look at the range of perks you can receive with a donation — we are excited to partner with you, and want to give you credit for helping us finish the film! Even with smaller donation amounts, we will give you credit online and in the film credits, and will invite you to a special screening of the documentary once it is released. Since many of the participants in the project, including people featured within the narrative, are artists, we are providing limited edition art prints and sculptures with a larger donation. And at the highest amount, we will provide special in-person experiences in Los Angeles and Mexico City. We also have an option for you to join on board as an associate producer! Please note that Indiegogo donations are NOT tax deductible — if you require a tax deductible receipt, please contact us directly prior to donating. Also please note that the images included to the left with perk descriptions are illustrative and not representative of how the final perk will look.

Most of all, you will receive the satisfaction of having an impact by helping to raise awareness about this urgent issue. We will keep you in the loop with updates about the progress of the film — and our efforts to screen it to policymakers in our effort to make positive change along the border through our project.

Qué ofrecemos a cambio y la importancia de tu contribución

¡Échale un ojo al abanico de beneficios que puedes obtener a cambio de tu contribución! Nos hace mucha ilusión colaborar contigo y nos encantaría darte el crédito que te mereces por ayudarnos a finalizar el documental. Incluso las donaciones menores recibirán agradecimientos en plataformas web y en los créditos de la película, además, invitaremos a nuestros colaboradores a una presentación especial del documental cuando se celebre el lanzamiento. Como muchos de los involucrados en el proyecto, incluyendo los personajes que aparecen en el documental, son artistas, las contribuiciones más generosas serán premiadas con ediciones especiales de obras escultóricas o piezas artísticas impresas. Y a aquel que realice la aportación mayor le ofreceremos una estancia y experiencia excepcionales a escoger en los lugares donde sucederá la filmación: Los Ángeles o la Ciudad de México.  Así mismo, ¡te invitamos a formar parte del equipo como productor asociado! Por otro lado, si estás interesado en aportar una suma considerable y requieres un recibo para deducción de impuestos, contáctanos directamente antes de realizar tu donativo, ya que las donaciones a través de Indiegogo no son deducibles de impuestos.

Lo más importante es que obtendrás la satisfacción de haber contribuido a crear conciencia sobre este tema de gran urgencia. Te mantendremos informado acerca del progreso de la producción de la película y sabrás sobre nuestros esfuerzos por presentar el documental a los responsables de las políticas públicas. Uno de los objetivos fundamentales precisamente de nuestro proyecto es dar a conocer una realidad que influya positivamente en la situación fronteriza.

Our team includes expertise in both content about border issues and in the practice of filmmaking, and we are fully committed to seeing our project through. We feel that this issue is too urgent and important to ignore, and will move forward no matter what issues come up. As is standard, we are securing the necessary insurances and permissions that come with a film project of this scale.

Our biggest challenge has been dealing with the effects of COVID-19 which made filming in Southern Arizona difficult due to its impacts on facilities being open, availability of locations and featured individuals, and on the process of filmmaking. We took all the best practice precautions against spread in our crew and successfully finished that portion of the project. We anticipate similar issues as we film in Mexico, including having to be flexible with our schedule, having extra costs for preventative measures, and putting extra care into planning to ensure that we have access to everything we need despite the pandemic. 

Riesgos y oportunidades

Nuestro equipo de trabajo cuenta con experiencia tanto en las problemáticas fronterizas desde el campo académico como en la producción cinematográfica. Estamos profundamente comprometidos con este proyecto. Este tema es de una relevancia y urgencia tales que no se puede ignorar y vamos a seguir adelante con el documental sin importar las dificultades que puedan surgir. Contamos con los seguros y permisos de producción necesarios para emprender un proyecto documental de esta magnitud. 

Nuestro mayor reto ha sido lidiar con las consecuencias de Covid-19 que complicaron la filmación en el sureste de Arizona,  al ocasionar el cierre de oficinas, limitar la disponibilidad de espacios para el rodaje, y dificultar  los encuentros con los personajes de la película. Tomamos todas las medidas preventivas  necesarias para evitar la propagación del virus y logramos finalizar satisfactoriamente esta primera parte del rodaje. Es muy posible que enfrentemos  situaciones similares durante la filmación en México. Por tanto, nuestro plan de producción es flexible y hemos incluido costos adicionales para afrontar cambios inesperados. Una Planeación cuidadosa y estratégica garantizará que tengamos acceso a todo lo necesario, a pesar de la pandemia. 

We need your help in spreading the word about our crowdfunding campaign! Please consider sharing a link to our Indiegogo page via your social media accounts, or sending it directly to friends and family who you think might be interested in supporting our project. Thank you!

Contact and follow us!

Please follow and amplify our campaign via social media! You can find us on Instagram @sinnada.info and on Facebook @sinnada.info. If you want to reach out to us via email, you can contact us at film@sinnada.info.

Otras maneras de contribuir

Si no puedes hacer una aportación monetaria, ¡por favor ayúdanos a correr la voz sobre la campaña de recaudación de fondos! Puedes compartir el enlace a la página de nuestra campaña en Indiegogo a través de tus redes sociales, o enviarlo directamente a tus amigos, familiares o a quien pienses que podría estar interesado en apoyar nuestro proyecto, ¡muchas gracias!

¡Contacta y síguenos!

¡Síguenos en redes sociales y ayúdanos a que nuestra campaña llegue a más personas! Puedes encontrarnos en Instagram @sinnada.info y en Facebook @sinnada.info. También puedes enviarnos un correo electrónico a film@sininada.info.
story_txt:
Note: This project is not associated with the short documentary Águilas (dir. Kristy Guevara-Flanagan and Maite Zubiaurre, 2021).Migration has consequences on both sides of the US-Mexico border: when somebody migrates, families and loved ones are left behind, and lives change forever. SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING tells the story of four migrants who take action into their own hands to help the families of other migrants lost in the Arizona desert.Oaxacan activist Marisela Ortiz, co-founder with Ely Ortiz of the search and rescue group Aguilas del Desierto/Desert Eagles; Guatemalan activist Mirza Monterroso, Missing Migrant Program Director of the Colibri Center for Human Rights; and of Colombian artist Alvaro Enciso who has put out close to 1,000 crosses in the Arizonan desert to honor those who died are fundamental contributors to the “ecology of migrant care.” Their relentless altruism and powerful agency — despite having no resources or support — shed glaring light on the humanitarian crisis of migrant death escalating at the border.Presentando SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING
La migración tiene consecuencias en ambos lados de la frontera entre México y Estados Unidos: cuando alguien emigra, las vidas de la familia y los seres queridos que se quedan cambian para siempre. SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING narra la historia de cuatro migrantes que toman la iniciativa de ayudar a familias de migrantes que desaparecieron en el desierto de Arizona al intentar cruzar hacia EEUU. Marisela Ortiz, activista oaxaqueña, cofundadora del grupo de búsqueda y rescate “Águilas del Desierto/Desert Eagles”; Mirza Monterroso, activista guatemalteca, Directora del Programa Migrante Desaparecido del Centro Colibrí para los Derechos Humanos; y Álvaro Enciso, artista colombiano que ha puesto cerca de 1,000 cruces en el desierto de Arizona para honrar a quienes han fallecido,  son los colaboradores fundamentales de “la ecología de atención al migrante”. Su altruismo inexorable y poderosa capacidad de intervención -sin contar con recursos ni apoyo - vierten  un rayo de luz sobre la muerte migrante y la creciente crisis humanitaria de la frontera. Exclusive first look at teaser #1 for SIN NADA / WITH NOTHING
Note: you can click on the blue title in the video image before clicking play to open the video in a new window, which will allow you to watch in full screen mode. This documentary film project is produced and written by Maite Zubiaurre and Jonathan Crisman, two professors from UCLA and the University of Arizona. They have been researching the border issues behind SIN NADA for over six years, and felt that the issue was too important to remain within academic circles. Maite went on to make a short-length documentary specifically about the search and rescue group Aguilas del Desierto, titled Águilas (dir. Kristy Guevara-Flanagan & Maite Zubiaurre, 2021), which has gone on to receive numerous awards, including best short documentary at Big Sky, SXSW, and LALIFF, among others.Nevertheless, a full-length documentary which captures the complexity of this issue and the ecology of migrant care is needed, along with more expertise about capturing lived border experiences on film. Dignicraft, a Tijuana-based film collective which includes Jose Luis Figueroa, Omar Foglio, and Paola Rodríguez, has been working on border, Latinx, and migration-related film projects for over 20 years, winning numerous awards (including an Emmy!) for their vision. They joined Maite and Jonathan as directors, co-writers, and co-producers in 2019, and we have been working together on SIN NADA since then.Quienes somosEsta película documental está escrita y producida por Maite Zubiaurre y Jonathan Crisman, profesores respectivamente de UCLA y de la Universidad de Arizona. Desde hace más de 6 años han realizado estudios sobre la grave crisis humanitaria que tiene lugar en la frontera y que se aborda en SIN NADA. Debido a la urgencia del tema, Zubiaurre y Crisman sintieron la necesidad de llevarlo más allá del círculo académico. Maite se dio a la tarea de hacer un corto documental específicamente sobre el grupo de búsqueda y rescate “Águilas del Desierto”,  titulado Águilas (Kristy Guevara-Flanagan y Maite Zubiaurre, 2021), el cual ha recibido importantes reconocimientos, entre ellos, los galardones al mejor corto documental que otorgan Big Sky, SXSW y LALIFF.Sin embargo, para capturar la complejidad del problema y retratar la ecología de atención al migrante era necesario producir un largometraje documental donde se hiciera un abordaje más profundo sobre la vida en frontera. Para ello, Maite y Jonathan unieron fuerzas con Dignicraft, colectivo cinematográfico de Tijuana, cuyos miembros incluyen a José Luis Figueroa, Omar Foglio y Paola Rodríguez. Dignicraft ha producido películas documentales sobre migración y frontera desde hace más de 20 años y recibido numerosos premios por su trabajo (entre ellos ¡un Emmy!). En el 2019, José Luis, Omar y Paola se unieron a Maite y Jonathan como directores, co-guionistas y co-productores de SIN NADA.We have already completed pre-production on our project, and also completed filming the first half of SIN NADA in Southern Arizona during 2020. We have already raised and spent $130,900 in these efforts, and now we are crowdfunding to raise the necessary money to complete production on the second half of SIN NADA which will be filmed in Mexico. The budget to finish the production phase of the project is $109,070, of which $56,700 is needed for filming in Mexico. We have already raised $20,600 in grants, so we are asking your help to raise the remaining $36,100 that we need to film in Mexico.This is an especially important piece of the project because we hear directly from the families and see the home communities of those who have gone missing. These families have worked with activists Marisela Ortiz and Mirza Monterroso, and our goal is to fully represent the humanity and agency within this ecology of migrant care. We can’t do it without seeing these places and hearing these voices throughout key sites in Mexico, and we need your help to do it! Every dollar that we raise will go directly to the costs of travel, equipment rentals, and crew for filming in Mexico — we are committed to seeing this project through no matter what. Any additional funds we raise will go toward remaining production costs, post-production costs, and distribution costs.Qué necesitamosHasta el momento está concluido el desarrollo del proyecto documental y también lo está la etapa de preproducción. Además, en el 2020 finalizamos la producción y rodaje de la primera parte de la película SIN NADA,  la cual tiene lugar en el sureste de Arizona. Hemos logrado recaudar y dedicado a los gastos de producción un total de $130,900 dólares, y ahora estamos iniciando una campaña de recaudación de fondos que nos permita acumular el dinero necesario para realizar la producción de la segunda parte de SIN NADA, que se filmará en México. El presupuesto total para el resto de la etapa de producción, es de $109,070 dólares, de los cuales $56,700 se utilizarán para cubrir el rodaje en México. Ya hemos recaudado $20,600 dólares a través de fondos y becas,pero  ahora acudimos a ti para recaudar el remanente de $36,100 dólares necesarios para costear lo más prioritario de la producción.  Esta etapa es una parte especialmente importante del proyecto porque nos da la oportunidad de escuchar la voz de las familias y conocer de primera mano las comunidades de origen de quienes han partido sin retorno. Estas familias han colaborado de cerca con los personajes que aparecen en el documental, y nuestro objetivo es representar en profundidad su carácter humano y participación en la ecología de atención al migrante. Estamos seguros de que no podríamos lograrlo sin retratar esos  lugares y escuchar esas voces, ¡por eso necesitamos tu ayuda! Cada dólar recaudado irá directamente a los gastos de viaje, renta de equipo y apoyos para colaboradores durante la filmación en México; estamos comprometidos a llevar este proyecto a su fin pase lo que pase.Take a look at the range of perks you can receive with a donation — we are excited to partner with you, and want to give you credit for helping us finish the film! Even with smaller donation amounts, we will give you credit online and in the film credits, and will invite you to a special screening of the documentary once it is released. Since many of the participants in the project, including people featured within the narrative, are artists, we are providing limited edition art prints and sculptures with a larger donation. And at the highest amount, we will provide special in-person experiences in Los Angeles and Mexico City. We also have an option for you to join on board as an associate producer! Please note that Indiegogo donations are NOT tax deductible — if you require a tax deductible receipt, please contact us directly prior to donating. Also please note that the images included to the left with perk descriptions are illustrative and not representative of how the final perk will look.Most of all, you will receive the satisfaction of having an impact by helping to raise awareness about this urgent issue. We will keep you in the loop with updates about the progress of the film — and our efforts to screen it to policymakers in our effort to make positive change along the border through our project.Qué ofrecemos a cambio y la importancia de tu contribución¡Échale un ojo al abanico de beneficios que puedes obtener a cambio de tu contribución! Nos hace mucha ilusión colaborar contigo y nos encantaría darte el crédito que te mereces por ayudarnos a finalizar el documental. Incluso las donaciones menores recibirán agradecimientos en plataformas web y en los créditos de la película, además, invitaremos a nuestros colaboradores a una presentación especial del documental cuando se celebre el lanzamiento. Como muchos de los involucrados en el proyecto, incluyendo los personajes que aparecen en el documental, son artistas, las contribuiciones más generosas serán premiadas con ediciones especiales de obras escultóricas o piezas artísticas impresas. Y a aquel que realice la aportación mayor le ofreceremos una estancia y experiencia excepcionales a escoger en los lugares donde sucederá la filmación: Los Ángeles o la Ciudad de México.  Así mismo, ¡te invitamos a formar parte del equipo como productor asociado! Por otro lado, si estás interesado en aportar una suma considerable y requieres un recibo para deducción de impuestos, contáctanos directamente antes de realizar tu donativo, ya que las donaciones a través de Indiegogo no son deducibles de impuestos.Lo más importante es que obtendrás la satisfacción de haber contribuido a crear conciencia sobre este tema de gran urgencia. Te mantendremos informado acerca del progreso de la producción de la película y sabrás sobre nuestros esfuerzos por presentar el documental a los responsables de las políticas públicas. Uno de los objetivos fundamentales precisamente de nuestro proyecto es dar a conocer una realidad que influya positivamente en la situación fronteriza.Our team includes expertise in both content about border issues and in the practice of filmmaking, and we are fully committed to seeing our project through. We feel that this issue is too urgent and important to ignore, and will move forward no matter what issues come up. As is standard, we are securing the necessary insurances and permissions that come with a film project of this scale.Our biggest challenge has been dealing with the effects of COVID-19 which made filming in Southern Arizona difficult due to its impacts on facilities being open, availability of locations and featured individuals, and on the process of filmmaking. We took all the best practice precautions against spread in our crew and successfully finished that portion of the project. We anticipate similar issues as we film in Mexico, including having to be flexible with our schedule, having extra costs for preventative measures, and putting extra care into planning to ensure that we have access to everything we need despite the pandemic. Riesgos y oportunidadesNuestro equipo de trabajo cuenta con experiencia tanto en las problemáticas fronterizas desde el campo académico como en la producción cinematográfica. Estamos profundamente comprometidos con este proyecto. Este tema es de una relevancia y urgencia tales que no se puede ignorar y vamos a seguir adelante con el documental sin importar las dificultades que puedan surgir. Contamos con los seguros y permisos de producción necesarios para emprender un proyecto documental de esta magnitud. Nuestro mayor reto ha sido lidiar con las consecuencias de Covid-19 que complicaron la filmación en el sureste de Arizona,  al ocasionar el cierre de oficinas, limitar la disponibilidad de espacios para el rodaje, y dificultar  los encuentros con los personajes de la película. Tomamos todas las medidas preventivas  necesarias para evitar la propagación del virus y logramos finalizar satisfactoriamente esta primera parte del rodaje. Es muy posible que enfrentemos  situaciones similares durante la filmación en México. Por tanto, nuestro plan de producción es flexible y hemos incluido costos adicionales para afrontar cambios inesperados. Una Planeación cuidadosa y estratégica garantizará que tengamos acceso a todo lo necesario, a pesar de la pandemia. We need your help in spreading the word about our crowdfunding campaign! Please consider sharing a link to our Indiegogo page via your social media accounts, or sending it directly to friends and family who you think might be interested in supporting our project. Thank you!Contact and follow us!Please follow and amplify our campaign via social media! You can find us on Instagram @sinnada.info and on Facebook @sinnada.info. If you want to reach out to us via email, you can contact us at film@sinnada.info.Otras maneras de contribuirSi no puedes hacer una aportación monetaria, ¡por favor ayúdanos a correr la voz sobre la campaña de recaudación de fondos! Puedes compartir el enlace a la página de nuestra campaña en Indiegogo a través de tus redes sociales, o enviarlo directamente a tus amigos, familiares o a quien pienses que podría estar interesado en apoyar nuestro proyecto, ¡muchas gracias!¡Contacta y síguenos!¡Síguenos en redes sociales y ayúdanos a que nuestra campaña llegue a más personas! Puedes encontrarnos en Instagram @sinnada.info y en Facebook @sinnada.info. También puedes enviarnos un correo electrónico a film@sininada.info.

story:
The Movie

My name is Peter Pardini, and I have been dreaming about this day for a long time. In late 2015, I came up with an idea to make a thriller set on an Indian reservation and I asked my wife Katherine (an actress/producer) if she would join me in trying to get it made.

The log line is:

It's 1988. A Native American hitman tries to get involved in his identical twin brother's new casino business. 

"The Buffalo" Concept Art by Faith Randolph.

American/Indian is a dark thriller with comedic elements in the style of the Coen Brothers, David Lynch, etc. But most importantly, it will be a movie told in our voice as filmmakers.

We had a dream cast in mind for our lead characters, including Academy Award-Winner Wes Studi (Last of the Mohicans, Heat, Hostiles) and Adam Beach (Flags of Our Fathers, Windtalkers, Suicide Squad). It felt like a pipe dream because we did not have any connection to either but after many emails, phone calls, and eventually meetings, we now officially have both in the roles that were written for them.

We don't have the funds to make the feature film but the feature script is getting great response from potential financiers and we are being asked to first create a PROOF-OF-CONCEPT piece for the film. This is what Damien Chazelle (director of La La Land & First Man) did for his movie Whiplash. In order to receive funding to make the real thing, he had to shoot a piece of the movie to prove himself as a director. 

For us, this means shooting 3-4 scenes and miscellaneous "shots" selected from the feature script so that I can cut together the scenes as well as a 1-2 minute teaser trailer showing the style and concept of the film.

This may be the only way to get this movie made. We have everything else in order from major cast to the crew, and this proof-of-concept should push us the extra step forward. 

Katherine is co-producing the short with Erik Reese, an extremely talented director in his own right as well as a great producer. Our cinematographer is Kevin Schlanser, an award-winning filmmaker who is going to make the short look incredible. Wes Studi and Adam Beach will both be producing the feature film with Katherine and Erik when it's ultimately made.

"Slim's Showdown with the Buffalo" Concept Art by Faith Randolph

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $5,000 for the short materials, which we want to shoot over three days in August in Austin, TX. 

This will cover:

Crew travel, equipment, food, props and set design and all the little things that arise in making a film.

Check out the perks!

We truly appreciate it.

The Impact

We know this project is an opportunity to tell a unique story that has never been seen on the big screen before. Wes and Adam are two of the most talented actors in the world and this is an amazing opportunity for us to collaborate with them and make something truly memorable.

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!

"Buffalo in the Road" Concept Art by Faith Randolph

"Joe and the Casino" Concept Art by Faith Randolph

FILMMAKERS

PETER PARDINI (writer/director)

Peter directed and produced Now More Than Ever: The History of Chicago, the official documentary about the band Chicago. It premiered on CNN Films to 2 million viewers and later on Netflix and Amazon Prime. He also directed festival favorite Black Cat and Rolling Thunder (also featuring Wes Studi) as well as FAT: A Documentary, which was #1 on iTunes and Amazon in its initial release.

KATHERINE MUISE (producer/actress "Candace")

Katherine is an actress and producer, who has appeared in such films as Now More Than Ever: The History of Chicago, Magical Red Wedding, Black Cat and has appeared in ads for companies like 7-Eleven and Lone Star Credit Ag. She has worked closely with Peter to produce many films and shorts and will be playing the character of Candace in the feature film.

WES STUDI (actor, "Slim" & "Joe")

Wes Studi has appeared in more than 80 film and television productions, including Hostiles, Last of the Mohicans, Heat, Geronimo: An American Legend, Being Flynn, Avatar, Comanche Moon, Streets of Laredo, Mystery Men, Kings, The New World, Hell on Wheels, Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee and Seraphim Falls. He also brought Tony Hillerman's "Lieutenant Joe Leaphorn" to life in a series of PBS specials produced by Robert Redford called Skinwalkers, Coyote Waits, and A Thief of Time (2004).

In 2019, he won an Academy Award for his lifetime of work in motion pictures.

ADAM BEACH (actor, "Carl")

Adam Beach is best known for his roles as Victor in Smoke Signals, Frank Fencepost in Dance Me Outside, Tommy on Walker, Texas Ranger, Kickin' Wing in Joe Dirt, U.S. Marine Corporal Ira Hayes in Flags of Our Fathers, Private Ben Yahzee in Windtalkers, Dr. Charles Eastman (Ohiyesa) in Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee, NYPD Detective Chester Lake in Law & Order: Special Victims Unit, and Officer Jim Chee in the film adaptations of Skinwalkers, Coyote Waits, and A Thief of Time. He starred in the Canadian 2012-2014 series Arctic Air, and played Slipknot in the 2016 film Suicide Squad. He also performed as Squanto in Disney's historical drama film Squanto: A Warrior's Tale. Most recently he has starred in Hostiles as Black Hawk, and the Netflix original film Juanita as Jess Gardiner.

ERIK REESE (producer)

Erik Reese is a producer and director, known for Dead Bullet, Train to Stockholm and Pickaxe. He has worked closely with the film company Sabi and has directed and produced numerous commercials and short films as well as feature films.

KEVIN SCHLANSER (cinematographer)

Kevin Schlanser is an award-winning filmmaker and cinematographer. His film The Ataxian won Best Documentary at the 2016 Sedona International Film Festival. He has also shot numerous shorts for famed comedy juggernaut Funny or Die.

"Bo Strickland" Concept Art by Faith Randolph

RISKS

As with any production, there are risks due to day of "acts of God" like weather, food being late, production delays due to something on set breaking, etc. Outside of the obvious risks, we are pushing forward on this and shooting August 1-3 unless something changes that we don't foresee right now.

That being said, if this production does not go forward for any reason whatsoever, we will return your donation to you.

story:
A Yemeni is an award-winning short dramatic screenplay that will be produced in an advanced directing course at the USC School of Cinematic Arts in the graduate Film & TV production program.

A Yemeni won first place in the USC Women of Cinematic Arts Feminist film festival. The screenplay ranked in numerous highly competitive industry screenplay competitions and Academy Award qualifying film festivals, including Screencraft, BlueCat, Atlanta Film Festival, and HollyShorts.  

With your support, you will empower our creative process. Most importantly, by donating, you are joining our creative vision to bring awareness to a dire humanitarian crisis in Yemen through the craft of narrative filmmaking. 

The story follows the emotional journey of Salim, a Somalian refugee in Yemen, who is compelled to help his fiance's gravely ill grandfather. On their journey to seek medical care, they encounter a violent event in the desert that devastates Salim. He loses everything. Salim must now cope with the loss and live with his fatal mistake. 

About Filmmakers

Alyssa Amer- Writer/Director

Alyssa Amer is a filmmaker based in Los Angeles, CA. She was born and raised in the Washington, DC area and New York City. She is a graduate of New York University, Gallatin School of Individualized Study. Her interdisciplinary education concentrated on screenwriting and the entertainment business. She will complete her graduate degree at the USC School of Cinematic Arts, Film & TV Production division in Fall 2021.

She is a filmmaker, with training and experience in writing, directing, and cinematography.  She co-wrote a horror feature film currently available on Amazon Prime Video. She wrote, shot and produced a short horror film released by Screamfest in 2020. She has also written micro-short horror scripts for Crypt TV.  Alyssa works as a collaborator on horror, science fiction, and dramatic projects. She has worked in support and leadership roles within the independent, mini-major, and studio environment in creative, logistical, and business roles.

 

Daniel Sheahan - Producer

Daniel Sheahan  is a graduate student currently completing his MFA at the USC School of Cinematic Arts, where he is a George Lucas Scholar. Ever since a young age, he has felt a calling toward public expression. At age 12, he won the Sacramento Kid Casters public speaking competition, giving him the opportunity to interview then World #1 tennis player Andre Agassi for Fox Sports. He continued his pursuit of public speaking during high school, becoming the national champion in dramatic interpretation of literature in 2009.

He obtained a Bachelor’s degree in film production from John Paul the Great Catholic University, and a Graduate Certificate in Digital Marketing from Cornell. He utilized these skills to co-found a film production company called IE Atlas Productions in 2013. They specialized in creating media for San Diego area law firms, including one series of videos that was responsible for the opposition settling for over $1 million.

He joined the MFA program at USC in Spring, 2019, and has since produced numerous films which have screened at festivals around the world, including Spokespeople, a documentary about the lack of access to public transportation in Los Angeles. The film won first place short doc at Flickers Rhode Island International Festival, the grand prize at the Filmed by Bike Festival in Portland Oregon, and was an award winner at the Better Cities Film Festival in Detroit Michigan, amidst dozens of other awards and selections.

 

Gülnigar Ralph-Nurhikim- Director of Photography

Gülnigar Ralph-Nurhikim is a third-year MFA student in Film & TV Production at the USC School of Cinematic Arts. With an equal interest in both science and arts, Gülnigar studied Physics and Film History at Emory University in Atlanta, before coming to USC in 2018. At Emory, she conducted research on the biophysical analysis of bacterial growth while continuing her study on Hollywood Censorship Era using archival resources on the Production Code. She graduated from Emory in 2017, with a BA in Film Studies and a BS in Physics with Magna Cum Laude distinction. Always passionate about merging science and art, and with an early interest in still photography, Gülnigar realized cinematography is what she would like to pursue at film school. Not only the technology and science (namely physics) behind cinematography fascinate her, but also the immense psychological effects of lighting, framing, and camera movement have on the audience captivate her. She believes narrating the story effectively through visuals is the bare minimum in cinematography; the real challenge and the fun part is to build the connection between the audience and the story world, to make them feel and react in a specific way using specific techniques in cinematography. The short films she directed and shot have been screened at film festivals in the United States, Italy, Austria, Portugal, India, Brazil, and the UK. Currently, she works as a cinematography TA at USC and an archival coordinator at the American Society of Cinematographers. 

Nidhi S. Kulkarni - Production Designer

Nidhi S. Kulkarni is an upcoming producer-production designer who loves realistic, character-driven stories. She believes in using film as a medium to portray the complexities of life, but also has a soft corner for various genres like Romance Dramas, Musicals, and Crime Thrillers. She is in her final semester at USC School of Cinematic Arts where she is pursuing her MFA in Film and Television Production. She graduated top of her class with a Bachelor of Creative Arts from Srishti Institute of Art, Design, and Technology, Bangalore. 

Amidst COVID-19, Nidhi safely and successfully completed the production of a BAFTA-GSA grant winner short “WITNESS”. Prior to that, she produced a USC-funded advanced documentary project called “IN HER CORNER” which premiered at the Catalina International Film Festival 2020. Before coming to USC, Nidhi worked as an assistant director on Rohit Shetty’s first Marathi film “School, College ani Life”. She also worked as an assistant director to Anusha Bose on her Royal Stag Large Short “SHAME” which premiered at the New York Indian Film Festival 2018. 

Apart from producing, Nidhi enjoys production design. Alongside her producing projects, she has also worked as a production designer on an independent short “Kyle’s Kreamery” which was selected at the LA Indie Short Fest 2021. And just recently finished working on a USC thesis film called “Mantis Club”

 

Budget

Meals for cast and crew- 800

Production Design- 2,700

Wardrobe- 500

Production Sound & Sound Design - 1,000
story_txt:
A Yemeni is an award-winning short dramatic screenplay that will be produced in an advanced directing course at the USC School of Cinematic Arts in the graduate Film & TV production program.
A Yemeni won first place in the USC Women of Cinematic Arts Feminist film festival. The screenplay ranked in numerous highly competitive industry screenplay competitions and Academy Award qualifying film festivals, including Screencraft, BlueCat, Atlanta Film Festival, and HollyShorts.  
With your support, you will empower our creative process. Most importantly, by donating, you are joining our creative vision to bring awareness to a dire humanitarian crisis in Yemen through the craft of narrative filmmaking. 
The story follows the emotional journey of Salim, a Somalian refugee in Yemen, who is compelled to help his fiance's gravely ill grandfather. On their journey to seek medical care, they encounter a violent event in the desert that devastates Salim. He loses everything. Salim must now cope with the loss and live with his fatal mistake. 
About Filmmakers
Alyssa Amer- Writer/Director
