story:
Feature Film by Sam Medina
[Writer & Director]

Visit our website and get Sam Medina's collection. 

The Story

Based on true events, our story follows a Marine, Daniel Gonzales, who enlisted after September 9/11. He had a 40-year plan to serve his country but unfortunately, a tragic event while  performing his duty in Afghanistan left him bound to a wheelchair. He was lucky to survive but some of his teammates did not. With a punctured lung pierced by bullets, Daniel's body could not supply enough oxygen to his brain. Laying there unconscious while the doctors did their best to bring him back to life, Daniel's fate was in the hands of God. Luckily, he pulled through. After being diagnosed with cerebral palsy, severe nerve damage to his lower back and his lower extremities, Daniel just like many other soldiers, suffered from PTSD.

Although after surviving that fateful day, the war only begins after Daniel arrives back home. This film will show what happens to a soldier after being discharged from the military. 

Despite all the struggles with depression and so many other obstacles, Daniel gets up every morning and fights. A fight within himself to make his life as normal as it can be.

"I am ready to live life not as a handicap person or a disabled veteran.
I just want to live life as Daniel." Daniel Gonzales

This film is about how each and everyone of us can contribute
to our veterans in any way, shape or form.

Sam Medina will portray Daniel Gonzales.

 

Introducing Charles Rooney, who is also a Marine.

Charles is a Vietnam War Veteran who will play Daniel's mentor in this film.  Charles' war experience is crucial to Daniel's survival. Due to the fact of PTSD, many people do not understand how a soldier feels except another soldier. 

Not a day goes by that Charles does not feel guilty about being alive, (Survival's Guilt). He along so many soldiers want to die on that battlefield so they won't be forgotten.

Being in the military gives guys like Charles and Daniel a sense or purpose, a sense of belonging, a brotherhood that bonds for a lifetime.

It is the brotherhood and the mentality of never leaving any man behind that this film will show our audience what it means to be a soldier.

 

About Sam Medina Film Director|Actor

Visit Sam's profile: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2795989/

When not in front of the cameras, Actor Sam Medina also lends his talent as a Director for Episodic Television Shows and Films.

Medina joins Robert Rodriguez family of actors, on more time, lending his talent in the animated feature Alita Battle Angel, written and produced by JAMES CAMERON. He also featured opposite of Tom Hardy in the Marvel adventure Venom, and in one of his most important role to date as the lead antagonist opposite Mark Wahlberg in director PETER BERG’S Mile 22.

Sam has just wrapped the upcoming Sci-Fi/Thriller Reminiscence as an important supporting character sharing the screen with Hugh Jackman and Rebecca Ferguson.

During his 15 year-career, Sam has been honored to work with numerous legendary DIRECTORS with superb vision for filmography and learn the art of directing: OLIVER STONE, ROBERT RODRIGUEZ, ANTOINE FUQUA, MARTIN CAMPBELL, EDWARD ZWICK-AND PETER BERG.

Sam Medina Director Reel

 

Why this project is important for us?

  • This campaign will help us to make an amazing and heartfelt project about Veterans who need our help lessening their burdens returning to our society. Although some soldiers do get help, the long lasting effect of war weighs heavily with them for the rest of their lives. For most Veterans, they do not survive the guilt.
    On an average, 22 Veterans commit suicide every day.
  • This film is a personal project for Sam Medina to give back and uplift our Veterans and it is with utmost importance that we come together to show them we care and appreciate what they have done for our country.

 

"As I'm writing this, I can hardly contain my tears, I'm sure many of you will feel the same way." Sam Medina

To all our contributors:

The magnitude of what we can accomplish together is crucial to make this project come to life.

As much or as little that each and everyone of you who donate to this campaign, you will help us honoring our Veterans. To let them know that we have not forgotten about soldiers
like Daniel and Charles. 

                     

What do we need and what do you get?

  • The funding will cover the pre-production, production and post-production of the movie.
  • Some proceeds will go to different charities for Veterans.
  • We do offer unique perks that will give you the opportunity to be part of a movie but also to contribute to a cause and help those who have served the United States of America.
  • The film is going to be made, even if the goal is not reached.
  •  To enhance the content of the film, we will pitch studios with the rough cut to be able to do flashback scenes in Afghanistan.

 

The Impact

Here is what difference and impact your contribution will make: 

  • Many soldiers have died so we can live in peace. It is our duty to never forget the blanket of freedom that our men and women in the military provide for us with blood and sacrifice.
  • 22 - The Unforgotten Soldier project is ultimately a goal to save as many lives as we can.
  • By making this project goes worldwide, we have done our job as a human being helping out one another, men or women.
  • With our contributors' help, we can achieve this. We can help their voices to live on for those who have died defending our great country.

 

 

 

Strengths & Opportunities

We would like to share our strengths and opportunities to give you a clear and transparent insight on how we will deliver a project of quality.

  • Sam has been working more than 15 years in the film industry under some of the best DIRECTORS that have enabled him to overcome many challenges he's already faced during his time as a director for a TV Series "Sons of Thunder" under Pureflix, a faith-base streaming services.
  • Sam will bring the same effort, intensity, dedication and hardworking mentality to lead our team into the right direction in this project.
  • Over a decade, we have developed amazing relationships with strong Cast and Crew that will join us in order to make this project.
    • Larry R Mckee, is a winning award Cinematographer who will join us for this task. Having all his own cameras, grip and lighting equipment reduces our budget tremendously.

​

Visit Larry's profile: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1436548/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

  • We are also able to do post production at our facility to cut down more cost [Edit | Sound | Color Correction].

​

 

  • Being an ACTOR, it helps Sam to bring forth the best out of himself and other actors involved in this projects, which will be mostly Veterans.

 

From Sam Medina:

"Challenges are on every project from a low budget film to a 200 million dollars. But with the right attitude and teamwork, we will adapt, improvise and overcome any obstacles in order to make this project a success with all of our contributors' help."

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out if you know any veteran that want to be a part of this project.

  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR COMING ALONG WITH US ON THIS WONDERFUL JOURNEY.

story:
About the Film

  • Follow Samson, a troubled and problematic young man finding his way through the night and finding his way through life, coming to a crossroads and having to decide who he wants to be.
  • In Until the Sun Comes Up we’ll take a look at Sexuality, Mental health, class and the effects of trauma. These are all issues I feel need to be looked at and normalized if we’re to move forward as a society.
  • Your donation will bring this project to life and let us bring these issues to light. It’s important for us to deal with these issues properly and respectfully and so want to put as much into the project as possible to make sure it’s taken seriously.

Risks & Challenges

  • Planning to shoot such a project in the current Covid climate has proven difficult in pre-production planning, however after accommodating for this, ensuring all precautions are taken and completing Covid risk assessments forms the team here is 100% confident that this will not be an issue and UTSCU will continue as planned.

How to Help

  • Please take a look at our perks/rewards and offers and see if any donation is possible. Rewards range from donations of £2 upwards with large range of choices.
  • NOTE: any donation above £5 will include all prior perks.
  • If you cannot donate, please share this page with friends and family to help raise awareness and interest in the campaign!

Thank you!

Follow Samson, a troubled and problematic young man finding his way through the night and finding his way through life, coming to a crossroads and having to decide who he wants to be.
In Until the Sun Comes Up we’ll take a look at Sexuality, Mental health, class and the effects of trauma. These are all issues I feel need to be looked at and normalized if we’re to move forward as a society.
Your donation will bring this project to life and let us bring these issues to light. It’s important for us to deal with these issues properly and respectfully and so want to put as much into the project as possible to make sure it’s taken seriously.

Thank you!

story:
LE FILM

 

À propos : 

"Border Line" raconte la descente aux enfers de Julien, un jeune homme qui vient d'apprendre que sa copine est enceinte. Comblé par cette nouvelle, la situation va rapidement dégénérer lorsque Dom, son meilleur ami, l'entraine avec lui dans une histoire de drogue. 

BORDER LINE est une comédie dramatique et d'action qui propose un mélange des genres  toujours intéressant. Le film incarne la pire situation qui puisse se produire entre meilleurs amis, mais qui, pour une raison quelconque, doivent rester ensemble. 

 

Pourquoi ce film est important :

Ce film a pour intention d'aborder les relations toxiques. Celles-ci sont, à un moment ou à un autre, présentent dans la vie de chacun. Par contre, les façons dont elles se développent ou qu'elles se terminent sont toujours uniques. Le but du film est d'utiliser cette unicité pour en exploiter le potentiel comique.  

Il y a toujours eu une attirance indéniable à regarder une oeuvre évoquant une relation toxique. Peut-être parce que cela nous permet inconsciemment de se sentir mieux avec nos propres relations dans notre vie respective. Ou encore, cela attise simplement notre curiosité de voir comment les autres vivent leur vie. Peu importe la véritable raison, Border Line a pour but de faire résonner ces émotions et ces sentiments qui sont en nous. 

 

Derrière le projet : 

Scénariste & Acteur :  Félix Simard, "Julien"

Félix est un cinéaste québécois indépendant situé à Montréal. En plus d'avoir étudié le jeu à la caméra à Montréal et à Los Angeles, il a également complété un Certificat en Scénarisation. Depuis, il continu son apprentissage en étant impliqué dans de nombreux projets cinématographiques et créatifs, tels que des vidéoclips, des web-séries, show télés, court métrages, etc. Il continu de faire son chemin dans l'industrie et la réalisation de son nouveau projet, Border Line représente la prochaine étape de son cheminement.  

 

Réalisateur : Dwight Petrovic 

Dwight est un acteur - réalisateur canadien habitant à Montréal. Il est notamment connu pour ses film Video Paradise (2018), Party of One (2020), Razor (2021), ainsi que plusieurs autres. Depuis, Dwight a co-créé la compagnie de production Sick N' Sweet où ils produisent du contenu pour des artistes canadiens-nes. 

 

Producteur : Joshua Bilbao

Joshua Bilbao est un acteur canadien-mexicain situé à Montreal. Après avoir étudié le théâtre à New York, Los Angeles & Vienne, Joshua continue de découvrir de nouvelles passions à travers son amour pour le cinéma, comme la réalisation, la scénarisation ainsi que la production. Il a récemment co-créé la compagnie de production Sick N' Sweet qui produit des films, vidéoclips, et du contenu en tout genre pour des artistes canadiens-nes. 

 

Directeur de la Photographie : Matt Veillette

Matt, troisième créateur de Sick N' Sweet, est un gars de la rive-sud de Montréal. Il se promène nu-pieds partout où il va et il est ben gentil. Aussi, ça adonne qu'il soit bon avec les caméras et l'éclairage. Donc il fait partie du projet.

 

Acteur : Simon Bélanger, "Dom"

Simon est passionné par le cinéma depuis son plus jeune âge. Il a découvert sa passion en réalisant des vidéos. Il a démarré sa formation d'acteur à l'ECTQ (École de Cinéma et Télévision de Québec) où il a gradué en 2015. Par la suite, il a développé ses compétences à Los Angeles où il a étudié Meisner à l'Acting Corps et où il a participé aux cours intensifs de Bernard Hiller. De retour à Montréal, il poursuit son entraînement auprès de l'école The House of Actors tout en s'impliquant dans de nombreux projets. 

 

Vos donations :

Nous sommes excités à l'idée de réaliser ce film. Nous avons travaillés pendant plusieurs mois sur le développement de ce projet et les donations nous permettront d'avoir plus de ressources qui, du fait même, augmenteront la qualité du projet. Les donations nous aideront notamment à couvrir les frais de location d'équipement, d'avoir les autorisations pour nos lieux de tournages, les accessoires, les costumes, la nourriture, ainsi que les frais pour soumettre le film à divers festivals. 

 

Autres façons d'aider : 

Bien sûr, il y a d'autres façons pour nous aider dans la réalisation de ce projet. Vous pouvez toujours partager la campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux ou en parler à votre entourage, afin que celle-ci atteigne plus de gens.  Ne sous-estimer pas l'impact que cela peut avoir pour nous! 

 

Merci!

- L'équipe de Border Line
story_txt: LE FILM À propos : "Border Line" raconte la descente aux enfers de Julien, un jeune homme qui vient d'apprendre que sa copine est enceinte. Comblé par cette nouvelle, la situation va rapidement dégénérer lorsque Dom, son meilleur ami, l'entraine avec lui dans une histoire de drogue. BORDER LINE est une comédie dramatique et d'action qui propose un mélange des genres  toujours intéressant. Le film incarne la pire situation qui puisse se produire entre meilleurs amis, mais qui, pour une raison quelconque, doivent rester ensemble.  Pourquoi ce film est important :Ce film a pour intention d'aborder les relations toxiques. Celles-ci sont, à un moment ou à un autre, présentent dans la vie de chacun. Par contre, les façons dont elles se développent ou qu'elles se terminent sont toujours uniques. Le but du film est d'utiliser cette unicité pour en exploiter le potentiel comique.  Il y a toujours eu une attirance indéniable à regarder une oeuvre évoquant une relation toxique. Peut-être parce que cela nous permet inconsciemment de se sentir mieux avec nos propres relations dans notre vie respective. Ou encore, cela attise simplement notre curiosité de voir comment les autres vivent leur vie. Peu importe la véritable raison, Border Line a pour but de faire résonner ces émotions et ces sentiments qui sont en nous.  Derrière le projet : Scénariste & Acteur :  Félix Simard, "Julien"Félix est un cinéaste québécois indépendant situé à Montréal. En plus d'avoir étudié le jeu à la caméra à Montréal et à Los Angeles, il a également complété un Certificat en Scénarisation. Depuis, il continu son apprentissage en étant impliqué dans de nombreux projets cinématographiques et créatifs, tels que des vidéoclips, des web-séries, show télés, court métrages, etc. Il continu de faire son chemin dans l'industrie et la réalisation de son nouveau projet, Border Line représente la prochaine étape de son cheminement.   Réalisateur : Dwight Petrovic Dwight est un acteur - réalisateur canadien habitant à Montréal. Il est notamment connu pour ses film Video Paradise (2018), Party of One (2020), Razor (2021), ainsi que plusieurs autres. Depuis, Dwight a co-créé la compagnie de production Sick N' Sweet où ils produisent du contenu pour des artistes canadiens-nes.  Producteur : Joshua BilbaoJoshua Bilbao est un acteur canadien-mexicain situé à Montreal. Après avoir étudié le théâtre à New York, Los Angeles & Vienne, Joshua continue de découvrir de nouvelles passions à travers son amour pour le cinéma, comme la réalisation, la scénarisation ainsi que la production. Il a récemment co-créé la compagnie de production Sick N' Sweet qui produit des films, vidéoclips, et du contenu en tout genre pour des artistes canadiens-nes.  Directeur de la Photographie : Matt VeilletteMatt, troisième créateur de Sick N' Sweet, est un gars de la rive-sud de Montréal. Il se promène nu-pieds partout où il va et il est ben gentil. Aussi, ça adonne qu'il soit bon avec les caméras et l'éclairage. Donc il fait partie du projet. Acteur : Simon Bélanger, "Dom"Simon est passionné par le cinéma depuis son plus jeune âge. Il a découvert sa passion en réalisant des vidéos. Il a démarré sa formation d'acteur à l'ECTQ (École de Cinéma et Télévision de Québec) où il a gradué en 2015. Par la suite, il a développé ses compétences à Los Angeles où il a étudié Meisner à l'Acting Corps et où il a participé aux cours intensifs de Bernard Hiller. De retour à Montréal, il poursuit son entraînement auprès de l'école The House of Actors tout en s'impliquant dans de nombreux projets.  Vos donations :Nous sommes excités à l'idée de réaliser ce film. Nous avons travaillés pendant plusieurs mois sur le développement de ce projet et les donations nous permettront d'avoir plus de ressources qui, du fait même, augmenteront la qualité du projet. Les donations nous aideront notamment à couvrir les frais de location d'équipement, d'avoir les autorisations pour nos lieux de tournages, les accessoires, les costumes, la nourriture, ainsi que les frais pour soumettre le film à divers festivals.  Autres façons d'aider : Bien sûr, il y a d'autres façons pour nous aider dans la réalisation de ce projet. Vous pouvez toujours partager la campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux ou en parler à votre entourage, afin que celle-ci atteigne plus de gens.  Ne sous-estimer pas l'impact que cela peut avoir pour nous!  Merci!- L'équipe de Border Line

story:
Short Summary

This film has its foundations six years ago at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, where we first saw a production of Love’s Labour’s Lost and were inspired by how much we connected to these characters that were written over 400 years ago.  Jennifer directed the play when she was in high school and set it in a modern-day boarding school.  That production was sold out every night and received glowing reviews at a large fine arts festival.  Last summer we decided to take that project to the next level by transforming it into a film!  We successfully passed our goal and raised over $29,000 on our last Indiegogo campaign, which enabled us to get through production.

Love's Labour's Lost was shot in Austin, Texas, from June 13th to July 1st. Our dedicated and extremely talented cast and crew made the most of the long, jam-packed days, and we were able to stay on schedule and on budget for the entirety of the shoot.

A successful Shakespeare movie has characters that are accessible to anyone, regardless of the audience's familiarity with Shakespearean stories or language.  Almost everyone has experienced the pangs of first love and the joy of enduring friendship.  Our movie celebrates every type of love, from romantic to unrequited to fraternal.  The themes are universal, but the story is unique.

Ferdinand, the Head Boy of Navarre Academy, leads three of his comrades in making a chastity vow in order to focus on their studies.  However, with the arrival of four new girls at their school, including the Princess of Aquitane and her sultry friend Rosaline, the boys can’t help but quickly fall for each of their new classmates.  Meanwhile, their eccentric Spanish teacher, Don Armado, falls for Jaquenetta, the sexy school nurse, but is caught in a love triangle with Costard, the janitor.  As you might imagine, this all leads to some wild antics, including secret parties in the woods and students disguised as Russians.

Already, just from watching the raw footage, we can see this project really coming together. With heartfelt performances, beautiful costumes, stunning production design, and exceptional camera work, this is a film that deserves to be seen.

And with your help, we can not only complete the film, but do it in a way that honors a story as complex and unique as Shakespeare's original work. 


What We Need & What You Get

We've already raised half of the money we need for post-production through independent fundraising, and now we just need $9,000 more to finish.  Here's a handy pie chart to show you how that money will be spent:


We have lots of great perks that we think you're going to love!  If you have an idea for a perk that's not listed here, let us know.

If we don't reach our entire funding goal, of course we will still finish editing the movie.  However, we may not be able to afford as high-quality equipment or as experienced of a post-production team; we might have to make compromises and sacrifice marketing tools that are really important to help this movie reach audiences.  We want to make the best film possible, which means we need your help to raise $9,000!  Every dollar gets us closer to our goal, so donate what you can and help us spread the word.


The Impact

We believe that Shakespeare is still important and relevant, even nearly 400 years after his death.  We want to show the world that Shakespeare is not just high-art literature. Shakespeare was a dirty poet, and we want to bring his beautiful dirty humor to life! We want to highlight the ridiculous characters who all have the same hopes, dreams, and desires as all of us...namely to get laid. This film will make Shakespeare accessible to everyone.  It's breaking new ground in the world of non-musical film adaptations of Love's Labour's Lost.

Our film will make Shakespeare comfortable for you if you've always been Bard-phobic, and make Shakespeare new for you if you're bored of the way these plays are taught in English classes.  There is truly something here for everyone to love!


Risks & Challenges

Creating an independent film is an inherently risky venture, but we've already done the hard part!  The entire movie is done filming, so now we just need to raise enough to finish post-production.  Thanks to your support, our last Indiegogo campaign surpassed our goal, raising over $29,000.  Working with a microbudget, we put the money we initially raised to good use on high-quality cameras, lighting, and sound equipment, which gave the film a much higher production value than the true cost of making it.  We want to finish strong with a fantastic post-production crew who can polish this movie and get it ready for film festival submissions, so that someday soon you can see Love's Labour's Lost on the silver screen!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help.  Spread the news about this campaign far and wide!  Share on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and any other social media sites you use!  Tell your family and friends, tell your neighbors and coworkers, tell your dog-walker, tell your English teacher, tell your checkout clerk at Whole Foods!  The more people know about Love's Labour's Lost, the better chance we have of seeing this movie premiere at a top-tier film festival.


Questions?  Comments?

Email us at loveslabourslostmovie@gmail.com or contact us through our social media accounts.

story:
What begins as an eccentric meet-cute in a romantic comedy...

...devolves into a hostage thriller.

Elevator Pitch follows EDGAR PARDIGGLE,  a reticent apartment complex security guard,  as he traps HANNAH HUBBARD, a resident with whom he is infatuated, in the elevator to prevent her from encountering a suave man waiting in front of her flat.

 

Director's Statement

In my films, I find myself drawn to outcasts – those among us who go through life feeling unseen and unremarkable, who tunnel inward and create elaborate worlds in their imaginations. As a gay person from a religious community, I find great solidarity with such characters, having lived in a fantasy realm of my own for the sake of self-preservation. Many stories blossom from these characters – virtually every underdog persists thanks to such a fantasy until their reality and fantasy merge spectacularly in the end. 

But hidden in these inner realms is the potential for real danger;  when someone creates a fantasy through which they understand themself, they risk swallowing others into their stories.

Elevator Pitch explores the consequences of personal fantasies as they ripple outward, ensnaring those within their reach. At its centre are two protagonists, one on either side of the security camera: Edgar, the creator of the fantasy, and Hannah, the object of his delusion. What starts as a charming-if-invasive, maybe even romantic opportunity for  Edgar to forge a connection with Hannah descends into a hostage nightmare as Hannah realises the danger of her situation. 

When we make a narrative to understand a situation – when we tell ourselves a story – it acts upon us and, if unfettered, risks dehumanising others as they are forced to take on roles in that story.  

Storyboards by Zoe Greenbaum

How You Can Help Us

Elevator Pitch is currently in pre-production, on schedule to shoot in June 2021. We have been thrilled by the enthusiasm this story has generated – the script was awarded Best Short Screenplay at the 2021 Ivy Film Festival, the largest student film festival in the United States. 

We have assembled a stellar team of talented professionals, formed a budget, scouted locations, and prepared shot lists.  However, to bring this project to life, we need financial support. We are looking for those individuals who are devoted to empowering young artists, who believe in our film's message and the passion of the team making it. 

This is how the budget will be used:

If you cannot make a financial contribution, we completely understand. If you're still keen to help, however, please spread the word!

 

The Team

Lyndon graduated Magna cum laude from Harvard University with a degree in English and VES (film) with minors in theatre and Arabic. He is a Marshall scholar, through which he received a Master’s degree from the Royal College of Art and is currently pursuing another Master’s at the London Film School. He has written and directed over a dozen films, winning numerous awards in both the US and internationally. More information about him and his work can be found here.

Alex is a Producer. He graduated from Queen Mary, University of London in 2016, and worked in corporate PR and TV before entering the world of film. Most recently, he served as an Executive Producer on 'You Really Got Me', which won awards at the Venice Shorts Festival, Berlin Flash Film Festival, and Screen Power Awards, and as a Co-Producer on 'Wave 3' through BBC New Creatives. He is currently studying International Film Business at the London Film School. 

Markus, an ASC mentee, is a German-born London-based cinematographer with over five years' experience in short films, adverts, feature films, and music videos. He has developed a reputation as a crafty, quick, problem-solving, economic, and meticulous shooter, and has been responsible for B-Camera operating and 2nd Unit work on shows such as 'The Crown,' 'Hand of Creator,' 'Redcon-1,' and many more.

Lauren graduated from the National Film and Television School in Beaconsfield in 2019 and has since worked as an Art Department Assistant on Edgar Wright's upcoming 'Last Night in Soho' and on the TV series 'The Power'. She has served as a Production Designer on a number of shorts including 'Azaar' (which won the Royal Television Society Student Award for Best Production Design and was nominated for the BAFTA for Best British Short Film 2020); 'The Third Sorrow (which was an Official Selection at the BFI London Film Festival 2018); and 'Lilmisscandy786' (which was commissioned for BBC 4).

Jane is a graduate of Screen & Film School Brighton, and has a wealth of experience across a number of both UK and international film sets, working for a wide range of productions, including for Invesona Films. 

 

Cast

Patrick is currently studying at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art, having previously appeared in several West End productions such as War Horse (National Theatre), Another Country (Trafalgar Studios) and Foxfinder (Bill Kenwright Productions). Patrick also co-founded No Prophet Theatre company which has put on shows around the UK, including ‘Boys’ by Ella Hickson at the Arcola Theatre.

Chloe is an actor and theatre artist, currently studying at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. She graduated summa cum laude from Harvard University where she was awarded the Louis Sudler Prize for the most outstanding artist at the University across all disciplines and the Jonathan Levy Prize for the best actor at Harvard. She is the co-founder and co-artistic director of the international experimental theatre ensemble THE GOAT EXCHANGE. 

 

Why Make This Film Now?

Elevator Pitch is about the dangers of the stories we craft – particularly those stories men tell themselves about women, and the mental gymnastics they do to accommodate those stories.

In this moment of societal reckoning around issues of inequality and subjugation, this film tries to shine a light on how two people in the same situation can interpret their shared circumstances in radically different ways. For Edgar, this is a romantic opportunity to meet the woman he has a crush on. For Hannah, it is a terrifying situation in which she is held captive...

 

Previous Filmmaking Successes

Lyndon has written and directed over ten films that have been screened and awarded at festivals around the world. Most recently, he won the Best Fiction Film award at the BIFA-qualifying Watersprite International Film Festival, the Red Arrow Studios screenplay competition, and the Best Experimental Film award at the Ivy Film Festival.  Alex's latest short film is due for release later this year via BBC iPlayer. 'You Really Got Me' also received numerous awards from both UK and international festivals.

 

Visual Language & Style

The film occupies three distinct realms, each defined by a colour palette and feel:

1. Edgar's desk / the apartment lobby

Edgar surreptitiously presides over the apartment complex via an array of CCTV monitors. The dim desk and lobby are at first illuminated by sundown, but as the film progresses and night falls, the only comes from Edgar's monitors, tinting the space in an ominous green.

2. Hannah's elevator carriage 

When we are with Hannah in the elevator, the film becomes increasingly claustrophobic as she becomes cognizant of her situation's potential danger.  For her, the security camera becomes the symbol of her oppression and it looms larger and larger.

3. Digital interfaces

The security camera is a crucial component of this movie's visual language. Edgar primarily interacts with the apartment complex's residents (such as Hannah) as figures on his CCTV screens and so he tends to think of them more as characters in a television show than as actual people. Whenever we are in Edgar's perspective, Hannah is seen either as a sketch in his notes or via CCTV on one of his numerous monitors.

Next to the array of CCTV screens is a portable television on which Edgar watches reality programming (mostly talent and game shows). The styles and these programs influence how he perceives the CCTV images, projecting the tonal expectations of these TV shows onto the apartment complex residents who populate it.

The film explores the reflexive power of voyeurism through reflections and distortions - turning Edgar's CCTV monitors and security cameras into mirrors.

 

Risks & Challenges

One significant challenge is Covid-19. However, a Covid Safety Officer will be present on set for each production date and cast and crew members who can be tested, will be tested shortly before production commences. Furthermore, following the UK government's lockdown easing roadmap, our hope is that a full crew will be allowed to work on set throughout the production period, provided social distancing and Covid-secure practices are implemented each day.

A brief and very minimal fire is required for one scene. Your contributions will also help pay for a Fire Safety Supervisor, who will be present on set during this scene, and who will train the cast and crew in the correct safety procedures prior to filming.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Edgar's desk / the apartment lobbyEdgar surreptitiously presides over the apartment complex via an array of CCTV monitors. The dim desk and lobby are at first illuminated by sundown, but as the film progresses and night falls, the only comes from Edgar's monitors, tinting the space in an ominous green.2. Hannah's elevator carriage When we are with Hannah in the elevator, the film becomes increasingly claustrophobic as she becomes cognizant of her situation's potential danger.  For her, the security camera becomes the symbol of her oppression and it looms larger and larger.3. Digital interfacesThe security camera is a crucial component of this movie's visual language. Edgar primarily interacts with the apartment complex's residents (such as Hannah) as figures on his CCTV screens and so he tends to think of them more as characters in a television show than as actual people. Whenever we are in Edgar's perspective, Hannah is seen either as a sketch in his notes or via CCTV on one of his numerous monitors.Next to the array of CCTV screens is a portable television on which Edgar watches reality programming (mostly talent and game shows). The styles and these programs influence how he perceives the CCTV images, projecting the tonal expectations of these TV shows onto the apartment complex residents who populate it.The film explores the reflexive power of voyeurism through reflections and distortions - turning Edgar's CCTV monitors and security cameras into mirrors. Risks & ChallengesOne significant challenge is Covid-19. However, a Covid Safety Officer will be present on set for each production date and cast and crew members who can be tested, will be tested shortly before production commences. Furthermore, following the UK government's lockdown easing roadmap, our hope is that a full crew will be allowed to work on set throughout the production period, provided social distancing and Covid-secure practices are implemented each day.A brief and very minimal fire is required for one scene. Your contributions will also help pay for a Fire Safety Supervisor, who will be present on set during this scene, and who will train the cast and crew in the correct safety procedures prior to filming. THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
WHAT IS 'Breakup Time Machine' 

 

Logline: After getting dumped, Max takes advantage of new time travel technology to try to right her wrongs in the relationship and get her ex back.

 

Synopsis

What would you do if you could travel back in time? Visit the dinosaurs? Run around the Acropolis? Have drinks with Picasso? 

When Max is given this magical opportunity, she decides to travel back to...six months ago, before things started to go terribly wrong in her relationship with Rob. Max will do whatever it takes to try to get her taco-loving boyfriend back, even if it means breaking the rules of time travel which, as she’s repeatedly warned, could have dire consequences for all of humanity.

 

 

WHY THIS STORY?

 

Breakup Time Machine is a story about love, obsession, and the consequences of travelling back in time. 

This movie asks the questions: What if women really were as obsessed with being in a relationship as society pressures them to be? Where is the line between obsession and love? If the future version of yourself sleeps with the past version of your ex, is it cheating? Breakup sex? An important scientific experiment? We don’t know! 

This film hovers between realizing the worst versions of ourselves after a breakup and an exciting romp through time and space. The story challenges ideas about fixing relationships and self-growth by letting the main character do what we’ve all thought about but never done because of things like self-control and lack of time travel technology.

This movie is an absurdist comedy with quick jokes and slapstick humor. 

 

 

BUT WHY US

Our group of filmmakers in Toronto and around the globe are in love with this story about love. Some might even go so far to say...we’re obsessed with it. The director, producers, cast, and crew connected to Kayla’s story because it was like no other film they’d seen before: A time travel, sci fi, comedy, anti rom-com. Mostly, we wanted to see how many genres we could fit into one short film. 

This short film has the slapstick humor of Juno mixed with cool Time Travel Visual Effects like Edge of Tomorrow & Tenet. This drew director Bobby Markov to the project. He knows his way around cool visual effects through directing the award winning sci-fi film Metamorphosis and is excited to incorporate visual comedy in this film. 

Lead producer Jeff Velez is obsessed with the sci fi genre and also does stand up comedy so thought this was the perfect marriage of his two interests. We’ve assembled a talented cast and crew in Toronto excited about this refreshing take on the sci fi and rom com genres. We wanted to ask them why they were excited to make this film but didn’t have time, so instead we guessed what they’d have to say about it: 

“This is the greatest script I’ve ever read in my life. It just lights me up!” – Special effects flash bulb 

“I laughed so hard milk came out my nose!” – Representative from the Dairy Lobby

“I think it could be shorter.” – Low ink cartridge 

 

 

MEET THE TEAM

 

Bobby Markov - Director 

Bobby Markov is an award-winning, Bulgarian/Canadian actor, writer, and director who, at just 21 years old, created the International Award-winning, prolific Sci-Fi Short Film Metamorphosis Ltd. His previous Sci-Fi movie has won Best Canadian Short Film at the Toronto Film channel awards, and Best Audience Choice for Best Short Film at the Amsterdam Lift-Off Film Festival, just to name a few. He is also a proud Parkour Traceur, coach, and Martial Artist.

Follow him on Instagram @ bobbymarkov

Facebook: https://m.facebook.com/bobby.markov.12

IMDb: https://m.imdb.com/name/nm12147988/

 

Kayla Kurin - Writer 

Kayla Kurin is a nomadic writer from Canada who can most often be found drinking a box of wine at the beach and not hunkering down in the arctic tundra due to a global pandemic. Kayla has written essays, satire pieces, and short stories which have been featured on The Belladonna Comedy, Little Old Lady Comedy, NewsThump, Perceptive Travel, Humber Literary Review, Matador Network, Side Hustle School, Yoga International, Tiny Buddha, and more.

Follow her at kaylakurin.com

 

Jeff Velez - Lead Producer 

Jeff Velez is an award-winning, American Producer, Writer, Director, Actor, and Comedian with 15 years’ experience. He started working in the Film/TV industry when he was fifteen. For his first TV job he worked at a Local Access Television Station in New Jersey, there he learned screenwriting, producing, directing, cinematography, lighting, editing, and much more. The New Jersey Star-Ledger State Newspaper even wrote a cover article about him, praising his outstanding work in local access television.

Since 2019, Jeff went onto being an Executive Producer on five amazing films that were made in three different countries, leading him to win awards internationally. Filmmaking is not Jeff’s only passion, he also loves acting and stand-up comedy. He has performed in multiple theater productions at Brookdale’s Performing Arts Center in Lincroft, NJ, New Jersey Churches, and has acted in multiple short films. Jeff has also performed Stand-up Comedy at the famous Gotham Comedy Club Main Stage in New York City and at the renown Scotty’s Comedy Cove in New Jersey. 

In 2021, Jeff went onto become the Founder & Owner of Stay Lucid Productions LLC. Since he is a huge fan of the Sci-Fi & Horror genres, he wanted to create his own production company that focuses on making Sci-Fi & Horror movies internationally.  

Find him on IMDb: imdb.me/jeffvelez

Follow him on Instagram: @ jeffvelez_ 

 

Mo Abdelkhalek - Co-Producer 

 

Mo Abdelkhalek is an Egyptian/British producer who found his passion and hunger for media productions and aims to become a valued member of the industry. Mo is a graduate from MET FILM SCHOOL. Mo is the producer for “The Order” web series and a production manager for short films “The Ashes you Left Behind” and “Peaceful Dealings”

Before the pandemic, you would always find Mo with his husband travelling around the world exploring new destinations, while during the last year you would have found them binging shows with a takeaway. 

Follow him on Instagram @ mo_abdel_khalek

 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

BACK OUR MOVIE: The Goal of this Campaign is $10,000. Where is the money going? See a budget breakdown below. 

As you can see below, we need $10,000 to tell this story. The way we can get that is if people like you pledge money. So please donate, even if it is only $10. Every dollar counts!

If you decide to help, you contribute whatever you want in exchange for awesome rewards! For example: Digital Copy of the movie, Prop used within the film, Have your face or name shown within the movie, Associate or Executive Producer Credit on IMDB and in the film's end credits! 

The more you contribute, the better the rewards! If you’re viewing this page on a computer take a look at the column on the right, if you’re using a phone/tablet the reward section will be at the top of the page.  

 

 
Check out our Crowdfunding Rewards video above for more info about the awesome Rewards & Perks we are offering to contributors! 

 

 

SHARE THE INDIEGOGO ONLINE: Share it everywhere! Share it on that Facebook you only use to view memes, Share it on Twitter even though you barely have any followers, Share it with that friend you haven't seen since the pandemic started. Share it with a buddy who loves Science Fiction!

 

Behind the Scenes photo from the trailer of Actress Brianna Wright holding the Hourglass that gives you the power to Time Travel!

 

BUDGET BREAKDOWN

 

If you haven't already please watch our Pitch Video at the top of the page for a more detailed break down of what funding will be going towards.  

 

STRETCH GOALS 

10K is the bare minimum goal we need just to start production. If we can hit 15-25K we can improve the quality of the movie significantly by renting better film equipment, better shooting locations, and film an EPIC intro and ending sequence for the movie!

 

MOOD AND VISUAL INSPIRATION

                                  Her (2013)                                     Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)

 

PROJECT TIMELINE

 

Pre-Production: 2/2021 - 02/2022

Production: 05/2022

Post-Production: 06/2022-08/2022

 

 

SOME OF OUR PAST WORK 

We want to give you even more reasons to trust that we will be delivering you an amazing short film by showing you some of our past work. Here are our favorite projects that we have worked on! 

International Award-Winning Sci-Fi Short Film Metamorphosis Ltd - Trailer 

 
Supernatural and Psychological Horror Short Film Obey Evil - Trailer 
 

 

Our Director Bobby Markov's Directorial Reel 

 

 

 

MEET THE CAST/CREW

 

Frances Santiago - Production Designer 

 

Aaliyah Sundar - Costume Designer 

 

Yunior Rojas - Stunt Coordinator 

 
Shelby Slack - Hair & Make-up Artist 
 
Zack Clark - Director of Photography 
 
Hayden Salter - Grip/Gaffer
 
 
Kaitlyn Gunnis - Prop Master/Background
 
 
Dmitriy Katalymov - Stunt Double 

 

Brianna Wright - (Actress) Presenter/Time Clinician in Trailer 

 

Steven Hao - (Actor) in Trailer 

 

Finn Browne - Sound Recordist 

 

Bajio Alvarado - Composer/Sound Designer 

 

Ryan Sun - Graphic Designer 

 

Risks & Challenges: Filming a movie during a Global Pandemic 

Although we have begun a new year, the same virus remains. We will be taking every precaution to ensure the health and safety of our team. If you take a look at our budget above, you will see that we accounted ($350) to buy all of the necessary cleaning supplies, temperature gun, K95 Masks, Rapid Test Kits, (we will be logging everyone's temperatures on set). The health and safety of our team is our top priority.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay! You can still help by sharing our Indiegogo, and our Movie's Website and Social Media! Also please share our trailer online as well! Spreading the word is just as important as contributing! 

Website:  http://breakuptimemachine.com/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/breakuptimemachine

Instagram: @ breakup_time_machine

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsAqBeyBRQUooEp7N7c5otg

 

Also follow Stay Lucid Productions to hear about more Sci-Fi & Horror movies we're releasing! 

Website: https://www.staylucidproductions.tv

Facebook: https://facebook.com/staylucidproductions

Instagram: @ staylucidproductions

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLANpo3StnFeRk...

 

A FINAL WORD

Thank you for checking out our project! We are super excited about this story and the epic Sci-fi/Comedy experience this film will bring to viewers. We are not only filmmakers but huge Sci-Fi fans. This is a film made by Sci-Fi Fans for Sci-Fi Fans! We hope you would join us in making this vision come to life!

story:
Ellipses and Semi-Colons

A raucous, quick-witted, college ensemble comedy!

Welcome to ELLIPSES and SEMI-COLONS!

As a kid from Utah my dream of making movies seemed a distant fantasy. Through adversity and a winding road I am finally in position to realize the dream I never gave up on! For the last four years, I've been perfecting my craft as a graduate student at the prestigious UCLA Film School which helped me move to Los Angeles and meet some amazing people.  

I'm a definitely a nerd-cinephile who lives and breathes movies.  The hang-out genre is one of my absolute favorites and I have been planning this film in my head since I first saw Dazed and Confused when I was 14. In my undergrad college years in Utah Valley, I had a dangerously great time with my friends, creating tons of ridiculous stories to tell as a result. I poured all of the stories, the successes and self-sabotage, into this script. I couldn't be more excited to make this comedy with you!

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

How YOUR contribution helps!

TRANSPORTATION - Getting everyone there!

Your contribution will help us reimburse the crew for gas and miles on their vehicles as well as fly in our leading actors.

FOOD & LODGING - You're helping us eat and sleep!

Cast and crew are generously giving all they can of their time to make this happen. Many are doing it for next to no pay (I am so grateful.) Good meals make for a happy team!

Help us provide clean, safe, and comfortable beds after a 12-hour day of filming!

EQUIPMENT - Lights and camera and all the things needed to make a movie look great! We are borrowing as much as we can from the UCLA School of Film. The rest of the equipment will be rented from professional equipment houses in Los Angeles. 

 

THE GOAL is $30,000! 

I need your help to make this happen!

Making a film is a costly endeavor.  As a graduate student, funds are even tighter and we receive no financial support from UCLA. I have worked hard to get the best-of-best on my crew. And you'll definitely hear me bragging about the extremely talented and accomplished cast in upcoming posts.

So, we've got all the right people for success, now we need the money to get us there!

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP?

Spread the word! SHARE our camapign! Make some noise!

Big accomplishments only happen when surrounded by great people. The further our campaign reaches, the quicker we reach our goal and the sooner this movie is playing NEAR YOU! Help us build our community of support.

Please share, share, share, even if you're not able to contribute!

 

ABOUT THE MOVIE

What is Ellipses and Semicolons?

Think Dazed and Confused Meets The Big Chill - Or Fast Times at Ridgemont High in College

Ellipses and Semicolons follows five best friends struggling to come-of-age before their last semester in college. As the clock of collegiate safety winds down and ambitions collide in hilarious and heartwarming episodes, will Luzette, Declan, Anson, Kellen and Page be able to keep their friendship intact? With graduation finally in sight, the only thing that can stop them is... themselves. 

Our goal is to release the movie after film festivals in early 2023!

 

CHARATERS:

Luzette

A goth middle shooter who never quite outgrew it, Luzette is a passionate filmmaker at a college with no film program. Luzette fights against school bureaucracy and a dead-beat dad to make her senior thesis — a low-budget feature film. All the while reconciling her on-again, off-again dynamic with Declan. 

 

Declan

A selfish pretty boy who's always gotten by on his charm and B- effort. Declan is forced to look inside himself for the first time in his life when his alcoholism hurts those closest to him. And he doesn't like what he finds. 

 

Anson

Anson faces a “quarter-life crisis” as he realizes that he's been training since age 10 to be a philosophy professor... but he doesn't like philosophers. He takes a vow of sobriety until he figures out his future at a house that uses any pretext for a party. 

 

Kellen

Kellen struggles to reconcile his black-sheep identity amidst his parents kicking him off the payroll. To solve his problems he launches his own business: Dank Sandwiches Inc. 

 

Page

Page bails on his last semester college to honor his perceived true calling: becoming a real-life pirate in land-locked Utah. 

 

The Impact

Movies like this don't get made anymore. It's a damn shame, but it's the truth. But it's not because audience don't want them. It's because studios are scared to make anything without "IP" or super-stars that they can bank on. The Indie spirit lives on through stories like ours and supporter like YOU! We have to fight to get great Indie stories back on the movie menu!

This story features a unique subculture (the counter culture of Utah Valley) and includes a diverse cast and crew of talented people. The story portrays queerness without the stereotypes, shows the beauty of friendship, the hardship of addiction, and the comedy of coming-of-age (not in your teens anymore for us Gen-Z and Millennials) with comedy and good natured irony. 

If you're tired of super hero movies, or just want some variety and original voices out there in the market (like the 90s!) then this film is for you! It's about characters. REAL PEOPLE! Who have opinions, make mistakes, and laugh along the way to adulthood. 

 

Risks and Challenges

Without your support, this movie wouldn't be possible. I am calling in every favor I can and putting nearly all of my personal money into the project (keeping enough to pay rent and afford Ramen noodles!) I am not doing this to make money, I am doing it to launch my career as a storyteller by bringing you a hilarious hang-out comedy. 

Financing is our greatest challenge. This Indie Go-Go is essential. 100% of your contribution will go to the making of the film as laid out above. We are hard at work seeking private investors but the fact remains that without this money we will require another crowdfunding campaign to finish the movie by moving our post-production budget over to cover these costs. By contributing now, we get this move made and on your screens as quickly as possible!

We have an incredible team, a great cast (more coming soon, I promise) and I have worked all through the pandemic to prepare this film. 

As of today though, we are scheduled, 90% cast, and planning this movie dreaming that your contribution will bridge the gap in our finances! Thank you!

Director's Reel

For a little extra background, here's a short video montage to give our viewers a sense of the work the director and crew have previously created.
story_txt:
Ellipses and Semi-Colons
A raucous, quick-witted, college ensemble comedy!


Welcome to ELLIPSES and SEMI-COLONS!
As a kid from Utah my dream of making movies seemed a distant fantasy. Through adversity and a winding road I am finally in position to realize the dream I never gave up on! For the last four years, I've been perfecting my craft as a graduate student at the prestigious UCLA Film School which helped me move to Los Angeles and meet some amazing people.  
I'm a definitely a nerd-cinephile who lives and breathes movies.  The hang-out genre is one of my absolute favorites and I have been planning this film in my head since I first saw Dazed and Confused when I was 14. In my undergrad college years in Utah Valley, I had a dangerously great time with my friends, creating tons of ridiculous stories to tell as a result. I poured all of the stories, the successes and self-sabotage, into this script. I couldn't be more excited to make this comedy with you!
WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?
How YOUR contribution helps!
TRANSPORTATION - Getting everyone there!
Your contribution will help us reimburse the crew for gas and miles on their vehicles as well as fly in our leading actors.
FOOD & LODGING - You're helping us eat and sleep!
Cast and crew are generously giving all they can of their time to make this happen. Many are doing it for next to no pay (I am so grateful.) Good meals make for a happy team!
Help us provide clean, safe, and comfortable beds after a 12-hour day of filming!
EQUIPMENT - Lights and camera and all the things needed to make a movie look great! We are borrowing as much as we can from the UCLA School of Film. The rest of the equipment will be rented from professional equipment houses in Los Angeles. 

 
THE GOAL is $30,000! 
I need your help to make this happen!
Making a film is a costly endeavor.  As a graduate student, funds are even tighter and we receive no financial support from UCLA. I have worked hard to get the best-of-best on my crew. And you'll definitely hear me bragging about the extremely talented and accomplished cast in upcoming posts.
So, we've got all the right people for success, now we need the money to get us there!

 
OTHER WAYS TO HELP?
Spread the word! SHARE our camapign! Make some noise!
Big accomplishments only happen when surrounded by great people. The further our campaign reaches, the quicker we reach our goal and the sooner this movie is playing NEAR YOU! Help us build our community of support.
Please share, share, share, even if you're not able to contribute!
 
ABOUT THE MOVIE

What is Ellipses and Semicolons?
Think Dazed and Confused Meets The Big Chill - Or Fast Times at Ridgemont High in College
Ellipses and Semicolons follows five best friends struggling to come-of-age before their last semester in college. As the clock of collegiate safety winds down and ambitions collide in hilarious and heartwarming episodes, will Luzette, Declan, Anson, Kellen and Page be able to keep their friendship intact? With graduation finally in sight, the only thing that can stop them is... themselves. 
Our goal is to release the movie after film festivals in early 2023!
 
CHARATERS:
Luzette
A goth middle shooter who never quite outgrew it, Luzette is a passionate filmmaker at a college with no film program. Luzette fights against school bureaucracy and a dead-beat dad to make her senior thesis — a low-budget feature film. All the while reconciling her on-again, off-again dynamic with Declan. 
 
Declan
A selfish pretty boy who's always gotten by on his charm and B- effort. Declan is forced to look inside himself for the first time in his life when his alcoholism hurts those closest to him. And he doesn't like what he finds. 
 
Anson
Anson faces a “quarter-life crisis” as he realizes that he's been training since age 10 to be a philosophy professor... but he doesn't like philosophers. He takes a vow of sobriety until he figures out his future at a house that uses any pretext for a party. 
 
Kellen
Kellen struggles to reconcile his black-sheep identity amidst his parents kicking him off the payroll. To solve his problems he launches his own business: Dank Sandwiches Inc. 
 
Page
Page bails on his last semester college to honor his perceived true calling: becoming a real-life pirate in land-locked Utah. 
 
The Impact
Movies like this don't get made anymore. It's a damn shame, but it's the truth. But it's not because audience don't want them. It's because studios are scared to make anything without "IP" or super-stars that they can bank on. The Indie spirit lives on through stories like ours and supporter like YOU! We have to fight to get great Indie stories back on the movie menu!
This story features a unique subculture (the counter culture of Utah Valley) and includes a diverse cast and crew of talented people. The story portrays queerness without the stereotypes, shows the beauty of friendship, the hardship of addiction, and the comedy of coming-of-age (not in your teens anymore for us Gen-Z and Millennials) with comedy and good natured irony. 
If you're tired of super hero movies, or just want some variety and original voices out there in the market (like the 90s!) then this film is for you! It's about characters. REAL PEOPLE! Who have opinions, make mistakes, and laugh along the way to adulthood. 
 
Risks and Challenges
Without your support, this movie wouldn't be possible. I am calling in every favor I can and putting nearly all of my personal money into the project (keeping enough to pay rent and afford Ramen noodles!) I am not doing this to make money, I am doing it to launch my career as a storyteller by bringing you a hilarious hang-out comedy. 
Financing is our greatest challenge. This Indie Go-Go is essential. 100% of your contribution will go to the making of the film as laid out above. We are hard at work seeking private investors but the fact remains that without this money we will require another crowdfunding campaign to finish the movie by moving our post-production budget over to cover these costs. By contributing now, we get this move made and on your screens as quickly as possible!
We have an incredible team, a great cast (more coming soon, I promise) and I have worked all through the pandemic to prepare this film. 
As of today though, we are scheduled, 90% cast, and planning this movie dreaming that your contribution will bridge the gap in our finances! Thank you!
Director's Reel
For a little extra background, here's a short video montage to give our viewers a sense of the work the director and crew have previously created.

story:
A summary of the project 

Hello everyone! Welcome to "The Great Awakening" and thank you for being here! :) 

Thank you so much for supporting the arts during this challenging time. The purpose of this film is to generate awareness of important facts and inspire our spiritual and cultural growth as a collective.

“The Great Awakening” is a thriller/supernatural short film about men's mental health, in support of war veterans all over the world, with a spiritual and empowering message for humanity.

It tells the story of Sam, a war veteran suffering from PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder) who is on the verge of killing himself when a mysterious phone call causes him to question his fundamental beliefs about life.

We are looking to crowdfund the cost of shooting (3-4 days in the jungle with a professional cast & crew of around 15 people), post-production (editing, original music, sound mixing, color grading, special effects, etc) and festival submissions. The more money we raise, the better the film we can make. 

The project is led by Lucas Jatobá, an Australian/Brazilian/Italian writer & director based in Australia. Lucas´previous short film, "Phenomenality",  became an Official Selection at Flickerfest Int. Short Film Festival (Oscar®/Academy Award® and BAFTA® Qualifying, Australia, 2018) and has been recognized with the Audience Award at the DOC LA Festival® (Los Angeles, USA), among many other accolades. His work for the advertising industry received over 30 international awards, including 5 Cannes Lions®.

DISCLAIMER 1: Some footage in the video and some images on this page are from the feature film "Jungle" (2017, Dir. Greg McLean)  and are being used for illustrative purposes only, under Fair Use. I do not own this content. All rights and credit go directly to its rightful owners. No copyright infringement intended.

DISCLAIMER 2: This project is not affiliated to any political party or social movement. It´s purely created out of the filmmaker´s imagination, with the intention to raise awareness to an important cause and touch people´s hearts.

 
The purpose 

Globally, about 354 million war survivors suffer from PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder) and every day an estimated 22 war veterans commit suicide. But what if they had the chance to expand their consciousness and connect deeply with their higher self? This is the connection that our film explores.

Yes, these numbers are shocking and no one is talking about it. But you can help to change this story. Now, more than ever, mental health is screaming for our attention and awareness as a collective. We all share the same home, Planet Earth, and we´re all part of the same family - humanity.

It is our responsibility to look after each other because when we help others to heal, we heal ourselves and we heal our collective consciousness.

You can help us remove the shame and stigma surrounding men’s mental health, while bringing light to the dark side of living with PTSD and a message of hope to many people around the world.

Source: Our World in Data & WHO (World Health Organization)

About the film

Genre: Thriller/Supernatural

Logline:  A war veteran suffering from PTSD (post-traumatic stress disorder) is on the verge of killing himself when a mysterious phone call causes him to question his fundamental beliefs about life.

Synopsys:

Sam is a 33-year old war veteran who is a husband and a father of two young children. After a serious incident while serving in Iraq, he developed PTSD (post-traumatic stress disorder).

After many years trying to cope with his pain and guilt, he’s now on his way to commit suicide in the woods. He discovers his compass is not working and his mobile phone is out of range. 

However, his phone rings and he receives a very mysterious phone call.

When “the voice” reveals that he seems to know what Sam is planning to do, he gets paranoid believing it could be the CIA or Military Intelligence.

As the story unfolds “the voice” starts to reveal information about Sam’s life that nobody knows, except him. All while sharing a spiritual message about the meaning of life, shattering all belief systems he had held for his entire life.

 

Mood board

Through Sam’s story, we’ll visit the darkest side of living with mental health issues like guilt, remorse, mental confusion, anxiety and a sense of worthlessness. In contrast to this darkness, “The Great Awakening” also presents one of those "Aha!" moments that can change our lives forever, transforming everything we once knew as reality and turning darkness into light.  You´re in for a wonderful ride!

Let your own beliefs be challenged. Back this film to make it happen.

 

What if you could talk to “a voice” who knows you better than yourself?

What questions would you ask? What would you like to discover? Would you be prepared to learn the truth about your existence?

Donate to see what Sam discovered about himself. Choose your perk now.
 

 


About the writer/director Lucas Jatobá. Why I want to make this film:

Hi, my name is Lucas Jatobá, I´m 39 years old and I am the writer and director of  “The Great Awakening”.

I had my own “Great Awakening” back in 2013, when I resigned from a successful career in the advertising industry to follow my dream of making films with a purpose. Now my mission and my dream are “to bring to life films & ideas that raise consciousness and inspire people to be the best version of themselves.” This inner shift was only possible through a deep process of self-immersion and self-awareness, and through my films, I want to inspire others to do the same. I believe that as a collective we have the power to co-create a new reality in which everyone is empowered to live in peace, truth, freedom, joy, love, and harmony with both ourselves and all other living beings on this beautiful planet, ultimately leaving a wonderful legacy for our children and grandchildren.

We're producing this project 100% independently. I have been working on it for over a year without any kind of funding or grants. If you can, please back this project. Any help is greatly appreciated so we can continue working and deliver the final project to the world.

Join me in this inspiring project and together we can make a positive impact in the lives of thousands of people like you and me.

 

About writer/director Lucas Jatobá. Professional career:

Holding 3 nationalities (Australian, Brazilian and Italian), writer/director Lucas Jatobá is a citizen of the world. In the last decade he has lived and worked on 3 continents, giving him deep knowledge and wisdom about what it means to be human.

His short documentary “Phenomenality” (written and directed by, Australia, 2018) has been recognized with the Audience Award at the DOC LA Festival® (Los Angeles, USA, 2017) and became Official Selection at Flickerfest Int. Short Film Festival (Academy Award® and BAFTA® Qualifying, Australia, 2018), among many other accolades.

His documentary series "Divine Women" (written/directed/produced by, Spain, 2020) aims to explain the shift in consciousness and the return of the Divine Feminine energy that our society is currently experiencing, told from the perspective of spiritual teachers who are pathing the way for a new paradigm on planet Earth.

His fashion film “Love Yourself” (written and produced by, Australia, 2016), starring Ryan Corr and Sophie Lowe, went viral and won the People Choice's Award, along with nominations for Best Australian Film and Best Directing at the Australian Fashion Film Awards.

Lucas has directed films for global brands like Sony, TomTom and Le Coq Sportif.

You can help us to make this film, so together we can transform lives and make our planet a better place for ourselves and many generations to come.

 

What you get | The Perks

Like in a game, we are going to work with milestones. Our goals will be progressive and every time we achieve a milestone, we will unlock exclusive perks and use the extra funds to make our film even better.


Status of the project

Lucas has been working on the script for over a year and it´s now ready to go! Pre-production has already begun over 3 months ago and now we need your help so we can move on into the production stage.

Locations confirmed at Mount Tambourine, Gold Coast, Australia
After over one month of location scouting, we have two gorgeous (23 million-year-old) subtropical rainforest locations at Mount Tambourine, one being an incredible “Indiana Jones-style” jaw-dropping rock canyon for the final scene. The Gold Coast has been the location chosen by big Hollywood productions such as Thor, Aquaman, Pacific Rim, The Chronicles of Narnia and many others. 

 

The Main Crew



Fran Villalba: Composer of the original soundtrack
Composer Fran Villalba has been confirmed and already briefed by Lucas on the soundtrack. Fran has composed music for several feature films that have been selected for A-List festivals like Berlin International Film Festival (Berlinale), Raindance, and Cannes.

 



Peter Szilveszter: Director of Photography (along with his trusted camera crew)
Director of Photography Peter Szilveszter is confirmed on board along with his trusted camera crew (Cam. Operator, Focus Puller, Gimbal Operator and Cam. Assistant). Peter has worked on the gorgeous “The Legend of Ben Hall” feature film, among many other projects.

 



Rene Hernandez: First Assistant Director
A writer/director/producer himself with over 20 years of experience in the film industry, his films have gathered the most coveted awards such as Clermont-Ferrand International Short Film Festival, Flickerfest International Short Film Festival, Sydney Film Festival, Melbourne International Film Festival, Aspen Shortsfest and many more.

 

Timeline

Funding: Where’s your money going?

The money raised will be used towards:  

Cast & Crew: 40% (15 professionals shooting for 3-4 days)

Camera & Gear: 15% (Camera Red or Alexa, Gimbal, Lights, Lenses, etc)

Post-production: 20% (edit, original music, sound mix, color grading, VFX, etc)

Other costs: 25% (perks to the backers, film locations, insurance, catering, transport, admin, art props, unit, film festivals, etc)

 

Audio, language and subtitles

The film will be spoken in English, with Closed Captions available in English.

We´ll have subtitles in Brazilian Portuguese. Teremos legendas em português!

If we raise more funds than our goal we can also add subtitles in other languages such as Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch and others, depending on the origin of our backers.

 

Why is this important to me, you and everyone else?

With globally about 354 million adults survivors of war suffering from PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder) or some sort of mental health issue, chances are if not you, you know a friend or family member who is living under excruciating stress, sadness, anger, guilt, pain, amongst other feelings that deteriorate life in silence. But it doesn’t need to be like this. By generating awareness and encouraging people to seek help we can turn this around.

With your contribution, we can rewrite the ending to this story. 

 

Do you love watching films?

If you’re any way like me and have enjoyed thousands of films, series and documentaries, it only makes sense for you to take it one step further and join this project by becoming a supporter. This your opportunity to give back to independent filmmakers who have been working hard behind the scenes so you can watch amazing stories! :)

Teamwork makes the dream work! Join us and be a part of the production.

 

Do you want to expand your consciousness?

If like me, you love personal development and are always working on becoming the best version of yourself, this film is for you!

 

Become a part of the team

When you contribute to bringing a film to life, you become a part of the team. Everyone has an important role to play, and yours is no different. 

Support is not about what you can give, it’s about the difference you can make.

 

Create some good karma for yourself

By helping me, you’re helping many others. With your help I will be able to hire a lot of people who were heavily impacted by Covid this year and would appreciate the opportunity to work on this project: actors, camera and sound crew, hair and make-up artists, editors, light and sound engineers, and many more. Plus, this film will have a big emotional impact on everyone who watches it, so you´re helping all those people as well.

We will always rise by lifting others. Help us to manifest this project and ultimately you will help the world.


What happens after the campaign ends on IndieGogo?

As soon as we have the funds, we are moving into production mode – yay can’t wait! Are we there yet?

 

Risks & Challenges during Covid times

We have everything organized but as you know, more often than not things don’t go exactly to plan.

The script is set, the locations are scouted, and we are very excited to begin production. Filming in a pandemic, however, presents a whole new set of challenges, so we are prepared with a contingency plan in place in case anything happens.

It will take longer than usual to film due to all the restrictions in place. We need more space to keep a safe distance, and extra covid-safe gear and procedures are required. But still, we are as excited as hell and can’t wait to start filming! 

The only part missing now is you and your contribution. We are so excited to get the ball rolling and take this film off the ground. Choose your perk and back this project now, please. :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love our project but can't contribute, that’s ok. The fact you can’t contribute with money doesn't mean that you can't help. You can help us spread the word about the film and the campaign by:

  • Sending this campaign to friends, family, colleagues, and any movie lovers in your life who would want to support the cause. You can do so using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Following us on Instagram and/or Facebook and sharing our posts to get the word out

Click here to follow us on Instagram

Click here to follow us on Facebook

 

 

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE :)

Thank you so much for your support, and we can't wait to get the film to a screen near you! Be sure that your contribution will be incredibly helpful to bring light and hope to a lot of people suffering from mental health issues on our planet.

Source of some images: Feature film "Jungle" (2017, Dir. Greg McLean) with Daniel Radcliffe
Music in the video: “Dust” by Hans Zimmer

Choose your perk and back this project now, please. :) Other Ways You Can HelpIf you love our project but can't contribute, that’s ok. The fact you can’t contribute with money doesn't mean that you can't help. You can help us spread the word about the film and the campaign by:
Sending this campaign to friends, family, colleagues, and any movie lovers in your life who would want to support the cause. You can do so using the Indiegogo share tools.
Following us on Instagram and/or Facebook and sharing our posts to get the word out
Click here to follow us on InstagramClick here to follow us on Facebook  THANK YOU IN ADVANCE :)Thank you so much for your support, and we can't wait to get the film to a screen near you! Be sure that your contribution will be incredibly helpful to bring light and hope to a lot of people suffering from mental health issues on our planet.Source of some images: Feature film "Jungle" (2017, Dir. Greg McLean) with Daniel RadcliffeMusic in the video: “Dust” by Hans Zimmer

story:
Roberto Enrique Clemente Walker's entrance into the MLB was a hallmark moment. The Civil Rights Movement in the United States had come and gone, and no Caribbean or Latin American baseball player had ever been inducted into the Hall of Fame.  Roberto Clemente would change that.

Making his debut only eight years after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, Clemente faced tremendous adversity. But through it all, he managed to hold on to his humanity and his morality, finding his own way in the world and ascending to the heights of the sport he loved.

Our film Clemente, tells the story of the man, the pioneer, and the right fielder, Roberto Clemente, and delves deep into his character, focusing on his strengths and flaws. This film is produced in the grand tradition of other great baseball films like 42, Field of Dreams, The Natural, and Pride of The Yankees, celebrating Clemente as the American hero he is – and shining a light on his quest for justice, right up to his untimely death at the age of 38.

Produced by Period Pictures and Bella Bene Productions, Clemente represents an unflinching look at the human experience.

Our goal through this campaign is to raise at least $35,000. That is certainly not enough for a movie but here is an important point: we are ready to move forward with a multi-million dollar budget. But to do that, we need to cover our legal expenses, hire a casting director,  get locations, as well as cover other miscellaneous things that are a part of pre-production.

To say thanks to all of our backers, we are offering limited-edition Clemente movie memorabilia and other perks.  These are unique perks and opportunities that you will cherish and they are available exclusively through this campaign.

Contribute now and let's tell the Roberto Clemente story together.

Clemente is an important film about an Afro-Latino man who always made his own way and who achieved glory both on and off the diamond. Clemente will provide a role model as well as a reminder of what is good and of what is possible.

"If you have a chance to accomplish something that will make things better for people coming behind you, and you don’t do that, you are wasting your time on this earth."

- Roberto Clemente (1934 - 1972)

There is always a risk of delay during film production. The film could go over budget, or we could have to put everything on pause. We are confident, however, that we have prepared for pre-production sufficiently. Once we raise the pre-production funds that we need, we do not believe we will run into any challenges so daunting that they force us to push back our timeline. We will send you regular updates regardless, keeping you in the loop about Clemente and letting you know when you can see it for yourself.

In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can also show your support for Clemente by getting others to support us.

Thank you!
