story:
Production has now started on Glory & Defeat!

Every new pledge will help us towards our stretch goals that will allow us to make the documentary series more detailed and help us give every topic the attention it needs.

Stretch Goals

€ 125,000

Every pledge allows us to make the documentary series more detailed and give every topic its due time. With this goal we can create a complete documentary series for the entire duration of the war with a total runtime of more than 4.5 hours. 

€ 200,000

Paris Commune week by week. One of the most dramatic consequences of the Franco-Prussian War was the Paris Commune, an uprising that pitted communards against the French Army in a bloody civil conflict. If we reach this goal, we will cover it week by week as well. 

Franco-Prussian War Documentary and Book 

The Franco-Prussian War (War of 1870) was one of the pivotal events of the 19th century. It paved the way for decades of Franco-German rivalry and it led to the creation of the German Empire and a new French Republic. Glory & Defeat tells the story of the Franco Prussian War week by week on YouTube exactly 151 years after the events. 

It’s time for the prequel to The Great War

In the mid-19th century, Europe looked quite different than today. There was the 2nd French Empire under Napoleon III, nephew of the legendary Napoleon who had nearly conquered the continent decades earlier. In central Europe the situation was chaotic with a number of rapidly changing German states. Prussia, under the ambitious King Wilhelm I and his chancellor Otto von Bismarck, was rapidly expanding through multiple wars (against Denmark and Austria) and by 1870 was in control of the North German Confederation. The Confederation encompassed Prussia and multiple other states like Brunswick and Saxony – and it had close ties with the German states in the south like Bavaria and Würtemberg. 

Napoleon III and Wilhelm I had quite different ideas for the future power structure of Europe – to say the least – and in 1870 this came to a head. After Bismarck leaked the infamous Ems Dispatch to the press, France and the German States went to war. And this Franco-Prussian War would change Europe forever. 

Beyond Sedan, beyond Bismarck

Today, Bismarck’s manoeuvring leading up to the war and engagements like the Battle of Sedan or the Siege of Paris are often remembered and sometimes even mystified. But the War of 1870 (as it’s called in French) was much more than that: over 3 million men went to arms and more than 150,000 soldiers died during the months-long campaign. The fighting wasn’t just concentrated around Paris; the ‘Southern Army' under General von Manteuffel famously drove the French Army of the East, commanded by general Charles-Denis Bourbaki, into the mountains near the Swiss border. With the Battle of Havana and a French naval blockade, the war even had an often-overlooked naval front. 

The ultimate defeat of the French Empire and the French Republic that emerged during the war, the proclamation of the German Empire in Versailles in 1871, and much more, are reasons enough to remember this important part of European history. The use of modern technology like trains and artillery and the rivalry between France and Germany that would fester until 1914 need to be examined to fully understand the lead up to the First World War. 

For its 150th anniversary, the Franco-Prussian War has come back into the spotlight with new research and publications. We want to tell its fascinating story for a new generation using the newest research. In the most detailed documentary series about this war ever made (total run time planned: over 4.5 hours), you will experience the war through the eyes of the people that lived through it. 

We can only tell this story with your direct support. 

Neither the traditional broadcast companies nor TV stations would be suitable for our vision. We can only tell the story of the Franco-Prussian War with your support. Glory & Defeat is the culmination of what we learned from our previous crowdfunded documentaries to better bring you our brand of Real Time History: history with multiple perspectives, easy-to-follow animations and using sources from all sides.  

Direct supporters will not just get access to all episodes of Glory & Defeat ad-free and outside of YouTube. They will also get extended episodes with deep dives on topics that YouTube doesn’t like. 

A free version of the documentary will be uploaded weekly to YouTube. With a more niche topic, we need to attract as wide an audience as possible and there is no way around YouTube when it comes to online video. We hope that the Franco-Prussian War won’t fall victim to YouTube’s algorithm like our World War 1 and World War 2 content in the past. Should YouTube interfere, the documentary will be available for backers regardless. So, only crowdfunding allows us to tell this story as comprehensively and completely unbiased as we possibly can. 

Rewards 

All rewards include digital access to the documentary except the book only perk. You will get access to all episodes of Glory & Defeat ad-free and outside of YouTube. These will also be extended episodes with deep dives on everything Franco-Prussian War. Every backer will also get access to behind-the-scenes content and be invited to our community Discord server where you can chat with other backers and with the production crew. 

Glory & Defeat Book

Our Official Companion Book will be the ultimate companion to the documentary series. It will contain all extended scripts for the show edited for reading and including the amazing artwork and illustrations featured in the show. Furthermore, there will be a chapter about exploring the Franco-Prussian War battlefields yourselves and much more. 

Virtual Battlefield Tour

In a year where travelling is a bigger challenge than usual, we're offering an exciting interactive virtual battlefield tour of the Sedan battlefield with Jesse Alexander. In this streamed and guided tour, we will show you the actual battlefield and its intricacies. Also includes streaming the documentary and behind the scenes access.


Meet the Team

We are Real Time History, the team behind the successful YouTube channel The Great War and the groundbreaking documentary series 16 Days in Berlin and Rhineland 45. We have produced well over 100 hours of high-quality history documentaries over the past years and over 225 million views!

Host and researcher Jesse has an MA in history and has been studying early 20th-century history for years. He speaks English, French, German and Russian. For Glory & Defeat, we will be working with some of the most renowned experts of the Franco-Prussian War.

Catherine Pfauth & Prof. Dr Tobias Arand – Script Writing & Research



Cathérine Pfauth BA is a research assistant at the Ludwigsburg University of Education . In 2020/21 as an editor she was responsible for the Twitter project 'Heute vor 150 Jahren - @Krieg7071' covering the Franco-Prussian War in real-time. She has already presented the project internationally at several conferences. 

Prof. Dr Tobias Arand teaches history didactics and history science at the Ludwigsburg University of Education. Numerous publications on the Franco-Prussian War, including the 2018 standard work '1870/71 - Der Deutsch-Französische Krieg erzählt in Einzelschicksalen', distinguish him as an expert on the subject.

BATTLEFIELD DESIGN 

A small studio with big ideas and a passion for history. Battlefield Design works with publishers, authors, museums, historians and tour operators all over the world and specializes in book cover design and battlefield cartography. The Glory & Defeat Logo, graphical elements and maps were designed by Battlefield Design. 

CHRISTA HOOK

Christa Hook is a fine artist and illustrator who specializes in military history. 
Her paintings have attracted commissions from museums, publishers and military organizations around the world. The cover art for Glory & Defeat is just a small taste of her work. 

FLO WITTIG


CEO & Executive Producer

Before founding Real Time History with Toni Steller, Florian produced The Great War YouTube channel since its inception. Flo is a native Berliner and responsible for content planning and community management, both vital to the success of the The Great War. Flo has an MA as Creative Producer from the Zurich University of Arts and a BA as Online-Editor from the University of Applied Sciences Cologne.

 

TONI STELLER


Director & Production Manager

Toni Steller has been working in the TV and online video industries in Berlin for over ten years. As a trained and state-approved audio-visual media designer, he worked for popular TV productions in Germany as producer and director. Toni has been behind the look and feel of The Great War since the very beginning. Beyond the studio, he successfully transferred the show's characteristics to the outside world when The Great War was filmed in museums or former battlefields.

 

JESSE ALEXANDER


Historian & Broadcaster

 Jesse Alexander is a historian, educator and higher education professional based in Vienna, Austria. He holds a BA in History from the University of Ottawa and an MA in Modern History from the University of Vienna. His focus is conflict in the first half of the 20th century. He has worked as a researcher and educator with Canada's Cold War Museum, the Canadian Museum of Civilization, the Canadian War Museum, the National Research Council of Canada, le Centre Juno Beach, le Mémorial national du Canada à Vimy, the Library of Parliament of Canada and more. With his passion for presenting history to a diverse audience, he recently joined The Great War as the new host and lead writer and with his ability to speak English, French, German and Russian, he brings an international perspective to the project.

 

DAN MORELLE


Crowdfunding Producer

Dan is a creative entrepreneur, producer, and qualified teacher. Dan has produced several hit podcasts including 'You're Dead to Me! for the BBC, and his shows have had 10 million downloads combined. Dan has organised events at Downing Street, raised £1M with crowdfunding, and was a co-founder of History Hit with Broadcaster, Dan Snow. In 2017 Dan headed Crowdfunding and Community at Dig Hill 80 - an archaeological excavation of a WW1 battlefield in Wijtschate, Belgium that recovered the remains of 135 soldiers. He has a BA in Communications & Audio Visual Production from London Metropolitan University, a Post Graduate Certificate in Education.

Get Involved

Whether or not you can make a financial pledge at the moment, we'd still really appreciate your help in spreading the word about this campaign. You can do this by sharing this page via social media, or mentioning the documentary and book to your friends. Thank you!

Contact Us

You can reach us at support@realtimehistory.net or on Messenger here. We'll get back to you within 48 hours.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit the page and check out what Physique is about, now on IMDb. 

NEW UPDATES : 

We have officially finalised our shoot date to be December 11th-13th with three rehearsals starting the 20th November, once every week leading up to the shoot. We have partnered with Angelina Gorgaeva and her account @dance.film.performance to find our last two male dancers. Music has been secured from one artist's song on Spotify and Itunes, and other music is being specifically composed for the film.

Raising the first 6,000 will go towards getting us started in rehearsals (which includes rehearsal space and actors) along with actual shooting day locations, cast +crew, catering and transportation. 

Secured crew + cast include DOP, First AD, Camera Assistant, Producers, Choreographer, Production designer, Hair and Make-up artist, Female Dancers and BTS photographer. 

We recently have just attached an editor, Phillip Pagett who will be working with us during Post Production. After editing we will begin to submit to film festivals, where two international film festivals have shown interest already, as well as a UK production company who are moved by the topic and willing to help with distribution. 

Raising the last 4,000 will go into post-production, music licences, film festival submissions and doing a Principal Cast photography shoot for posters.  It will also help fund getting a venue for a special premiere you get the opportunity to attend to with the cast and crew, after its run its festival circuit! 

We are very excited to get this film made and will be opening up further conversations on our social media @physiquefilm to bring awareness to the matter. We would love to have you join us on this journey and become a part of a larger conversation. If you cannot donate, please share the word, as our crowdfund ends on the 19th of November. 

I am Jennifer James, 22 years old, and the creator of Physique. My recent credit was an associate producer on The Nightriders and we exceeded our crowdfunding goal. I have a short film in Aesthetica Film Festival 2020 and am an Award-Winning Dancer. 

Also, on my project is Clair Gleave who is an Award-Winning TV and Film actress, dancer and choreographer. Check out her Youtube video for more: https://www.youtube.com/user/Clairabellx

Adam, producer, IMDb credits and currently worked on Sikh Soldier. 

Nitin, producer, IMDb Credits  

What inspired me to create this project was my own personal struggles with this matter, and also the urge to speak up.  Hopefully, it will inspire many other young dancers that they are more than their physique.

We have already generated interest from film festivals and production companies that wish to help us when we get it made, so if you are willing to help, any support you are able to give us is greatly appreciated. 

If you are interested in learning more, please keep reading and I hope you will support + join us on this journey. 

Our dancers are now cast!! Check them out below 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, there are challenges to any film production, but the crew is positive and passionate about seeing this project happen. If we do not meet our goal we cannot make this happen. With COVID unpredictabilities we also understand that we will be safe on set and will post-pone for the safety of our cast + crew. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are struggling with the effects and cannot donate, please share us on social media(: 

Facebook - Twitter - Instagram

 

Contact

We'd love to hear from you if you have any questions on the film or just want to get in touch! info.physique.film@gmail.com

Adam, producer, IMDb credits and currently worked on Sikh Soldier. 
Nitin, producer, IMDb Credits  
What inspired me to create this project was my own personal struggles with this matter, and also the urge to speak up.  Hopefully, it will inspire many other young dancers that they are more than their physique.
We have already generated interest from film festivals and production companies that wish to help us when we get it made, so if you are willing to help, any support you are able to give us is greatly appreciated. 
If you are interested in learning more, please keep reading and I hope you will support + join us on this journey. 

Our dancers are now cast!! Check them out below 





 

 
Risks & Challenges

Of course, there are challenges to any film production, but the crew is positive and passionate about seeing this project happen. If we do not meet our goal we cannot make this happen. With COVID unpredictabilities we also understand that we will be safe on set and will post-pone for the safety of our cast + crew. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are struggling with the effects and cannot donate, please share us on social media(: 
Facebook - Twitter - Instagram
 
Contact
We'd love to hear from you if you have any questions on the film or just want to get in touch! info.physique.film@gmail.com

story:
Story

Paper Rat follows Jackie Dormer, a subpar musician moving into her mid-twenties, still trying to make her dream of being a singer-songwriter come true at each local open mic. After a particularly crushing performance, Jackie finds the key to her success in a back alley; a paper rat. Suddenly things Jackie can’t explain start to happen, first her life is disrupted, but then she’s given the final pieces to make her music connect with her coffee shop audiences. Coffee shops turn into a national stage, and Jackie finds herself in a whirlwind of a situation, all thanks to the mysterious paper rat. When the good times start to get out of hand, it makes Jackie pause -- what really are the intentions of this paper rat?

The film explores themes of creative dreams and naive dispositions, as well as how much the force of life can change situations on a dime. No one is prepared for where their dreams might take them, what the intentions are of those who help them, or whether they can handle what happens along the way. What if the key to the success of your self expression isn’t actually you?


Paper Rat is a film that aims to capture both the absurdity and the realer-than-real implications of success and failure in its extremes.

Crew

Director:

Liam Parker is a returning senior at The University of Alabama majoring in Creative Media with a minor in General Business. Paper Rat began as an idea discussed on a student film set during Liam’s freshman year, garnering widespread support and blossoming into a story that has been waiting for its chance to stun audiences. In between drafts, Liam has worked as a documentary and commercial cinematographer, as well as in Grip and Electric departments on 15+ student sets. In his directorial debut, Liam seeks to give viewers an experience they will always remember.

Producer:

Sam Indyke is a senior at the University of Alabama, majoring in Creative Media with a minor in Communication. Throughout her time at UA Sam has worked on multiple short films, producing three in this past year alone. Sam is so excited to finish out her first semester senior year producing Paper Rat, alongside Liam and Mack. While the story of Paper Rat is initially what pulled Sam in, she is excited to make this set a learning opportunity for newcomers and underclassmen! 

Director of Photography:

Mack McCollum is an alumnus of the University of Alabama with a degree in Telecommunications and film. He has 4+ years of commercial production work and 1+ year of church media. Most of his work has been in cinematography, gaffing, grip and editing. Mack also has 4+ years of live production work and has directed over 300 multicam services.

Timeline

Paper Rat will be shooting November 12th - 14th, 2021.

The film will reach completion in the summer of 2022.

Budget

The total budget of Paper Rat is $650.

story:
Hi! I am so excited to be making my debut short film Man Cured. I’ve been obsessed with television and film for forever now and I can’t wait to share with you all what I’m working on.
 

THE WHAT

Man Cured is a film that takes place right here in Brooklyn, New York. The story follows Lucas, a shy and sensitive 22 year old babysitter who often spends his weekends watching a precocious 7 year old named Freud. What’s set to simply be any other Friday evening is suddenly upended when Lucas arrives to discover a new babysitter named Frankie is already in the brownstone. What happens as a chance occurrence between two young men spirals into a weekend of self-discovery and acceptance. 
 

THE WHY 

The script is inspired both by my own self-journey and the people I’ve met since coming to New York. So many gay stories on screen hinge on a romance or a tragedy (or often both), and for my producer Alex and I, we’ve found that doesn't necessarily reflect that reality we live in. Sure, those situations exist, but so do all the little moments that leave lasting marks. We’re here to create and tell those unique, authentic stories that are actually worth the watch. 

Man Cured takes a slice-of-life approach to one weekend in our protagonist’s journey that opens his eyes to so much more. Part coming of age, part coming to terms, and part coming out, it’s a dramedy that tenderly takes you through the internal (and oft misdirected) rage that silently burns inside so many of us. 
 

THE LOOK AND FEEL

In bringing Man Cured to life, I've found inspiration in various movies and TV shows, specifically Andrew Haigh's Weekend, Dee Rees' Pariah, Eliza Hittman's Beach Rats and yes... even GIRLS. Whether it be their intimate grit, happenstance encounters, or Brooklyn roots, they each feel etched into a shared understanding of what it means to be a young person figuring out who they are.

Color will also play a large part in distinguishing Lucas' world. From how it surrounds him to how he eventually embraces it, our soft hues of blue and purple will saturate in different scenes, creating an unmistakable aura.

References

Color & Tone


MEET THE TEAM

There are always risks when making a movie, but luckily I have the best team possible to make this film a full-fledged reality. Here’s a little about us—

 

Kyle Heiner

Writer, Co-Director

Kyle is a writer from Portland, OR who's found his way in Brooklyn, NY. He’s created out-of-the-box work for HBO, Stella Artois, Target, and Urban Decay. Beyond being a gay, vegan, pop culture connoisseur, he’s passionate about making things, and making them well.

He’s thrilled to be working on this project with such a talented group of artists. He believes in the beautifully-intimate power of storytelling and Man Cured is just the beginning of what’s to come. 

He’s currently writing his debut novel set on the Oregon Coast.

Johan Anderson

Co-Director

Johan is an American filmmaker and commercial director. He has written and directed pieces for some of the most iconic brands in the world including Samsung, Starbucks, Converse and Google.

He is known for his keen eye for detail, with strong aesthetic choices, deep understanding of character and fresh production design. His narrative films have screened all over the world including the Cannes Film Festival.

His debut feature film is slated to shoot in the summer of 2022 in his home state of Minnesota.

Alex Hilliard

Producer

Alexandria is a Creative Producer based in Brooklyn, NY. She has spent the majority of her career producing work in the commercial space for high profile global brands. As of late, she has begun to make her way into the narrative and music video world.

As a mixed race (Black and Portuguese), queer woman, Alexandria believes heavily in the importance of telling stories through the lens of those in the BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ communities.

Molly Block

Production Designer, Associate Producer

Molly is a Technical Producer and Production Designer based in New York, NY. She has produced live and virtual events, fashion shows, and brand activations across the country. With her background in theatrical production and scenic fabrication, she is currently focusing on discovering the stories about the people around her and revealing the world they live in.  

Molly is excited to join the team of Man Cured and looks forward to future projects where she can collaborate with fellow artists creating space at the intersection of art and community.

Heather McTavish

1st Assistant Director

Heather (better known as "MCT") is a Creative Director based in Brooklyn, NY. She is known for breaking boundaries and pushing category convention.

As a queer and mixed race woman, she strives to create work that captures emotions geared toward the underrepresented and overlooked. 

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Independent filmmaking is a labor of love and there are several expenses we hope to account for. We want to do this story right by authoring authenticity and creating a high quality, compelling queer film that catches your attention — and that can happen with your help! 

First and foremost, after a time where many were out of work, we believe our cast and crew should be accommodated accordingly. Beyond that, our full budget breakdown can be seen below. Funding this short will help us share our art with the world. 

We are striving to meet the goal of $10,500. All of the money raised here will go directly to the film and covering our Indiegogo fees. You can also check out our donation perks listed on this page. Our team is so excited to make this project and we appreciate your support! 

 

Where Your Money Will Go

Funding Stretch Goals

$10,500 - This will allow us to cover all of our production costs while ensuring that our cast and crew are compensated with the rates they deserve. This will also help us cover some of our post production costs!

$15,000 - Level up. This will allow us to cover all of our production AND post costs, while also allowing us to rent some additional equipment that will make our film look even better!

$20,000 - The Dream! This will allow us to go above and beyond on all of our production and post needs, therefore elevating our film across the board. This will also cover our festival submission fees!

 

Other Ways to Help

We understand that times are hard these days. If you are unable to contribute monetarily, there are some other ways you can still help us bring our film to life:

  • Give us a shout online! Share our Indiegogo link with friends, family and followers.
  • If you’re in the NYC area and you know anyone that could help us out with equipment, catering, or anything else we've mentioned above, send us a note!

 

Thank you!

The Man Cured Team

story:
Have you ever heard of the Native boarding school experience? Where Native children were ripped from there homes and forced to assimilate into western culture. There many children faced sexual, physical and verbal abuse.

Douk is film that touches on these subjects.

Douk is a historical fiction drama that takes place in 1910. It tells the story of a young Native girl, Irene, who deals with a difficult reality of her and her sister being taken away from their family and sent to boarding school, where they will be assimilated into the western culture. This means that once this happens, they will no longer be able to practice their language, culture, and traditions. In order to prevent this from becoming a true actuality, Irene’s parents hatch a plan to save them.

Inspiration for this Story

This project was inspired by not only my great grandmother, who experienced these types of boarding schools, but other tribal elders’ stories in my community. For many years this has been a topic that has a hidden subject from general discussion in the United States. This is a subject that needs to be explored and discussed by the general public.

The Team

Writer/Director - Michelle Hernandez

Michelle Hernandez is a Native American filmmaker and photographer. She is a Wiyot tribal member and grew up on the Table Bluff Reservation. She is currently pursuing her Masters in Film and Electronic Media at American University in Washington, D.C. She received her B.A. at Humboldt State in both Film and Native American Studies. Many of her work focuses on the importance of culture, traditions, and identity, as well as dealing with Native American subjects. With her work she wants to give voice to stories that help breakdown stereotypes. 

Producer - Courtney Brooks

Courtney Brooks is a photojournalist, filmmaker, and scriptwriter who enjoys creating and watching films that bring awareness to true stories. Courtney has a BS in Biology from Spelman College and a MA in film and Video from American University. She believes that through film you can take any issue and make it feel more personal to those who may not be directly affected by it. She believes that if you can get people to see someone else's perspective, you can get them to care and get involved. That is the power of filmmaking for her and why she has dedicated her passion for film and photography to telling the stories that bring awareness, create conversation, action, and change. Courtney's future plans involve directing for documentaries as well as continuing her work as a photojournalist and scriptwriter.

Producer - Carolyn Silvernail

Carolyn Silvernail is a photographer, filmmaker, and musician. Born in Germany as an Air Force brat, Carolyn is now a military wife of an Army officer. Having lived in various countries and states in the US, she currently lives in the DC area with her husband and two cats. Carolyn has her BA in music performance from Millikin University, her BA in filmmaking from New Mexico State University, and an MS in Exercise Science and Health Promotion from California University of Pennsylvania. At present, she is working on completing her MFA degree in Filmmaking at American University with her thesis film, Before I Wake. Her future plans involve directing and working as a DP in the film industry as well as continuing her work as a photographer and digital artist. 

Assistant to Producer/Editor - Richard Wenzler

Richie Wenzler is a Master of Fine Arts Candidate for Film and Electronic Media at American University. He’s finishing up on his thesis project Insomnia Nights. In the fall of 2012, Richie earned a B.A. Degree in both Telecommunications and Communications & Culture at Indiana University. Currently, Richie works as a film reviewer for Picture Lock. He has also appeared on the Picture Lock radio show and Arlington in the Morning on WERA FM. Most recently, Richie was a freelance editor for ACE Media and assisted on several projects of theirs. One of his works has been featured on sites including Sports Spectrum and ESPN. In addition, Richie has been involved in various film productions, and loves to collaborate with others. A lifelong fan of film, Richie hopes he can infect his energy of film to others.  

Director of Photography - Ross Godwin

Ross Godwin is an award-winning filmmaker from Washington, DC, and an MFA graduate of American University. A writer, director, and cinematographer, Ross has worked on a variety of different projects across genres and across the globe; from Alaska, to Czech Republic, from Mexico to the Isle of Saba, and everywhere in between. His directorial debut, What You Sow, went on to win best student short at the Indie Gathering Film festival, while other projects, such as Forgotten River and Stow Away were official selections at the Environmental Film Festival and Escape Velocity respectively. Among his most current projects is the short film, Riverment, which was a successful crowdfunded project that is now in its completion stages. 

Assistant Camera - Zan Gillies

Zan attended the College of William & Mary, graduating with a Film Studies degree in 2009. He was one of twelve screenwriters selected for a mentorship in The Writers Store's Industry Insider contest in 2011, and was a semi-finalist for the Academy Nicholl Fellowship in 2016. He has worked as a cinematographer on two feature films and roughly a dozen shorts, and has written and directed three short films. He is currently finishing up his Masters of Fine Arts degree in film at American University.

Why your help is so important!

We are so excited to share this project with the world, but before that can happen we need your help! Our funding goal is based on a detailed production budget and we need every penny to make this film a reality.

Budget Breakdown:

  • Cast and Crew 
  • Travel Expenses 
  • Camera 
  • Lighting 
  • Sound
  • Period Costumes/ Set Design 
  • Music 
  • Food and Lodging 
  • Marketing and Publicity Post Production 
  • Film Festival Fees

As many of you know, creating a great film is not free and we appreciate each and every penny donated.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people can't contribute, but there are other ways you can still help us!

  • Share this campaign! Share with the people you know! Share with the ones you don't! Just share! The more people we can reach, the closer Douk will become a reality. This can make a huge difference!
  • Follow Douk! You can follow the film on our Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook pages to keep up with updates and more.

Please contact us with any inquiries or comments to: doukfilm@gmail.com and visit our Website page!

This is a story that needs to be told and with your generous help, we can bring it to life.

Much love,

Team Douk

Risks and challenges

The bigger the risk, the bigger the payoff. Douk is an ambitious project and we are consciously making decisions to bring authenticity and realism to our film. This authenticity extends to locations, actors, set design, and costumes. As this is a period piece taking place in the early 1900’s, it is essential that we have what we need to adhere to that time period. We plan to shoot on a traditional Native village in California using local Native actors as well as bringing in Native actors from different areas of the country. Many of our crew are based in the Washington DC area and finding the funds to send us to California is a crucial first step. We know where we want to shoot, but we need the funds to get us there. We also need to find our Native actors and we need the funds to do so. That said, our biggest expenses and challenges will be travel costs, cast/crew expenses, set design and costumes. Creating a meaningful and accurate story is our main focus and hitting our Indiegogo goal will bring us much closer to bringing the film to life.

Follow Douk! You can follow the film on our Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook pages to keep up with updates and more.
Please contact us with any inquiries or comments to: doukfilm@gmail.com and visit our Website page!This is a story that needs to be told and with your generous help, we can bring it to life.Much love,Team DoukRisks and challengesThe bigger the risk, the bigger the payoff. Douk is an ambitious project and we are consciously making decisions to bring authenticity and realism to our film. This authenticity extends to locations, actors, set design, and costumes. As this is a period piece taking place in the early 1900’s, it is essential that we have what we need to adhere to that time period. We plan to shoot on a traditional Native village in California using local Native actors as well as bringing in Native actors from different areas of the country. Many of our crew are based in the Washington DC area and finding the funds to send us to California is a crucial first step. We know where we want to shoot, but we need the funds to get us there. We also need to find our Native actors and we need the funds to do so. That said, our biggest expenses and challenges will be travel costs, cast/crew expenses, set design and costumes. Creating a meaningful and accurate story is our main focus and hitting our Indiegogo goal will bring us much closer to bringing the film to life.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to our fundraiser! thank you so much for checking out our page and giving us the opportunity to inform you about Godsend. Below we are briefly going to explain a little bit about us as a crew, give you an insight into the world of Godsend and what we hope you'll help us achieve, thank you:

  • Based in Brighton and London, our skeletal crew of filmmakers have a combined 70+ years on features, commercials, music videos and short films just like this one. We all came together after reading Godsend and fell in love with an ambitious, beautiful story set in a world full of horror and decay.
  • THIS CAMPAIGN IS BIG. As a crew we sat down and worked out what it would take to create a post-apocalyptic world set in the English countryside full of Radiated humans and awe-inspiring set pieces, and we came to this conclusion. We could make it on £3k if we are focused and resourceful.
  • We cannot express how much it means to us for you to support our goal. We've done the maths and this story is gonna be bigger than our budget when it hits the screens. So help us make something memorable, exciting and thrilling for all of you movie-goers and cinephiles.

What We Need & What You Get

We understand that investing money into the arts isn't often priority but we've listed what's needed, why and how you can make a change:

  • Our target is to raise £3k. This covers both cast and crew expenses, locations, amenities such as food and petrol to much cooler things such as hazmat suits, zombie make-up and a burnt bike pyramid the size of a house!
  • So if you thought the last part above sounded cool, wait until you see what we have instore for you as rewards for your donations. We've got opportunities to be on set with us as a zombie, t-shirts, storyboards, screenplays and digital copies of the film!
  • Our target is to raise £3k but a question that always lingers is, what happens if we don't get it? well we are lucky enough to keep what we raised to create a film on a smaller budget, this may mean smaller crew, less practical effects and locations, which seems like it'll be ok, but it effects the story massively, so help us in raising the precise amount and you'll get a post-apocalyptic thrill ride!

The Impact

This is by far the biggest film we've ever made and that's why you have such a monumental part to play. Here's a few reasons why it's important to us that you help us.

  • Supporting our film encourages others to support us, be it financially or practically.
  • Previous to Godsend, we were successful in campaigning for both of our other short films and we couldn't have done that without you. Both of which won awards and encouraged local businesses to help us with cheaper kit hires and locations for free!
  • Short films are a gateway for local filmmakers to be recognised for our talents, which raises our profiles for future works and potential finance for projects down the line.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that this is a huge, ambitious fundraiser but that summarises our story too. From monolithic practical's to large groups of actors on screen, Godsend demands to be fully realised and that comes with challenges. Below, we have listed a few:

  • Large-scale set designs require financial aid and the hands to produce it. Our director has donated a large amount of his own money to push funding for this film. Practical set designs are crucial to make this world believable and authentic. We are also lucky enough to have an expert set-designer on the team who is already underway with planning and scheduling props and materials.
  • A two-day shoot to create such a diverse world is challenging and time constraints are plenty. To prevent delays we have scheduled our locations to be within short distances from each other and scenes that require less crew means spare hands can prep the next location.
  • Practical effects such as prosthetics are costly and time consuming but we have a team of highly skilled Make-up artists on standby to create beauty in the ugly.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't support us in other ways:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools so that our campaign is recognised.
  • Share our social media posts on Instagram, Facebook, our website and Indiegogo.

Practical effects such as prosthetics are costly and time consuming but we have a team of highly skilled Make-up artists on standby to create beauty in the ugly.


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't support us in other ways:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools so that our campaign is recognised.
Share our social media posts on Instagram, Facebook, our website and Indiegogo.

story:
Log Line

After the death of Johns sister, he tries to re-construct a sappy home video the two had not completed previous to her death. John's' parents are both in a toxic grieving process with drug and alcohol abuse John's home video makes the two quite distressed and angry, closure is at steak on the line of becoming destroyed

From the Director & Writer

Hey, I’m Callum Osterberg an Australian Film Student in Melbourne, trying to make my vision for Jonhathan Jackson and his story come alive, this idea I have had for over 3 years now is much bigger than what this story I am promoting is. This is only the foundation of Johnathan’s story, a prequal to what I would love to create in future, and make his story even bigger!

Budget we hope to achieve

With this dark little story I've created, I want to pull on people's emotions and take them away from their own headspace into Johnathan's world and his day-to-day life. The Budget I’ve set is very reasonable for $1000 - $1500 for the story this includes, locations (Air BnB), catering for cast and crew, props, costumes, camera equipment, and lighting as well as much more film equipment.

Filming

We hope to be filmed in September – October this year, hopefully you could take part in making this story come to life and onto the screen by donating or sharing this campaign around.

story:
Two men descend into a cave, seeking answers to a book of unknown horrors. What will they find at the edge of sanity?

THE STATEMENT is a short film adaptation of H.P Lovecraft's spine-chilling story 'The Statement of Randolph Carter'.

Summary: Dishevelled and exhausted, an unreliable prisoner recalls the terrible events which transpired in a cave to two inquisitive police detectives, as they investigate a local disappearance.  

This is a unique short film within the Psychological Horror / Cosmic Horror genre. THE STATEMENT is a film that explores themes of Sanity, Cosmic Indifference, Existentialism, Detachment and more. 

Although THE STATEMENT is based on the original H.P Lovecraft story 'The Statement of Randolph Carter', our crew are bringing our own unique vision and sensibilities to the story, whilst respecting and staying true to the original work's intentions, aesthetics and themes. 

What Inspired The Film?

Besides the original story, many other works of art have inspired the overall tone of the film we're developing. Some of these inspirations are:

THE WITCH (2015) | PULSE (2001) | WE NEED TO TALK ABOUT KEVIN (2011) | ANNIHILATION (2018) | THE LIGHTHOUSE (2019) | YOU WERE NEVER REALLY HERE (2017) | NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN (2007) | THE SEVENTH SEAL (1957) | THE THING (1982) | 2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY (1968)

The Characters

Vernon:

Our unreliable narrator, Vernon has always been an outsider and feels like he doesn't belong around anyone. His mysterious and troubled past haunts him. He fears getting attached to people.  

The dream person to cast for Vernon is Chiwetel Ejiofor.

Stanley:

A mysterious and oppressive patriarch figure, Stanley’s quest into the cave seems to be one of redemption. His relationship with Vernon is strange, however, the origin of the book of unknown horrors he has is even more bizarre. 

The dream person to cast for Stanley is Jake Gyllenhaal.

Detective Roth:

A respectful and collected detective, Roth is a very malleable person who always wants to uncover the truth, no matter the cost. 

The dream person to cast for Detective Roth is Henry Fonda.

Detective Doyle: 

A grizzled and confrontational person, Doyle believes in justice above all else. He lets his anger and passion get the better of him. 

The dream person to cast for Detective Doyle is Philip Seymour Hoffman.

The Locations

Inhuman and cosmic horror beyond human comprehension could lay dormant with our locations...however, we're pretty sure they don't! 

There are only two locations necessary for us to make this film - a police interview room and a cave. 

Thanks to the Great Old Ones, we've already managed to organise our locations. 

Here is the room which we will be turning into our police interview room.

The image is a test shoot with some of our crew members. Our Art Department Lead - Ellen - is working hard to transform this room into the creepy and claustrophobic police interview room.

Here is the location of the cave.

We've managed to get access to Yordas Cave, North Yorkshire to allow us to film inside and outside of the cave.  This cave and the surrounding landscapes will make the disturbing and horrific events that will unfold in the film even creepier!

These incredible locations ensure that THE STATEMENT will have very authentic and bone-chilling visuals to complete the Lovecraftian horrors of the narrative. 

The Props

Props and Costumes are incredibly important to THE STATEMENT as we want everything to appear rustic, eroded and authentic to the audience and the characters in the film. 

Many props will feature within the film, however, none hold more significance and importance than the 'Necronomicon'. 

Described in the screenplay as "weathered pages with scribblings that resemble runic symbols from Old Norse, comparable to hieroglyphs from ancient Egypt. It is written in a flowing, circular style".

Check out the 'Necronomicon' created by the Director of THE STATEMENT - Callum Wilkins.

We are Colossal Productions - an independent film production company based in the North West of England.

We create short, documentary and feature films that deliver compelling stories and memorable characters that stay with you forever. Filmmaking is our passion. 

Our incredibly talented crew have worked on many successful films such as the emotional documentary film BREAKING BREAD (2019) and the amazing murder mystery feature film - THE HANGED (Currently in Post-Production).

We understand that we are launching our crowdfunding campaign and producing this film during the current COVID-19 pandemic but we need your help!

Colossal Productions is an independent production company and, as such, doesn't have the financial backing and support that larger production companies do. 

If you love films, Horror films or Cosmic Horror and Lovecraftian Horror films - please donate and support this project. 

We need art to help us through these turbulent times more than ever!

We NEED your help, without funding from the public this film can't be made and the more money that we can raise, the better the film will be!

Your donations will go directly towards funding and helping us to produce THE STATEMENT. 

Check out this petrifying pie chart below to see how your donations will contribute to the film. 

What mysteries and secrets do our perks and rewards hold, I hear you ask? ...None! 

We have many fantastic perks on offer and we're very transparent about what you'll receive, you won't go mad trying to decipher what amazing reward you'll be bestowed if you pledge to our campaign. 

Our perks and rewards offer you a compelling insight into the entire production process of developing, producing and finishing this upcoming cosmic horror short film.

You don't have to be a Great Old One to know that the more money you donate and pledge to our campaign, the greater the rewards will be. 

We've many marvellous rewards such as: 
> A personalised video from the Director.
> The chance to become an Executive Producer of the film.
> A video tour of the sets and locations of the film.
> A custom GIF like the ones of the crew above.

These are just some of the many stunning perks we have on offer if you donate to THE STATMENT.

Check out the perks below and a more in-depth description about what you'll receive - how enticing! 

Perk #1 - ASTRAL BELIEVER - £5.00

You may have some sense of the unfathomable knowledge that awaits you but you remain sceptical to believe with reckless abandon.

If you donate to this perk you will receive:

  • NAME IN THE CREDITS – As a token of our everlasting gratitude you will receive your name in the end credits of the film.
  • LINK TO THE FILM – You will receive a link to the short film THE STATEMENT when the entire post-production process has been finished.

Perk #2 - UNRELIABLE NARRATOR - £10.00

You are not entirely sure what to believe but you cannot help but feel drawn towards the mysterious unknown.

If you donate to this perk you will receive:

  • DESKTOP WALLPAPERS – Two downloadable wallpapers of THE STATEMENT (one with the logo and one without) you’ll be the envy of everyone in Arkham (both wallpapers are 1920 x 1080).
  • PHONE WALLPAPERS – Two downloadable phone wallpapers of THE STATEMENT (one with the logo and one without) now you can take your adoration for the film portable (both wallpapers are 1248 x 2208).
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #3 - MISKATONIC STUDENT - £15.00

You have done your research and studied into the strange, otherworldly phenomenon. You are more prepared than others but still not willing to make the necessary sacrifice.

  • POSTER DOWNLOAD – You will receive two downloadable posters of THE STATEMENT (one with the logo and one without) perfect you the walls of your sanatorium (both posters are 3508 x 4961).
  • SCREENPLAY DOWNLOAD – You will receive a PDF document containing the final draft of the screenplay for THE STATEMENT. Read and enjoy at your existential pleasure.
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #4 - CHILD OF THE COSMOS - £20.00

Your origin is unknown but you are deeply connected to the eldritch occurrences. On the outside, you appear like the others but your loyalty and faith are stronger.

  • PERSONALISED VIDEO – You will receive a short HD video of the crew of THE STATEMENT thanking you for your donations. This will be personalised and customised for every backer (one short video of 1080p quality).
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #5 - CULTIST LEADER - £25.00

Your devotion to our cause is clear, you have made the sacrifices required in order to bring our plan into creation. You will be remembered for aeons to come.

  • CUSTOM PROFILE PICTURE – Much like the GIFs found on the “Who are We?” section below, you will receive a custom profile picture of yourself being transformed into an eldritch cultist. (You will receive a GIF and two images, the first image of yourself against the background, the second image of yourself with tentacles behind you – you will need to provide a picture of yourself in order for this to be created).
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #6 - DREAMLANDS SERVANT - £35.00

Your unwavering dedication to our ideal is seen by everyone in all existence. You will be commemorated in the Dreamlands for eternity.

  • COMMENTARY TRACK – You will receive a HD download of THE STATEMENT featuring a commentary track from the Producer, Director and members of the crew.
  • ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK – You will receive a private Soundcloud link of original soundtrack composed for THE STATEMENT (all songs on the original soundtrack are audio files).
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #7 - ELDER THING - £50.00

Seen to others as ethereal and transcendental, your entire being is devoted to cause. We can see your passionate fervour as clear as the luminous stars in the obsidian sky.

  • SEE THE FILM BEFORE ANYONE ELSE – You will receive a link to the short film THE STATEMENT before anyone else. As soon as the film is finalised and completed you will receive the link a whole month before anyone else.
  • BEHIND THE SCENES PHOTOGRAPHY – You will receive a folder of downloadable images taken by our professional stills photographer of the filmmaking process of making THE STATEMENT.
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #8 - GREAT ONE - £65.00

Birthed and raised in the Dreamlands, your entire being and those around are committed and ready to bring our master plan to fruition. You have waited for this moment for millennia.

  • PERSONALISED TOUR OF THE SET – You will receive a personalised downloadable HD video of the Producer and Director giving you a tour around the set of THE STATEMENT, showcasing the filmmaking process, the cast and the crew. You can see our insanity from the comfort of your own home, how lovely. (one video of 1080p quality).
  • A BEHIND THE SCENES FILM – You will receive an exclusive downloadable HD video of the ‘Behind the Scenes’ of THE STATEMENT. Showcasing the crew throughout the pre-production, production and post-production of the short film. Including exclusive interviews with the crew and footage of the development of the short film (one video of 1080p quality).
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #9 - GREAT OLD ONES - £80.00

All bow to you. You have slumbered for generations waiting for a worthy reason to awaken. In us, you have found that reason. Rise, oh’ Great Old One. Reclaim your merited place upon the throne of humanity.

  • NECRONOMICON PDF – You will receive a PDF document of the custom-made pages inside the Necronomicon featured in the film. Within the PDF are custom-made hieroglyphs and drawings made for THE STATEMENT.
  • ONLINE Q&A WITH THE DIRECTOR – You will receive an online meeting with the Director (Callum Wilkins) to talk about the film and answer any questions you may have about the filmmaking process of THE STATEMENT.
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Perk #10 - PH’HUPADGH - £100.00

Hastur pth’glui sgn'wahl shathog hupadghog ebunma 'fhalma y-li'hee nogyar, hai 'fhalma nathrod zhvagg nilgh'ri athg, ehye k'yarnak h'aog ch' vulgtlaglnnyth ooboshu.

  • EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT – You will receive an Executive Producer credit on the film and be credited on IMDb.
  • ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.

Films and the teams working on them often run into risks and challenges, every production has them, whether it's an independent production or it's made in Hollywood. 

Creating THE STATEMENT won't be an easy process but with the amazing team we have working on the project, we're sure that we can conquer any challenge that faces us, no matter how insurmountable they are. 

However, the biggest challenge the production of THE STATEMENT faces is the current COVID-19 worldwide pandemic.

The crew are working in the safest environment possible. We are all working from home whenever possible. When we need to meet face to face we are making sure to wear masks, social distance and wash our hands regularly. 

This attention and professionalism, in regards to COVID-19, is something that the crew of HOLLOW are enforcing on set when we begin shooting the film. 

As much as we want to make the best film possible, we must place the safety of the cast and crew first.

Our Great Old Ones have blessed us with a magnificent social media presence - which you should follow. 

Please follow our social media accounts on Instagram and Twitter to stay up to date with all of the amazing work we're doing on THE STATEMENT through pre-production, production and post-production. 

Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/thestatement_cp/

Twitter - https://twitter.com/TheStatement_CP

If you are unable to donate to our crowdfunding campaign you can still support us by sharing our social media pages.

Every like, retweet and share helps to ensure that we reach our goal to make the best version of THE STATEMENT.

You can always message your friends, share our social media pages with your family and beg to the Great Old Ones to spread the awareness of THE STATEMENT throughout the cosmos. 

Thank you for looking through our Indiegogo campaign, we hope that this upcoming Psychological / Cosmic Horror film is of interest to you and you choose to donate. 

However, if you can't donate there are still plenty of ways to support our film.

Please share, retweet and spread the word of our film to everyone and anyone you know who may be interested. 

We can't wait to bring the eldritch horrors of THE STATEMENT to the world in 2021...

It is written in a flowing, circular style".Check out the 'Necronomicon' created by the Director of THE STATEMENT - Callum Wilkins.We are Colossal Productions - an independent film production company based in the North West of England.We create short, documentary and feature films that deliver compelling stories and memorable characters that stay with you forever. Filmmaking is our passion. Our incredibly talented crew have worked on many successful films such as the emotional documentary film BREAKING BREAD (2019) and the amazing murder mystery feature film - THE HANGED (Currently in Post-Production).We understand that we are launching our crowdfunding campaign and producing this film during the current COVID-19 pandemic but we need your help!Colossal Productions is an independent production company and, as such, doesn't have the financial backing and support that larger production companies do. If you love films, Horror films or Cosmic Horror and Lovecraftian Horror films - please donate and support this project. We need art to help us through these turbulent times more than ever!We NEED your help, without funding from the public this film can't be made and the more money that we can raise, the better the film will be!Your donations will go directly towards funding and helping us to produce THE STATEMENT. Check out this petrifying pie chart below to see how your donations will contribute to the film. What mysteries and secrets do our perks and rewards hold, I hear you ask? ...None! We have many fantastic perks on offer and we're very transparent about what you'll receive, you won't go mad trying to decipher what amazing reward you'll be bestowed if you pledge to our campaign. Our perks and rewards offer you a compelling insight into the entire production process of developing, producing and finishing this upcoming cosmic horror short film.You don't have to be a Great Old One to know that the more money you donate and pledge to our campaign, the greater the rewards will be. We've many marvellous rewards such as: > A personalised video from the Director.> The chance to become an Executive Producer of the film.> A video tour of the sets and locations of the film.> A custom GIF like the ones of the crew above.These are just some of the many stunning perks we have on offer if you donate to THE STATMENT.Check out the perks below and a more in-depth description about what you'll receive - how enticing! Perk #1 - ASTRAL BELIEVER - £5.00You may have some sense of the unfathomable knowledge that awaits you but you remain sceptical to believe with reckless abandon.If you donate to this perk you will receive:

NAME IN THE CREDITS – As a token of our everlasting gratitude you will receive your name in the end credits of the film.

LINK TO THE FILM – You will receive a link to the short film THE STATEMENT when the entire post-production process has been finished.
Perk #2 - UNRELIABLE NARRATOR - £10.00You are not entirely sure what to believe but you cannot help but feel drawn towards the mysterious unknown.If you donate to this perk you will receive:

DESKTOP WALLPAPERS – Two downloadable wallpapers of THE STATEMENT (one with the logo and one without) you’ll be the envy of everyone in Arkham (both wallpapers are 1920 x 1080).

PHONE WALLPAPERS – Two downloadable phone wallpapers of THE STATEMENT (one with the logo and one without) now you can take your adoration for the film portable (both wallpapers are 1248 x 2208).

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.Perk #3 - MISKATONIC STUDENT - £15.00You have done your research and studied into the strange, otherworldly phenomenon. You are more prepared than others but still not willing to make the necessary sacrifice.

POSTER DOWNLOAD – You will receive two downloadable posters of THE STATEMENT (one with the logo and one without) perfect you the walls of your sanatorium (both posters are 3508 x 4961).

SCREENPLAY DOWNLOAD – You will receive a PDF document containing the final draft of the screenplay for THE STATEMENT. Read and enjoy at your existential pleasure.

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #4 - CHILD OF THE COSMOS - £20.00Your origin is unknown but you are deeply connected to the eldritch occurrences. On the outside, you appear like the others but your loyalty and faith are stronger.

PERSONALISED VIDEO – You will receive a short HD video of the crew of THE STATEMENT thanking you for your donations. This will be personalised and customised for every backer (one short video of 1080p quality).

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #5 - CULTIST LEADER - £25.00Your devotion to our cause is clear, you have made the sacrifices required in order to bring our plan into creation. You will be remembered for aeons to come.

CUSTOM PROFILE PICTURE – Much like the GIFs found on the “Who are We?” section below, you will receive a custom profile picture of yourself being transformed into an eldritch cultist. (You will receive a GIF and two images, the first image of yourself against the background, the second image of yourself with tentacles behind you – you will need to provide a picture of yourself in order for this to be created).

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #6 - DREAMLANDS SERVANT - £35.00Your unwavering dedication to our ideal is seen by everyone in all existence. You will be commemorated in the Dreamlands for eternity.

COMMENTARY TRACK – You will receive a HD download of THE STATEMENT featuring a commentary track from the Producer, Director and members of the crew.

ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK – You will receive a private Soundcloud link of original soundtrack composed for THE STATEMENT (all songs on the original soundtrack are audio files).

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #7 - ELDER THING - £50.00Seen to others as ethereal and transcendental, your entire being is devoted to cause. We can see your passionate fervour as clear as the luminous stars in the obsidian sky.

SEE THE FILM BEFORE ANYONE ELSE – You will receive a link to the short film THE STATEMENT before anyone else. As soon as the film is finalised and completed you will receive the link a whole month before anyone else.

BEHIND THE SCENES PHOTOGRAPHY – You will receive a folder of downloadable images taken by our professional stills photographer of the filmmaking process of making THE STATEMENT.

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #8 - GREAT ONE - £65.00Birthed and raised in the Dreamlands, your entire being and those around are committed and ready to bring our master plan to fruition. You have waited for this moment for millennia.

PERSONALISED TOUR OF THE SET – You will receive a personalised downloadable HD video of the Producer and Director giving you a tour around the set of THE STATEMENT, showcasing the filmmaking process, the cast and the crew. You can see our insanity from the comfort of your own home, how lovely. (one video of 1080p quality).

A BEHIND THE SCENES FILM – You will receive an exclusive downloadable HD video of the ‘Behind the Scenes’ of THE STATEMENT. Showcasing the crew throughout the pre-production, production and post-production of the short film. Including exclusive interviews with the crew and footage of the development of the short film (one video of 1080p quality).

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #9 - GREAT OLD ONES - £80.00All bow to you. You have slumbered for generations waiting for a worthy reason to awaken. In us, you have found that reason. Rise, oh’ Great Old One. Reclaim your merited place upon the throne of humanity.

NECRONOMICON PDF – You will receive a PDF document of the custom-made pages inside the Necronomicon featured in the film. Within the PDF are custom-made hieroglyphs and drawings made for THE STATEMENT.

ONLINE Q&A WITH THE DIRECTOR – You will receive an online meeting with the Director (Callum Wilkins) to talk about the film and answer any questions you may have about the filmmaking process of THE STATEMENT.

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Perk #10 - PH’HUPADGH - £100.00Hastur pth’glui sgn'wahl shathog hupadghog ebunma 'fhalma y-li'hee nogyar, hai 'fhalma nathrod zhvagg nilgh'ri athg, ehye k'yarnak h'aog ch' vulgtlaglnnyth ooboshu.

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT – You will receive an Executive Producer credit on the film and be credited on IMDb.

ALL PREVIOUS PERK REWARDS – You'll also receive all of the rewards from the previous perk.
Films and the teams working on them often run into risks and challenges, every production has them, whether it's an independent production or it's made in Hollywood. Creating THE STATEMENT won't be an easy process but with the amazing team we have working on the project, we're sure that we can conquer any challenge that faces us, no matter how insurmountable they are. However, the biggest challenge the production of THE STATEMENT faces is the current COVID-19 worldwide pandemic.The crew are working in the safest environment possible. We are all working from home whenever possible. When we need to meet face to face we are making sure to wear masks, social distance and wash our hands regularly. This attention and professionalism, in regards to COVID-19, is something that the crew of HOLLOW are enforcing on set when we begin shooting the film. As much as we want to make the best film possible, we must place the safety of the cast and crew first.Our Great Old Ones have blessed us with a magnificent social media presence - which you should follow. Please follow our social media accounts on Instagram and Twitter to stay up to date with all of the amazing work we're doing on THE STATEMENT through pre-production, production and post-production. Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/thestatement_cp/Twitter - https://twitter.com/TheStatement_CPIf you are unable to donate to our crowdfunding campaign you can still support us by sharing our social media pages. Every like, retweet and share helps to ensure that we reach our goal to make the best version of THE STATEMENT.You can always message your friends, share our social media pages with your family and beg to the Great Old Ones to spread the awareness of THE STATEMENT throughout the cosmos. Thank you for looking through our Indiegogo campaign, we hope that this upcoming Psychological / Cosmic Horror film is of interest to you and you choose to donate. However, if you can't donate there are still plenty of ways to support our film.Please share, retweet and spread the word of our film to everyone and anyone you know who may be interested. We can't wait to bring the eldritch horrors of THE STATEMENT to the world in 2021...

story:
LOGLINE:

An employee from a closing department store, working his last day, is not ready to accept defeat in a changing retail landscape. When out of the blue, a young woman, who has been lost in the mall for 19 years appears to give him the wakeup call he truly needs to hear.

 

SYNOPSIS:

“ Sears Sketch” follows Fred, an employee, who is working his last day at a department store inside a local mall which is having a going out of business sale. Due to the changing retail landscape and the rise of online shopping, there aren’t any customers in sight. Fred is a bitter old man who hates the changing times and longs for the days when the department store was once a thriving business. Suddenly, out of the blue, a young woman named Susie, who 19 years ago got lost in the mall as a child, comes up to Fred in search of her mother.  The whole mall is empty because people are content to just shop online, including Susie herself.  Susie tries to convince Fred to move on with his life and accept the status quo, while Fred argues that people should continue the old ways of shopping instead of the new. 

 

After having a long back and forth with each other, along with Susie getting her latest package delivered to her, Fred accepts that he is from a bygone era and needs to move on with his life. Before Fred can close the store for good, a customer named Bob appears to check out the deals from the going out of business sale. Fred ignores Bob, who happens to be the last customer the store will ever have, because Fred has accepted the store’s fate.  Susie realizes that it is time for her to reunite with her mother and leave the dying mall behind her. She wishes Fred well, but before Susie will leave the mall, she wants to stop by her favorite toy store from childhood.  Now the roles are reversed as Fred must inform Susie of the true fate of her childhood toy store. Again, in these times, no physical store is safe from the convenience of online shopping.

 

 

MEET THE TEAM:

Clifton Wilson, Producer

Cliff is the Producer of this film and currently a student at Flashpoint Chicago. He also owns and runs a toy store and has a tv/film studio for filming. Cliff got into film after a long career of entrepreneur ventures ranging from grant auditor to travel agency manager. Now that he has found his passion, Cliff is hoping, with your support, to make a passion a reality starting with this movie. 

 

Elizabeth Day, Director

Liz Day is currently a student at Flashpoint Chicago, is 20 years old, and has always had a creative side.  She is currently studying to be a cinematographer, but has always wanted to dabble in directing. Liz has been working on photography and building a photography business.  She has a keen eye for detail and has worked on set, in addition to taking photos for a wedding, engagements, and graduation. Liz is currently working on Sears Sketch as director and hopes that someday she can combine both film and photography in a company. 

 

Andrei Kozhevnikov, Director of Photography

 

Andrei Kozhevnikov is in his second year at Flashpoint Chicago. His major is directing but  also has interest in doing different roles on set. He plans to garner as much experience as possible to towards his  future. This is one of the reasons why Andrei has taken on the role of Director of Photography for this particular project. You can have vision in your mind, but it's quite another thing to stand behind the camera and bring this vision to life.  This is not his first time behind the camera, so he does feel comfortable working with the equipment.  With friends, Andrei has also shot clips and media content before in Russia, then later choosing to further his knowledge in the filmmaking practice. He is now moving on to the professional level and things are becoming more challenging, yet more interesting.           

 

Xochilt Estrada, Production Designer   

  

 

Ever since Xochilt was seven years old. she has always wanted to know how to to make a film. She grew up in a household where the family and her only had one way to bond, and that was through watching films. Every Friday night the family and Xochilt would go to the nearest video store and rent out a couple movies to watch together.  She wasn’t attracted to any specific genre, but just enjoyed watching all types of films.

While watching these films she found them all fascinating to watch and always wondered if making a film would be just as fun as watching one. Xochilt also wanted to know how to make connections in the film business. After community college she came across an ad that encouraged her to attend a film school in the area. She thought there would be a lot to gain out of attending film school and really decided to make the leap even at the time she had no money, no connections, and no expertise.

That’s when she decided to attend Flashpoint Chicago, and never looked back. She is currently taking classes that are going to benefit her in the long run. It turns out making a movie takes a lot of work and time, but she has also learned that it is just as fun to make one than it is just watching one.

Since attending Flashpoint Chicago she has started watching films in a much different way now than she did before. She is always wondering what the director was thinking, why he or she decided to make a decision, or the mistakes they might of missed along the way. A

Xochilt is currently working on a film called ‘Sears Sketch” for a second production class while also maintaining a part time job at a fast food restaurant. It’s seems like the task might be a bit overwhelming, but she is excited and ready to work with her classmates on the film. She is just glad to have a team of people helping make the film come together.

story:
STORY

Thank you so much for showing interest in our project. My name is Antonio Oliveros-Nikol, I am the writer and director of Meet Natasha, a 12-minute thesis short film I produced and directed to fulfill a graduation requirement at The City College of New York.

The film tells the story of Marco Lombardi (Jarred Harper), a man hires an out of work actress (Ankah Bello) to play his fiancé during a family dinner, but his plans go awry when she decides to go off-script.  Although mainly a comedy, the short has a strong message about bigotry and the importance of being proud of who we are, regardless of what other people think.

 

WHAT WE NEED & PRODUCTION STATUS

We wrapped principal photography on the film (including re-shoots and pickups) in late March of the year, and we already have a rough cut of the film.  We were able to secure $10,000.00 through different grants and private contributions, which we fully used to fund the pre-production and production  part of the project.

What we need at this time is a little help raising approximately $3,000.00 to fund the last stage of the post-production process, which includes color correction/grading, sound editing/mixing and scoring.  Any additional funds raised will be used to submit the project  to various film festivals across the country.  No donation is too small. Even $1 will bring us closer to reaching our goal.

 

WHY THIS PROJECT IS SO IMPORTANT TO US

COVID-19 forced me and my classmates to spend our Junior and Senior years at home learning the fundamentals of film production virtually. This not only stifled our interaction with each other and the film community at large but put a huge stress on the learning processes behind creating a successful film. Meet Natasha represents a triumph under these intense circumstances. Although limited in scope, due to pandemic restrictions, this production was able to move forward and capture the spirit of the script that I had worked so hard to create over many years. Many of my classmates devoted their time and skills to make this production a success and for us,  this production represents  a culmination of the hard work that we had put in for years to receive our degrees in film. Completing this film  will guarantee that me and my fellow classmates will get recognition in another forum for  our  hard work and perseverance through such unfortunate circumstances. Your kind donation will help ensure that this film gets seen by the widest audience possible and give all those involved a chance to truly showcase our talent, and with your generous help, “Meet Natasha” will get the showcase that it truly deserves .  Thank you again for your interest.

WATCH TRAILER HERE.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you cannot make a monetary contribution at this time, sharing our campaign with  friends and family will helps us as much. Thanks for helping us get the word out

 

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13242864/
